loans.name: Azteca Group

texts.es:
El grupo  se llama azteca y se  ubica en un lugar muy bonito en donde hay muchos árboles en la que es una comunidad muy agradable , la señora quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama María luz quien es afortunadamente  casada con el señor Antonio y conquián procreo siete hijos quienes cuatro ya están casado y tres a un están a su responsabilidad.

    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de pollos por reja  y luego venderlo  destazado en la misma localidad en donde lleva trabajando hace ya unos años y le va bien.
 
    Quien  lo motivo a esta actividad  fue su familia ya que también quiere apoyar a su  esposo con los ingresos de la casa y así sacar adelante a sus hijos quienes aun dependen de su apoyo y desean darle lo más necesario.

    Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo  que solicito pueda seguir trabajando para continuar con sus horros y apoyarse con los ingreso hasta que dios le preste vida.
 
   Los dos integrantes más que solicitaron el préstamo son:   Marco Antonio quien invertirá en la compra de  frutas y  verduras  así también se integra el señor Jaime quien invertirá en la compra de marranos para engordarlo y posteriormente venderlo.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called Azteca and is located in a beautiful, wooded area in a nice community.  María Luz was the person interviewed and she is married to Antonio.  They have seven children, four of whom are married and the other three are still in their care.

She is requesting a loan to buy caged chickens for her poultry butchery business.  For several years she has been involved in this work in her home town.

Her family is responsible for getting her started since she also wanted to help her husband cover household expenses and help her children get ahead, giving them everything they need. 

What she wants most is through her small business and with the loan to be able to continue saving money and earning an income for as long as she lives.

The other two members requesting a loan are:  Marco Antonio who will buy fruits and vegetables, and Jaime who will buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single, and lives with seven family members, two of whom work.

Haydar has owned a large electric generator since 2008, leasing electric lines for his area and surroundings. He worked in this field for four years, so he has a good experience and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to purchase an engine for the generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase an engine for the generator

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 40-year-old married woman with seven children. Her husband works as a driver. 

Elsa runs a sari-sari (general) store business in Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She sells items like toothpaste, shampoo and soft drinks. Elsa also sells corn and rice to the people in her community. 

Each month, Elsa earns 6000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, corn and rice. Elsa hopes for her business to grow and to have more savings.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, corn and rice

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, 27, is single. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are clothing, food and electricity bills.

Florence has operated a taxi business for the past five years; her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other taxi operators in the area. She dreams of purchasing another car for her taxi business in the future.

With the 60,000 KES she wants to purchase bales of clothes to start a clothes-selling business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth, tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltera y vive con sus hermanos y sus papás. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar los alimentos para el engorde de los animales. Ella también tiene pensado darle unas mejoras a su local para mantenerlos en óptimas condiciones. Ella quiere poder tenerlos para esta temporada buena para la venta de cerdos que se avecina y así poder sacarle el máximo del provecho a su pequeño proyecto. Ella quiere poder lograr la venta en un muy buen precio ya si poder generar buenas ganancias para ayudarle a sus padres con las responsabilidades del hogar y poder ir generando un bienestar familiar cada día. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 18 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings. She intends to use this loan to buy feed so that she can fatten her animals. Yaneth also plans to make improvements to her facilities so that her animals remain in optimal condition. The season for selling pigs is approaching, so she wants to make the most of her small project. Yaneth plans to sell her pigs at a very good price so that she can generate good earnings to help her parents with household responsibilities and provide for the welfare of each family member.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. Yaneth has not had any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Mónica Kaituska

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi (Portoviejo), cantón conocido  por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Mónica, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y está esperando a su primer hijo. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de la localidad.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja  de tres  a cuatro días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Ella empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución y lo ha ido mejorando con los créditos que ha recibido. Lo que más vende son los perfumes ya que son muy buenos.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa en general. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y le ayudan mucho.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener a su bebé.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada credit group meets every fifteen days in the parish church of La Sequita de Montecristi (Portoviejo).  The region is known for its famous straw hats, which are highly valued both inside and outside the country.

This is the place where Mónica lives.  She is 23 years old, married, and is expecting her first child.  Her husband works at a factory in town.

Mónica is a housewife who makes a living selling clothing from a catalog along with Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women).  She works three to four days a week; she leaves her products on credit and then collects payment for them on the weekend.  She started her business with the first loan she received from the lending institution, and she has improved her business with the subsequent loans she has received.  Her best-selling items are the perfumes, since they are very good.

Mónica will use this loan to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing.  She has been with the communal bank from the beginning, and she likes it because the loans are fast and very helpful.  

Her dream is to get ahead and to have her baby.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Mchemunda

texts.en:
Mchemunda, 33, is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a vegetable-selling business, selling from door to door and from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the dry, hot season when the supply of vegetables is lower compared to demand. She dreams of establishing a green grocery store in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: San Pedro De Huatajata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN PEDRO DE HUATAJATA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Copacabana, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Gaby es la tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: compra de animales, comercio de charque, venta de cerveza, venta de pescado, venta de ganado, venta de chompas, venta de verduras.

La señora Gaby,  indica que es el primer ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su tía.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posterior a la elaboración lo venderá en la feria de su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The A.C. “San Pedro de Huatajata” will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana center.  The group is made up of 12 people and is run by a Board with Gaby as the treasurer.  The group has different types of businesses such as: buying animals, jerky sales,  beer sales, fish sales, cattle sales, sweater sales and vegetables sales.  

Gaby says that this is the first cycle that she will work with Pro Mujer and she joined the institution after having received an invitation from a “promotora” (a trained community worker).   She currently has a business of selling vegetables that she has had for years and that she learned from her aunt.

She will use the loan to increase her working capital (buying vegetables) that she will purchase in La Ceja and later sell in the village market.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family since she is single.

When we asked her what she liked about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes the financing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 59 years old and married to Ruth. They have five children.

He has been into the business of hawking  medicine and medicinal products for the last 13 years from which he earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. He is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

Simon hopes to use the loan to buy a motorbike to help him move and reach a wider customer base in his business. He plans to use the profits to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to reach more customers

loans.name: Neulita

texts.en:
Neulita is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Neulita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Neulita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Neulita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 28-year-old single lady. Wafaa is the youngest of her four brothers and sisters.

Two years ago, she started a small business buying baby diapers in large quantity at a wholesale price, packing them in smaller quantities and selling them.
.
Now Wafaa has applied for a youth loan to increase the quantity she has of baby diapers so she can make more profit and open a small store as a retail business.

loans.use: to increase the quantity she has of baby diapers.

loans.name: Amuor

texts.en:
Amuor lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 35 year old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Amuor heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase onions, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the children’s school fee.

loans.use: to purchase onions, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Ayawa Loucia

texts.fr: Veuve et mère de quatre enfants, Ayawa est une femme âgée de 46 ans résidant à Baguida. Ayawa est une couturière qui revend aussi des fruits et s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord de la route non loin de son domicile. Ayawa sollicite ce prêt pour commander spécialement les fruits tels que le carton de pommes et des paniers de bananes en vue de bien revendre puis d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en:
Ayawa is a 46-year-old widow and the mother of four children.  She lives in Baguida and works as a seamstress.  She also resells fruits and she stocks up four times per month at the market.  She resells her merchandise on the side of the street not far from her home.  

Ayawa is taking this loan to buy one box of apples and a few baskets of bananas.  Her goal is to increase her sales so that she can take care of her children's education and cover the day-to-day expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy one box of apples and three baskets of bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on stock

loans.name: Elmir

texts.en: Elmir is a young IDP from Fizuli region. He is 29 years old. He has established his business in 2002. He has a pharmaceutical shop. His business developed thanks to 4 loans from Normicro Beylagan branch. During 2003-2006 he borrowed $400, $500, $600 and $900. All loans were invested in expansion of the business. Now he needs $1100 to increase the variety of drugs he can offer his customers.

loans.use: To increase the variety of drugs available to his customers

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M. sells music videos, movies on DVD and VCD in the evenings on Tihuanaku Avenue in the city of El Alto. He also works as a taxi driver during the day. He employs two people at his market stall. His income allows him to support his 75 year-old mother and his 12 year-old son. He lives in the Villa Tunari-Rio Seco zone of the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to buy inventory, which will allow him to meet the demand for his products. Because of his good credit history, it is possible for him to take out a new loan in order to strengthen his commercial activities and thereby improve his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Samuel M., es comerciante de Videos Musicales, películas en DVD y VCD por la noches en la Av. Tihuanaku de la Ciudad de El Alto, asimismo trabaja como transportista del servicio público (TAXI) durante el día , emplea a dos personas para el puesto de venta, los ingresos que genera le permiten la manutención de su madres de 75 años y su pequeño hijo de 12 años. Vive en la Zona Villa Tunari – Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto. El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería, misma que le permitirá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que existe en su puesto de venta. Por su buen antecedente crediticio, le permite acceder a un nuevo crédito para poder fortalecer su actividad comercial y de esa forma mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sabokhat

texts.en: Sabokhat is already retired, but she cannot be at home.  She has work experience in trade, and so went to trade at the markets.  She lives with her husband in a 2-room flat separately from her children.  To purchase of her goods she goes to the neighborhood republic – Uzbekistan Kokand city, which is 50 km away.  She needs money in order to purchase more goods and justify the trip.  Her sons can lend her the money, but she does not want to burden them.  When she heard about MicroInvest, she decided to get a loan of $160.  This loan was spent for the extension of her assortment of goods.  Her business is developing still, and now she would like to receive $800 for 12 months to increase her turnover.

loans.use: To increase her turnover

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a single mother to a 7 year old son and a 6 year old daughter. They are the reason she started her own business selling shoes three years ago. She has no one to rely on or help her with her children, so she has to work very hard everyday to get ahead. Fortunately, her knack for sales and her desire to provide for her family have helped her increase the number of customers and expand her business, as this is her only source of income.

She currently needs a loan in the amount of $475, to be repaid over a six month period, to fill current orders and to buy shoes for the new season. This will allow her to provide better service and continue to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena es madre soltera de un pequeño de 7 años de edad y una niña de 6 años, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual hace tres años inició su propio negocio con la venta de zapatos, no cuenta con el apoyo de nadie para sacar adelante a sus hijos por lo que tiene que esforzarse mucho día con día. Afortunadamente su gusto por las ventas y el deseo de sacar adelante a su familia la han ayudado a incrementar su número de clientes y hacer creer su negocio, éste representa la única fuente de ingresos para su familia.

En estos momentos Elena necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que le permitirán surtir los pedidos que tiene y adquirir calzado de la nueva temporada para ofrecer un mejor servicio y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, decídete a apoyar a Elena, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justine is a 32 year-old mother of four living in Makangarawe in the city of Dar Es Salaam. For the past two years, she has owned and run a shop selling fruits and vegetables, and various food items such as maize, rice, wheat and other cereal products.

She now wants to upgrade her shop into a bigger shop in order to increase her income. She is now in need of USD 250, to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To further expand the food business

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.en:
María Magdalena is dedicated to selling fried plantains, maniocs, meat and natural juices. She is a very experienced businesswoman and has been running her business for more than five years. Her business is famous and she has a well-established clientele.

María Magdalena gets the vegetables from within the community, where there are a lot of fields; she gets the products for low prices because she buys big quantities of goods. However, she is currently short of enough products to satisfy all her customers' needs. She will invest the loan requested to get more raw materials to prepare the food. María Magdalena will also start to sell seven days a week. That way, she will be able to attend to more customers and increase her income so that she can better fend for her four children.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of raw materials to prepare food for a small business.

loans.name: Alder

texts.es:
Alder is 27 years old and is married to Liliana. They live in their own home and have a young daughter, 3 years old, who is a joy for them both. Alder is the owner of a small shop in the bus terminal where he sells CDs, mobile phone accessories, sunglasses, etc.

Since he was young, Alder has worked in the bus terminal, selling from stall to stall. He inherited the business from his father and he is accustomed to traveling to other cities and towns to offer his products. His wife also works selling womans lingerie. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise such as CDs, videos and phone accessories. With the holiday season he expects sales to increase.

Alder tiene 27 años, esta casado con Liliana y viven en una casa propio con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar, tienen una sola hija de 3 años de edad que es la felicidad de ambos.

EL es propietario de un puesto de ventas en la terminal de ómnibus con 9 años de antigüedad en el rubro, entre las cosas que vende podemos citar: cd´s de músicas, accesorios para celulares, lentes para el sol , etc. Alder desde pequeño trabajo en la terminal de ómnibus como vendedor ambulante dentro del predio, su negocio lo heredo de su padre.

Suele recorrer ciudades y colonias ofreciendo sus productos. Su esposa también trabaja, ella se dedica a las ventas de ropa interior a cuotas por las escuelas y colegios de la zona. El destino del crédito es para compra de mercaderías como ser: cd, videos, accesorios de celulares, etc. ya que se aproxima las fiestas y las ventas serán mayores.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE SUCH AS CDs,  VIDEOS AND PHONE ACCESSORIES FOR HIS SMALL SHOP IN THE BUS TERMINAL.

loans.name: Sandra Leticia

texts.es:
Sandra Leticia began selling used shoes to her neighbors and friend since her husband’s income as a furniture salesman was not sufficient to pay for the expenses of her three children, who are 14, 8 and 5 years of age. One year ago, she added the sale of new shoes from catalogs to her repertoire. Currently, the majority of her customers know Sandra’s products. As a result, Sandra needs to buy new products to sell.

Sandra is soliciting a credit of US $325 which she will repay within 5 months. With this money, Sandra will be able to buy more merchandise in order to offer her customers more variety. With your help, Sandra can move her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Sandra Leticia comenzó a vender zapatos usados entre sus vecinos y amigos, puesto que con lo que su esposo gana como vendedor de muebles. No es suficiente para pagar los gastos de sus 3 hijos de 14, 8 y 5 años. Hace 1 año que agregó la venta de calzado nuevo por catálogo entre su repertorio, actualmente la mayoría de sus clientes conocen los productos que vende Sandra, es por eso que Sandra necesita comprar nuevos productos para venderlos.

Sandra está solicitando un crédito de US $325 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Sandra podrá comprar más mercancía para poder ofrecerle variedad a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Sandra podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
My name is Safia E. U.. I have been living at Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan, for the last 25 years. I am a mother of six girls, all of whom are less than 13 years old. Five of the girls attend school, but the youngest is not of school age yet. I send my children to school because I do not want them to remain uneducated like me. My husband is the only breadwinner of the family and he works in a local factory. Because my husband’s income is small, I sell clothing to supplement his earnings. My group members are: Bushra B., who is borrowing for her family’s mobile phone store; Shugufta B., who will invest her share of loan in their breakfast stall; Nagina B., whose husband operates a milk sales shop; and Parween B., who needs to buy dates for her husband’s fruit cart. I completely trust these women and want to help them escape poverty.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Expand a clothing sales business

loans.name: Sunkari

texts.en: Sunkari is 26 years old and married with two children.  Her husband is also a small trader and both are working hard to meet family expenses.  Sunkari sells rice and beans in the street of Kabala town.  The location of the business is inappropriate. To help ease Sunkari's burden and boost her business revenue, she needs to rent a stall in the main market and increase her selection of food items for sale. To do that, she needs to increase her stock to earn income that can enable her to pay the rent and also earn a profit.  She is therefore requesting a loan of Le.800, 000.

loans.use: To rent a stall in the main market and increase her selection of food items for sale.

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en:
Anjelina is a married woman with 4 children. Anjelina owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María has two cars that are used as taxis. Her husband works as a taxi driver in one car, and the second is rented to a third person. In addition, María works selling fruit lollipops in the summer, sells cosmetics by catalog, and sells custom clothing.

The loans that she has received in the past have been used to maintain the cars or purchase spare parts or tires.

María is currently taking computer classes and wants to be a junior accountant. She plans on developing a career in that profession. Nonetheless, she would like to purchase more vehicles and have a taxi company.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

María tiene dos autos que los trabaja como taxi. Su esposo se desempeña como taxista en un carro, y el otro, lo alquila a una tercera persona. Además, ella vende chupetes de frutas en verano, ofrece cosméticos por catálogo y vende ropa a pedido.

Los préstamos que ha recibido han sido para el mantenimiento de los autos o la compra de repuestos y llantas.

Actualmente, María está estudiando computación, y quiere ser auxiliar contable, por lo que su plan a futuro es desempeñarse en su profesión. No obstante, a ella le gustaría poder comprar más vehículos y tener una empresa de taxi.

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Séanté

texts.fr:
A trained hairdresser, Mrs. Séanté Tchamssi-Wuitta was born on November 2, 1983 in Lomé. She is married to Mr. Abalo Badjake who is a construction electrician and she has 4 children. She also sells charcoal in her Agoè neighborhood. She would like to acquire a freezer for her beauty parlor so as to be equipped to sell fruit juice and iced water.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to achieve her goal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Coiffeuse de profession, madame TCHAMSSI-WUITTA Séanté est née le 2 novembre 1983 à Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur BADJAKE Abalo qui est un électricien bâtiment et à quatre enfants. Elle exerce aussi le commerce de charbon de bois dans son quartier Agoè. Elle désire acquérir un congélateur, pour équiper son salon de coiffure afin de pouvoir vendre aussi des jus de fruits et de l’eau glacée.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de réaliser son projet.

loans.use:
Purchase of a freezer

Achat d'un congelateur

loans.name: Herminia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Herminia lives in the neighbourhood of Laureles Norte where she sells pork products. She is 40 years old, her partner is a taxi driver. She has a daughter of 15 years of age who is a student, and who Herminia would like to become a professional and to get ahead in life. Herminia started her small business selling pork 7 years ago, with the difficult economic situation she hopes to have enough resourses to continue with it and, if possible, to increase her inventory. But she needs to replace the roof of her room immediately as it is in a very bad state and the rains are affecting it a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Herminia habita en el barrio Laureles Norte donde se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo. Tiene 40 años de edad, su compañero de vida es taxista y tiene una hija de 15 años de edad, estudiante y quien Herminia desea que se convierta en una profesional para que salga adelante en la vida. Herminia hace 7 años empezó el pequeño negocio de la venta de carne de cerdo, con lo difícil de la situación económica ella espera poder tener los recursos suficientes para mantenerlo y si es posible poder aumentar en inventario. Pero sus necesidades inmediatas son cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación que está en muy mal estado y las lluvias le están afectando mucho.

loans.use: To replace the roof of her room

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes is 22 years old and is married to Ernesto Villagra who is 30 yearls old. They both work making dress pants and they have a two year old son.

Mercedes learned this trade from an early age from an uncle. She has been working independently for three years with the help of her husband who is also a tailor.

Their small business also employs two family members (cousins) whom they pay for their services. Currently, she relies on her steady clientele. The work that they do is much appreciated in this area because of the quality of their products.

She needs this loan to purchase an Overlock machine which will help her meet the demands of the jobs that she has and also to generate more work in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Mercedes tiene 22 años, está casada con el Sr. Ernesto Villagra de 30 años de edad, ambos trabajan en la confección de pantalones de vestir, tienen un hijo de dos años de edad.

Desde muy temprana edad la señora aprendió el oficio de un tío. Hace 3 años trabaja en su propio local en forma independiente, con la ayuda de su marido quien también es costurero.

Emplean en la microempresa a dos familiares (primos) a quienes les paga por los servicios. Actualmente cuenta con clientela formada, en la zona es muy apreciado el trabajo que realizan por la calidad de sus productos.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de una máquina Overlock, que la ayudará a satisfacer las demandas de trabajo que posee y también generar más fuente de trabajo en su barrio.

loans.use: Purchase of an Overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Mme S. est commercante tres experimentee evoluant dans la vente de chaussures . Ces chaussures sont tres demandees dans la periode des fetes regiligieuses a la fin de ce mois.
Par consequent , elle sollicite le renforcement de son stock pour satisfaire sa demande
texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a very experienced businesswoman in the field of shoe sals. The shoes she sells are very much in demand at the period of religious holidays at the end of this month. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to reinforce her inventory so as to satisfy demand.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her working capital

loans.name: Delia Dalila

texts.es:
La señora Delia Dalila V. Fernández tiene 42 años  y es tesorera de su Banco Comunal Mujeres Valerosas II, vive en la calle Francisco de Miranda 1998 del distrito Esperanza Alta de la provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa pero no continuó estudiando debido a que se casó con Basilio Minchola León con quien tiene 2 hijas  estudiantes.
Delia vendía objetos de plástico y zapatillas, luego gracias al préstamo de Manuela Ramos pudo incrementar su negocio y empezó a vender también objetos de vidrio y ropa de diversa calidad. Su trabajo es ambulante.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas, compró juegos de platos, jarras y otros pedidos de sus clientes.
Con este crédito de 1700 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará ropa y objetos de vidrio.
Sueña con tener una tienda mayorista y cumplir los sueños de su hija que le gustaría hacer el bien a todas las personas.
texts.en:
Ms. Delia Dalila V. Fernández is 42 years old and is the treasurer of the Mujeres Valerosas II (Valiant Women) Microfinance Institute. She lives on Francisco de Miranda Street 1998, in the district of Esperanza Alta, in the Trujillo province of the La Libertad Perú department. She finished high school but was unable to continue with her studies due to the fact that she married Basilio Minchola León, with whom she has 2 school age daughters. Delia used to sell plastic goods and shoes, but then, thanks to a loan from Manuela Ramos, she was able to expand her business and started selling glass products and apparel. She works as a street vendor. With her first loan of 300.00 PEN, which were repaid in 4 monthly installments, she purchased dish sets, pitchers, and other products that customers ordered. With this 1,700.00 loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase clothing and glass products. She dreams of having a wholesale store and of helping her daughter’s dream come true, which is helping other people.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and glass products

loans.name: Blopo

texts.fr:
Madame K. Blopo est née le 13 mars 1967 à Lomé.  Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle a pour activité la vente de poissons fumés dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1997 et est bien expérimenté dans ce domaine de vente de poissons. Au cours de l’année 2000 elle a ajouté la vente de volailles (pintades) qui lui rapporte beaucoup de revenus.
Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de d’acheter 25 paniers de poissons fumés et 60 pintades afin de pouvoir satisfaire ses clients durant la période des fêtes de fin d’année et gagner de bon revenus.
texts.en:
Ms. Blopo K. was born on March 13, 1967 in Lomé. She is married and a mother of one child. Her work involves selling smoked fish in the Adidogomé district of Lomé. She started this business in 1997 and is highly experienced in the domain of fishmongering. During 2000, she included the sale of poultry (Guinea hens), and it brings in a lot of income for her. She once was a recipient of a loan, which she repaid. This second loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 25 baskets of smoked fish and 60 Guinea hens in order to satisfy her customers during the year-end holiday period and to earn a good income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy smoked fish and Guinea hens

loans.name: Friscana

texts.es: Friscana tiene 62 años, es viuda y vive con su hijo. Se dedica a los bordados de faldas que utilizan las mujeres en los días festivos,  como las fiestas patronales, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 50 años,  prácticamente desde que era niña  y ayudaba a su mamá en la elaboración de  estas faldas. Francisca se siente muy contenta por el trabajo que realiza, ya que lo hace de una manera muy efectiva, por la creatividad que pone en cada uno de sus  bordados, y esto hace que las personas acudan a solicitar sus servicios con anticipación, debido a la cantidad de pedidos que recibe por año. Pero comenta que lo más tedioso es poner los adornos a los acabados de las faldas, lo cual toma mucho tiempo. Este es su 10mo préstamo con MFP, y hasta la fecha no ha tenido problemas en sus pagos. Friscana  invertirá 1000 soles en la compra de hilos especiales que requiere para los acabados de las faldas, lo cuales son muy costosos.
texts.en:
Friscana is 62 years old, a widow and lives with her son. She works embrodering the skirts that women wear on holidays such as patron saints celebrations. She has been in this business for 50 years, practically since she was a little girl, when she started helping her mother make these skirts. Friscana is very happy with the work she does because she does it very effectively because of the creativity she puts into each one of her embroideries. Because of this come to ask for her services in advance because of the number of orders she receives every year. She says that the most tedious part of her job is embellishments on the finishing elements on the skirts because it takes her a lot of time. This is her 10th loan with MFP and to date she hasn't had any problems with her payments. Friscana will invest 1000 soles in the purchase of special needles that she needs for the embroidery, which are very costly.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase special needles for embroidery.

loans.name: Mang

texts.en: Mrs. Mang S. S. P., age 20, is married and lives with her husband and her young son in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She has began a beauty salon and hair dressing shop in 2007, and it has been extremely successful.  Each day she typically makes a profit of about $2.50, but during her busy season, the wedding months of November and December, her profit increases. Before the wedding begins, many guests that are invited will come to her shop to make up their face, hair, and polishing their skin. Lately, S. P. has applied for a loan from KIVA to purchase more hairdressing tools and other materials for her shop to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To buy more make up products to satisfy her client needs.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy es socia del banco comunal “Las brisas del río blanco” comunidad Chipana, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento de Puno; de  25 años de edad, es casada, no tiene hijo y posee estudios superior completa.
Trabaja hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio con una tienda de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería.
Con este préstamo de S/: 2000.00 nuevos soles podrá ampliar su negocio,  ella comprará sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche, y entre otros; de esta manera contribuirá ayudar con los gastos del hogar;  asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of The White River's Breezes Community Bank in Chipana, Peru. She's 25 years old and married with no children and has a high school degree. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and started her convenience store with her first loan of 300 soles, purchasing supplies. With the loan of 2,000 soles she's requesting, she plans to expand her business, purchasing sacks of rice and sugar, boxes of milk and other items. In this way she will be able to help with household expenses. She promises to repay the loan punctually in five months.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of rice and sugar, boxes of milk and other items for her convenience store

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes M. sells food supplies at Kakumdo near Abura. Agnes has received no formal education.  She is a single parent and has 4 dependants. Agnes has been selling food supplies for about 6 years now. She is responsible for paying rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used as capital to enable her to buy more food supplies to increase sales to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Her loan will be used as capital to enable her to buy more food supplies to increase sales to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en: S. Saodat lives in the J. Rasulov region of Tajikistan, is married and has four children. As is the case with many rural women, she has received some education but is especially skilled in raising and managing livestock. Saodat takes care of two cows, one bull and two rams, and has been in this business for 15 years. She sells the milk produced by her small herd in the local bazaar. Saodat wants to expand her business and has applied to Kiva for a loan to buy yarn-making equipment so that she can make and sell warm socks.

loans.use: To buy yarn-making equipment

loans.name: Gentille

texts.fr: B. Gentille est une demoiselle qui a appris le métier de la coiffure, en 2007 elle a ouvert un salon de coiffure « GOD IS GREAT » dans son quartier, quelques temps après elle y a associé le commerce de produits de beauté, elle est très dynamique et a beaucoup de clientes dont la plupart des femmes de son quartier et des quartiers voisins. Elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 30 mèches, 12 tissages perruques, divers crèmes. Avec ce qu’elle gagne de son activité elle subvient à ses charges et à celles de sa famille
texts.en:
B. Gentille is a young lady who learned the trade of hairdressing. In 2007, she opened a hair salon "GOD IS GREAT" in her area. Awhile afterwards, she included along with it commerce in beauty products. She is very energetic and has many customers, most of whom are women from her district and from neighboring districts. She's requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 30 hair extensions, 12 woven wigs, and various creams. With what she earns from her work, she supports herself and her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en: Abiodun is 30 years old and married with one child. He is a photographer. He is requesting the loan of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase a digital camera and film. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a digital camera and film

loans.name: Johanna Oswalda

texts.es: Johanna Oswalda Calderón P. tiene la edad de 34 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Johanna tiene 2 hijos y ambos estudian. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general y gaseosa. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Johanna inicio este negocio por la necesidad de salir adelante con sus hijos, por lo que decide buscar este medio de supervivencia. Los propósitos propuestos por Johanna para su negocio son de incrementar en la venta de oro laminado ya que es el más solicitado por sus clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y comprar ropa interior, oro laminado, plata y además gaseosa. El deseo de Doña Johanna es darle las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda y lograr esta oportunidad de superación.
texts.en:
Johanna Oswalda Calderón P. is 34 years old, and married. Johanna has two children and both are studying. She sells general merchandise and soft drinks; she has dedicated herself to this business for over 4 years. Johanna began this business due to her necessity to get ahead in life with her children, for which she decided to look into this means of survival. Johanna’s business objectives are to increase the sale of gold platted jewelry given that it is highly solicited by her clients. The loan is destined to serve as work capital to purchase underwear, gold plated jewelry, silver, and also soft drinks. Johanna’s wishes are to carry out the necessary improvements on her home, and to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital to purchase underwear, gold plated jewelry, silver, and also soft drinks.

loans.name: Pablo Avelardo

texts.es: Pablo Avelardo C. P. de 37 años de edad reside en Candelaria en el municipio de Cuscatlán, habita en ese lugar hace más de 12 años y vive junto a su esposa y su única hija. El posee un negocio de decoración y trabaja por contratos en diferentes departamentos del país. Pablo es una persona muy responsable, el cual se esfuerza por brindarles todo lo necesario a su familia, ya que ha pesar de poseer dicho negocio, también tiene un trabajo como auxiliar de diferentes servicios que se prestan en la unidad de salud de su lugar de residencia. Pablo solicita un préstamo, ya que desea comprar nuevas herramientas para su negocio, tales como: taladro, clavos, tornillos, pintura, escalera, entre otras herramientas la cuales son fundamentales para desempeñar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Pablo Avelardo C. P., 37, lives in Candelaria in the Cuscatlán municipality. For twelve years he has lived in this place with his wife and their only daughter. He has a decorating (construction) business, and he works for contracts in different departments of the country. Pablo is a very responsible person, and he works hard to give his family what they need. Besides having the decorating business, he also has work as an aide for different services given by the health unit in his place of residence. Pablo is asking for a loan because he wants to buy new tools for his business. He wants tools like a drill, nails, screws, paint, a ladder, and other tools that are fundamental to the doing his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction tools

location.town: Candelaria en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia E. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 50 years old. Letecia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Letecia owns & operates a fishing business harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Letecia is just starting this business.

In 2008, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Letecia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Unidos Para Progresar Group 1

texts.en:
Miguelina D. L. S. is a 29-year-old single mother of three children, ages 9, 7 and 4. With her first loan she opened her own store selling jewelry and for the past three years it has been growing. She says her store has been successful because she has a lot of young women as customers who like the style of jewelry she sells. With this loan she will buy more bracelets, necklaces and rings from the nearby town of San Pedro to sell in her store.

Miguelina has successfully completed five loan cycles and is excited at the possibility of increasing her business even more. With her past loans, Miguelina has been able to keep her children well fed and healthy. Her dream is to one day own her own house and make enough money to send her children to college. With this loan she will be one step closer to achieving her dreams.

Miguelina is the leader of the group Unidos Para Progresar 1 (Progressing Together) which takes out microloans as a group in Hato Mayor, Dominican Republic. On behalf of Miguelina and everyone in the Unidos Para Progresar group, thank you for the opportunities you proviD. to the people who need them most!

loans.use: To buy bracelets, necklaces and rings

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en: Sergei is married with two daughters. He sells shoes at Dneprovski market in Kherson city. He started this business 10 years ago. At that time, he lost his job and his family needed a stable source of income. Sergei saw the positive experience of his friends and decided to try. Sergei is the kind of person who can finish things he starts. He is disciplined and responsible. He is persistent enough to overcome barriers on the way to success. Today this business brings 7,000 UAH of income and enables Sergei to provide for his family. Sergei would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to purchase more shoes. Sergei enjoys his business and wants to develop it even further.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has owned and run a shoe vending business for the past seven years. A 29-year-old man, Joseph has requested his second loan of Ksh. 50,000 after successfully repaying a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to buy a varied stock of shoes. He hopes that this loan will help to raise his income and allow him to start importing shoes directly. One day, Joseph wants to buy a plot of land and build rental houses as well as a home in Nairobi. Joseph describes himself as hard-working and determined.




Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add  to his stock of shoes

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 47 years old and married with three children. She lives in Warri. She sells gas for cooking. Josephine has been in business for the past eight years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more gas to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more gas to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah E. is 48 years old and lives in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.  She is married to Gregorio, a merchandiser, and she works in direct selling, a tried and tested alternative source of income for most Filipinos.

Sarah enjoys her work selling cosmetics and apparel offered by prominent brand names like Sarah Lee and Personal Collection.  She has been in this business for five years now and earns close to P10,000 a month especially during peak months like Christmas season.  She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative last year.  She is applying for a P12,000 loan to purchase more items to sell.  

She works hard to help her husband pay for their basic daily needs, and she dreams of her family will soon live in their own house on their own property.

About CCT:
The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Duch

texts.en: S. is a local rice farmer. She, 29, is married with three children. All of them are going to school. As another source of family income comes from her husband works as an internal staff for a Hotel. S. is taking out a loan in order to decorate her old house.

loans.use: To decorate her old house

loans.name: God Children Group

texts.en:
'God Children' is a group of 5 borrowers led by Martha K., 44 years old, married with 5 children aged 11-25 years old. Their educational levels are 5th grade-high school graduate. Martha is a 9th grade drop-out due to lack of financial support. She and her family live in Brewer Ville, north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia .

Martha's business is baking bread. She buys baking materials like flour, sugar, butter, yeast, etc.  to bake bread to sell retail to residents of Brewer Ville. She has been running this business for 9 years and is hoping to establish a bigger bakery in the future.

Martha bakes good bread and talks to her customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. But she faces difficulties like heat from the oven and price rises of baking materials. She needs this loan in order to purchase candles, rice, Maggi cubes etc. to sell along with her bread as a means of expanding the business. 

Martha dreams of improving the living standard for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase candles, rice, Maggi cubes etc. to sell along with her bread

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a 38 year-old married father of two daughters, Lucy and Ruth. He describes himself as a stable businessman. He has run Mugunda Fabricators since 1996, providing fabrication of metal products, such as doors, windows, chairs, and tables. He also earns income from his retail shop and employs two people. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to rent a new modern workspace for his business. 

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To rent a new workspace for his business

loans.name: Memia

texts.en:
Memia S. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 39 years old. Memia is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Memia owns & operates a manufacturing business, manufacturing & selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members. Memia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Memia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. Memia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Memia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Memia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mercedes Trinidad

texts.es:
En el bello puerto marítimo de Manta en la Provincia de Manabí encontramos  el banco comunal Manuelita Sáenz, este banco está formado por mujeres emprendedoras en busca de mejores días para su familia.

Mercedes esta felizmente casada tiene dos hijos solteros, ella vive en Manta en el barrio 11 de Noviembre, su casa  es propia en  ella ha improvisado un espacio para poner su negocio de calzado, lleva cinco  años realizando este  trabajo que ama y no ha pensado en realizar otra actividad, sus ventas las realiza a sus vecinos de la  localidad  con facilidades de pago por lo que  sus clientes la visitan en casa para comprar y escoger de la gran variedad que oferta.

Para mantener surtido su negocio ella viaja a Guayaquil periódicamente,  compra a los distribuidores  para obtener mejores  ganancias, sobre todo trabaja con calzado colombiano porque son de buena calidad y es lo que sus clientes más solicitan, su hermana queda a cargo del negocio cuando ella vija a traer mas  mercadería.

Mercedes está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para realizar la compra de calzado casual y deportivo para esta época del año que es la mas importante en cuanto  a las ventas, su meta es seguir trabajando con los comerciantes mayoristas para obtener buenas ganancias  y seguir incrementando su negocio sin quedar mal con los pagos del préstamo que la Fundación Espoir le esta entregando.
texts.en:
The Manuelita Sáenz communal bank is in the beautiful port city of Manta, Manabí province. It's members are enterprising women who seek ways to improve life for their families. Mercedes is happily married and the mother of two unmarried sons. She lives in Manta's 11 de Noviembre neighborhood in her own home. She has equipped an area of her house as a shoe store. She has been in this line of work for 5 years; she loves it and has no plans to go into any other type of work. Her sales are to neighbors and she offers them comfortable payment plans so her customers visit her in her house and choose from the wide variety she offers. To keep her store stocked, she travels periodically to Guayaquil to buy from distributors so that her profits will be better. Her main product is Colombian shoes because they are of high quality and what her customers ask for. When she travels to get more merchandise, her sister stays in charge of the store. Mercedes is asking for new financing to buy casual and sport shoes for this season which is the most important where sales volume is concerned. Her goal is to continue to work with wholesalers in order to get the best profits and continue to expand her business without failing to repay the loan which Fundación Espoir is granting.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear for women, men and children for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 37 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. All her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling cereals like beans, maize, and groundnuts, etc. in the community market to her loyal customers. She says selling these products is very lucrative and with her nine years' experience, she can increase her market size. She takes delivery of stock from the farming communities. Therefore, she wants the loan to expand her inventory to enable her to make good income to support her family, especially the children’s education and her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnuts and beans

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea de 32 años es una mujer muy alegre y sincera, vive en su casa  que es propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.El restaurante de Andrea es el más concurrido de su barrio, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su restaurante para degustar los deliciosos platillos  que prepara, es una cocinera muy buena y desde muy pequeña le nació el amor por la cocina, ya que veía a su madre como cocinaba  con dedicación. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es mezclar ingredientes y obtener lo mejor, es por eso que lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todas las personas que visitan su restaurante, ya que muchas veces tiene que trabajar sola.  Para el futuro  espera mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y así tener más clientes.Es el cuarto préstamo de Andrea con  MFP,y promete ser muy puntual en el pago de cada una de  sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a más créditos, además en su banco comunal es muy participativa.Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para cocinar, ya que la demanda por su comida va  en aumento.
texts.en:
Andrea is 32 years old and is a very happy and sincere woman. She lives in her own home and what she wants most is to improve her quality of life. Her restaurant is the most popular in her neighborhood and every day her customers come to enjoy the delicious meals that she prepares. Andrea is a very good cook, who fell in love with cooking as a young girl watching her mother's devotion to cooking. What Andrea likes most about her job is mixing ingredients to get the best results, and because of this she cooks with great care. She has had her business for five years and thinks that the most difficult thing is serving all of the customers who come to her restaurant, since she often works alone. For the future, she hopes to improve the infrastructure of her business and thereby attract more customers.

This is Andrea's fourth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she promises to be on time with each of her payments, as she hopes to receive more loans in the future and her communal bank is very involved. She will invest the 2,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to purchase more ingredients, as the demand for her food is increasing.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her business

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén pertenece al banco comunal “PALCCARAQUI” de la Asociación Arariwa.  Ruben vive en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. La ciudad de Urubamba esta a una hora y media de la ciudad del Cusco.
  
Ruben tiene 49 años, es casado y tiene un hijo. Ruben y su esposa Juana se dedican a la venta de verdura, Ellos envían sus productos a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado como por ejemplo zapallo, zanahorias, asnapa, lechuga y muchos más. El socio es un padre trabajador y ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo su esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más semillas y después sembrarlas.  
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rubén belongs to the community bank PALCCARAQUI of the Arariwa Association. He lives in the Urubanba province of the Cusco region. The city of Urubamba is an hour and a half from the city of Cusco.

Rubén is 49 years old, is married, and has one child. Rubén and his wife Juana sell vegetables. They send their products to the city of Puerto Maldonado; their products include, for example, squash, carrots, aromatic herbs, lettuce, and much more. This community bank member is a hard-working father. He has already worked in this business for several years, and it has gone very well for him, thanks to all the effort that he puts into his work.

Rubén needs a loan to buy more seeds and then plant them. He is grateful for the opportunity to get a loan and he promises to make the payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more seeds and plant them

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Mr. Ren K., age 42, and his wife, Mrs. Savun Seak, age 42, live along National Road No. 1, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. One works in a garment factor, three attend school and the other one is a construction worker.

Ren has been a carpenter for ten years. His wife stays at home and does the housework. Ren is applying for his first loan of $1,000 US to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: This village bank loan includes four people who all live in Prachum Angk village in Kandal province. All the members selected Mrs. Mom S. as the village bank president. They will use the loan for different purposes. She owns a general store and her husband, Mr. Thy Hab, is a sugar cane juice seller. This family tries to work hard with their business but they can't earn enough income. Thus, in order to improve the family's living condition, Mrs. Mom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries and cane to re-sell. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are attending a local public school and one is too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and cane to re-sell.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Karla Patricia C. R., tiene 28 años es casada y su esposo es agricultor ellos tienen 2 hijos de las edades de 7 años y el menor de 3 añitos, ella se dedica desde hace 8 años a la agricultura.

Uno de los principales problemas a los que se ha enfrentado ha sido la escaces de agua de la zona, la afectaciopn de las plagas y por concecuencia las enfermedades de la tierra, ella comenzo involucrandose en las actividades agricolas gracias a su esposo que trabajo con su papa, ella solicita de este prestamo para la compra de material vegetativo e insumos fertilizantes, estos materiales le ayudaran  a sus tierras a que su producción, sea de mejor calidad, dentro de los planes a futuro esta la instalacion de un sistema de riego para tener un plan de contingencia cunado tenga problemas de escaces, espera se le ayude a mejorar us condiciones de vida y por concecuencia las de su familia.
texts.en:
La señora Karla Patricia C. R., tiene 28 años es casada y su esposo es agricultor ellos tienen 2 hijos de las edades de 7 años y el menor de 3 añitos, ella se dedica desde hace 8 años a la agricultura. Karla Patricia C. R., 28, is married; her husband is a farmer. They have two children, who are 7 and 3 years of age. She has been a farmer for 8 years. Among the problems she has faced are the lack of water in the area, the pests that attack her crops and the plant diseases that are in the soil. She began to be involved in farming thanks to her husband, who is a potato farmer. She is asking for funding to buy farm supplies like: seed and fertilizers. These supplies will help the land to be more productive and produce better quality crops. Her plans for the future include installing an irrigation system so that she can have a fall-back in place when rain is scarce. She hopes this will help to improve her living conditions and, as a result, that of her family as well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Saddy Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor Saddy Adolfo M. P., tiene la edad de 24 años es casado  y vive en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, el es agricultor y desde hace 5 años se dedica a este tipo de actividad y fue gracias al apoyo físico y económico que logro evolucionar en este rubro.

Uno de los principales problemas a los cuales se ha enfrentado esta la falta de agua potable que afecta a todo el reparto, ya que él habita en un humilde lugar que sufre de la escases del vital liquido, y que por esta razón sus tierras se encuentran enfermas, él solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas que permitan mejores condiciones a las tierras y garantice una cosecha de calidad, esto le permitirá el capital necesario para la compra de un tanque almacén de agua potable o la instalación de un sistema de riego que resguarde las cosechas.
texts.en:
24-year old Señor Saddy Adolfo M. P. is married and lives in Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla. He’s worked in agriculture for five years, and thanks to physical and financial support he’s managed to do well in this line of work. One of the main problems that he faces is the lack of potable water in the area. He lives in a simple place which suffers from a scarcity of this vital liquid. For this reason his land is poor. Saddy is asking for a loan to buy agricultural products to improve the soil so that he is guaranteed a good harvest. A loan would provide him with the necessary capital to buy a water storage tank or an irrigation system that will safeguard his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fungicides and other agricultural products

loans.name: Bagaga Baagalana Group Of Mukono

texts.en:
S. Mai is a humorous 43-year-old married woman. She is in charge of a two-year-old butchery business in Namuyenje, Mukono district. From her business she has, in a way, managed to cater for most of her family’s needs, especially her four kids’ education.

Customers who insist on paying in kind for her meat have, to a large extent, put her fledgling business out of gear. As a consequence, her profits have not gained much ground as evidenced by the minimal 70,000 shillings, she makes weekly.

The optimistic Mai says she wants to make sure she gets increased deliveries of good quality meat supplies to her butcher shop. This also means her profits will also increase. She foresees a scenario where this is going to be possible, once he can obtain this loan.

loans.use: To pay for increased meat supplies to her butcher shop

loans.name: Violy

texts.en:
Violy C. is from the village of Eatern Pob., Lopez Jaena. She is 38 years old. Violy is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Violy owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling her own caught fresh fish in the local community. Violy has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Violy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Violy is requesting a new loan of 5,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional nets for fishing. This will be the third loan taken out by Violy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the daily needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional nets for fishing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth N. is an ECD teacher and at the same time owns a hair salon business which she started in 2005 in Nambale town, Busia, Kenya to help generate enough income to support her family. She is 36 years old with five children.

Elizabeth travels as far as Bungoma once every two months to buy her stock. Like any other small-scale business person, Elizabeth has a dream to expand her business by venturing into dairy farming where she will be keeping dairy cattle and selling milk. This will ensure her financial security and she will be able to give her children a better education.

To do this, she needs a loan worth Ksh.20,000 to enable her to increase her stock.

loans.use: increase her stock

loans.name: Self Help Group

texts.en:
Shown in the photo are the members of the “Self Help” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Ya Marie K. pictured on the left. She is age 45 and was born in Makeni where she lives with her husband and five children. Her husband is a professional worker and her children are attending primary and secondary schools.

For many years now, Ya Marie has sold charcoal, toothpaste, bathing soap, etc. With her share of the loan, she will invest in her business by buying wholesale more of the above mentioned items.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, toothpaste, bathing soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr: Kadiatou N. est une femme de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge et tutrice aussi de 5 autres qui lui sont confiés par des parents et des proches. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAOBE MANDING depuis le 10 juin 2002 et a 15 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle vend sur étale des légumes et produits halieutiques au marché et fait la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois en 2002. L'objectif visé par son crédit est de satisfaire les besoins de la famille en terme de scolarité, santé et nourriture.
texts.en:
Kadiatou N. is a 49-year old woman, married and the mother of five dependent children; she also has five other children entrusted to her care by relatives. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Diaobe Manding since June 10, 2002, and obtained credit 15 times in the past. She retails vegetables and seafood products at the local market and also prepares and sells peanut sauce, a line of business she has been in since joining Banc Villageois in 2002. The reason for her loan is to help meet her family’s needs as regards schooling, healthcare and food.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening and promoting her business

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife L. is from the village of Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 26 years old and single. To make a living, Marife owns & operates a general store. Marife has been engaged in her business for 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

At present, Marife has joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marife is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This is the 1st loan taken out by Marife from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

 About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy products for resale

loans.name: Miech

texts.en: Miech S. is a 37-year-old married mother who currently lives in the best territory of Kompong Cham Province, in Cambodia Country. She is a local chef. She is always hired by neighbors to decorate or to cook meals for their wedding parties and their other ceremonies. Her husband works with her in the same field. The family includes three devoted children who are single and living at home. Miech S. would like a loan of $800 in order to purchase piglets to raise in a stall next to her house that she built a few months ago. This will provide her with extra income that she will be using to meet her family needs.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Otgonchimeg

texts.en:
Otgonchimeg D. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Hovd province, western Mongolia. All of her children attend a local middle school, while her husband operates a truck transportation business in their town. The family has been living in Hovd province for 13 years now.

Otgonchimeg operates a clothing retail business out of her own movable stand at the local market. She started her business in 2005 and has found success in her trade. She has used her earnings to support her family and purchase a car and the stand in where she sells her clothing. In the future Otgonchimeg hopes to continue her success and grow her business line. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es: La  Sra. María Auxiliadora G. N.   ella es Trabajadora del Hotel Barceló Monte limar desempeñándose como Asistente de Eventos tiene  un año de trabajar para esta empresa. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora G. N. works at the Hotel Barceló Montelimar as Events Assistant. She has been working for this business for a year. She has had two loans with CEPRODEL and has used them to purchase construction materials to improve the house where she lives. The loans have benefited her greatly since as a result she has improved her living condition and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, stone and gravel

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy O. is thirty-six years old, married, and has four children aged between fourteen years old and four years old. His business is located at the busy Kakamega town. He has been selling vegetables for the last ten years to the local people. He has managed to provide employment to one person. 

He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business as his, so customers are spoilt for choice. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy vegetables to meet customer demand. He hopes to grow his business. He sees himself diversifying to a photography business. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: purchasing vegetables for resale

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa G. is from the village of Barcolan. She is 37 years old. Teresa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresa owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport to the local community members. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities. Teresa wants her children to finish their college education; thus, she wants her business to become profitable.

In 2006, Teresa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Teresa is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Teresa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
