*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy high-quality seed and mineral fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 30 years old. She has one son and lives with her parents in La Esperanza, a part of Reque – a town to the south of the city of Chiclayo. It is a rural area in which the majority of the population raise animals in order to support themselves. Estela and her family support each other in order to maintain a clean and happy home.

Estela will use her loan to expand her small general store.  She sells items of basic needs including soap, accessories and food products such as rice, beans and corn. She has been running her business for over six months and finds that she needs access to more capital in order to realize greater discounts on her wholesale purchases. This will allow her to increase her profit margin and better provide for the family.

Estela has good references both from the community and other businesses. She is a hardworking woman who is extremely dedicated to ensuring that her son receive the best opportunities as he grows up. She is grateful for the access to credit that she has been provided and the reduced cost of the Kiva product.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise at greater discounts

loans.name: Tes

texts.en:
Tes V., 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. V. weaves Cambodian traditional silk, earning an income of USD 8.60 per day. Her husband sells cows, earning an income of USD 5 per day. 

V. has to spend USD 75 on food and USD 85 on other necessary expenses every month. V. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more silk products to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more silk products to sell

loans.name: Ruth Miguelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Ruth Miguelina; tiene 41 años de edad, y es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa y también se dedica  a la producción de café, cacao y chocolate, ella tiene un pequeño terreno de cultivo y luego lo vende en forma independiente, la socia quiere mejorar las tierras de cultivo. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Ruth Miguelina is a member of the Communal Bank “Mosoc Runa”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 41 years old, divorced, and has three children. Ruth divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling clothes. She also produces coffee, cacao, and chocolate. Ruth has a small plot of farmland and sells her crops as an independent merchant. She wants to improve her land, so she is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

Ruth is grateful for the loan she requested and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase seeds & fertilizers

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith, de 22 años, convive con Ángel, de 25 años de edad. Producto de su amor, nació Luz Clarita, de 2 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio del Palomar (selva central peruana). Está valerosa mujer, trabaja hace 2 años en la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de café, plátano y maíz híbrido; los que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo mantiene. Ya que tiene que trabajar el doble, para poder costear no solo los gastos de producción, también los de arrendamiento del terreno agrícola. Pero optimista ella, está juntando capital para poder comprar un terreno, de esa manera obtener ganancias e  intensificarse en la agricultura, pues son muchos los compradores que visitan la zona a comprar calidad de grano de café y frutos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y a pesar del corto tiempo que están trabajando con su banco comunal, se siente dichosa por el apoyo que se dan mutuamente. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado, completar el pago para la compra de un terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Judith, 22, lives with Ángel, who is 25.  They have a two-year-old daughter named Luz Clarita.  This family lives in their own house, located in the community of Sanchirio del Palomar in the central Peruvian jungle.

This brave woman has worked in agriculture for two years.  Her main crops are coffee, plantains and hybrid corn; she grows them with much work and effort.  She has to work twice as hard to be able to finance not only her production costs but also the cost of renting the field.  But she is an optimist and is getting together capital to buy a field.  In this way she will earn more and strengthen her position in agriculture, since there are many buyers who visit the area to buy quality coffee beans and fruits.

This is Judith's third loan with MFP, and despite the short time she has been working with her communal bank, she feels fortunate because of the support the members give each other.  She is thinking of using this loan to add to the capital that she saved for so long and buy a field.

loans.use: Buy farmland

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is an ambitious married man with a child, who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of educating his children so that they can have a better future and he is building a permanent house. He buys and resells shoes and the business is very profitable. Joseph requires the loan to buy shoes for selling.

loans.use: Buying shoes for resale

loans.name: Esnarda

texts.en:
As the saying goes, opportunity knocks only once. Esnarda M. knows this truth and grabs every opportunity that comes her way. Esnarda, 63, reached elementary school. She is a widow who raised her three working children. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines.

Esnarda presently runs a sari-sari (variety) store, in which she sells items that are needed daily by neighbors in her community. Products on her shelves range from soap bars to candies and energy drinks to rice. Also, she has an alkaline water-making machine with which she adds to the income of the family. Having been at least five years in business, she knows how to pay her dues on time. She also has an excellent reputation with her fellow community partners in CCT* and, most important, her customers. Monthly, she is able to earn an average of 10,000 Philippines pesos (Php).

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 44,000 loan. She intends to use this money to purchase more products for her store, all the more now that the Christmas season is fast approaching. She also plans to charge up her alkaline water business so that it will also become profitable. Esnarda plans to take this opportunity to drive her businesses toward more profitability.

Esnarda's life is never without challenges, both in her business and personal life. Nonetheless, she stays focused on the opportunities that lie ahead, and not on the failures of yesterday or the worries of today.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: Additional stock to replenish current store inventory

loans.name: Liesel

texts.en:
Liesel M. is from the village of Centro Napo Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Liesel is married and has one infant-aged children. To make a living, Liesel owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Liesel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Liesel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liesel has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Liesel is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Liesel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with four children. One of her children has graduated from school, two are still in school, and one is still too young. Mwanasha owns a house without electricity or potable water and her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For over ten years, Mwanasha has operated a cashew business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Mwanasha decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her livelihood. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase cashew nuts. In the future, Mwanasha hopes to become a reliable coconut seller.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts

loans.name: Amigos Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AMIGOS EMPRENDEDORES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana Sofia; ella tiene 43 años D. edad y es soltera y tiene 4 Hijos; La socia  tiene un negocio D. tienda D. venta D. libros, ella tiene un puesto D. venta D. libros en forma ambulatoria, ella venD. libros, cuentos y libros D. aprendizaje, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. libros.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar libros al por mayor.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta D. golosinas, venta D. productos D. belleza, venta D. libros y tienda D. abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
These people are members of the "AMIGOS EMPRENDEDORES” (Enterprising Friends) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Ana Sofia is 43 years old, single, and has 4 children.  Her business is selling books.  She has a mobile stall from which she sells books, both fiction and non-fiction.  She would like to expand and improve her book business.  She is requesting this loan so that she can buy books wholesale.

The other members of the group sell candy, beauty products, books and groceries.

Ana Sofia is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy books wholesale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria T. is 67 years old and from the town of Surallah. She is married with eight children.  Maria owns and operates a business raising agricultural crops.  The main source of income for her business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale.  Maria also raises pigs in her backyard for sale.

Maria joined Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), to access financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Maria is requesting a new 15000 PHP loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena A. is a palm oil extractor atTakoradi. She has five children. She has been in the production of oil for a decade now. Mena uses her income to feed, educate and clothe her children. The loan will be added to her initial capital to buy more palm fruits to process for sale.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Mena plans to plough back her increased capital. In this picture, on the floor is the chaff from the palm fruit. In the bowl are some palm fruits.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruits to process for sale.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Ibrahim from Waterloo. He is married with three children between the ages of 8 years and 14 years. All three of the children attend school and Ibrahim also has one relative that he takes care of.

Ibrahim runs a general merchandise shop where he sells rice, dried cassava, pepper, benni seeds, and more food stuff. He has been running this business for 15 years. He has requested a loan in order to be a supplier to other shops. The extra income from this loan will allow him to improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, dried cassava, pepper, and benni seeds.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 34 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has three children between the ages of 9 months and 18 years. All three of them live at home with her and are presently in school. 

For the past 9 years Martha has been selling vegetables, oil, rice, soap, pepper, salt, chicken stock, onions and drinks. She says she buys on credit from other businesses and sells so that she can maintain her business. Martha started this business from her susu money, a group of people saving together. She is proud of this business because has built a house from the business and is sending her children to school, and sometimes has helped other family members. 

Martha requested this loan to purchase rice, soap, oil, salt, drinks and other products for her shop. In the future Martha wants to do business internationally.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soap, oil, salt, drinks and other products

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Tep M., 43, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. M. raises pigs, earning an income of about $2 per day. Her husband raises ducks, earning an income of around $4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $20 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. M. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more ducks to raise for sale. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more ducks to raise for sale.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.ar: خالد في عمر 48 سنة متزوج وهو اب 3 اولاد يعمل منذ 20 سنة في الحدادة الافرنجية (فرفورجيه)يتميز عمله بالدقة والاسعار الجيدة والدقة في العمل والتطور وملاحقة كل ما هو جديد فهو طموح يسعى الى تأمين مصدر رزق جيد له ولأولاده وخاصة انه يعلمهم وهم مسؤوليته يريد تعليم اولاده بشكل جيد وتربيتهم ويسعى من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة حديد وتأمين سيولة للمحل اكثر ما يطمح اليه هو تقوية مصلحته وتطويرها
texts.en: Khaled is 48 years old and married with three children. He has been working as a blacksmith for 20 years. He is distinguished for his good prices, his precision in his work, and his pursuit of new developments. He is ambitious and aspires to secure a good source of income for himself and his children. He particularly wants to, and is responsible for providing them with a good education and upbringing. With this loan he wants to purchase new stock and iron he may need, and most of all he wants to support and develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase new stock and iron, and most of all to support and develop his business.

loans.name: Hambardzum

texts.en:
Hambardzum is 24 years old and he lives in Zovaber village, an area of Sevan, with his parents and his brother. 

For a while, Hambardzum worked as a builder. After that he became involved in farming. 

On his farm he has cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. Hambardzum’s family members help him in farming and so they meet their family’s needs
. 
Hambardzum intends to grow potatoes on his farm and therefore he is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan, which he will use to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel. 

This is Hambardzum’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 60-year-old married man who has worked hard painting cars for the past 35 years. He's an expert in his field, and most of his clients have been dealing with him for that long time. He is a hard working man who is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, for the first time in order to buy necessary paints and tools for his business. Ali invests his good reputation in improving his business and expanding his working zone, and he hopes to stay healthy in order to meet his customers needs.

loans.use: To buy necessary paints and tools for his business

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva, administra una tienda de productos domésticos, vive en su propia casa con sus dos hijos, la tienda la administra desde hace 5 años, ella tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio pues desde hace muchos años viene dedicándose al negocio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos domésticos, como bebidas, papel higiénico, jabón, detergentes, azúcar, sal, y otros más productos que son necesarios para la venta.
Su objetivo es aumentar el crecimiento del negocio, a través de financiamientos que le permitan lograr sus objetivos, también quiere garantizarle a sus hijos una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Eva runs a general store. She lives in her own house with her two children, and she has been running her shop for 5 years, and thanks to the years she has been working in her shop she has gained considerable experience in this activity.
The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy everyday products such as drinks, toilet paper, soap, detergents, sugar, salt and other products she needs in the shop. 
She hopes to improve the growth rate of her activity through funds that will help her achieving her goals; she also wishes to grant her children better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy drinks, toilet paper, soap, detergents, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Myassar

texts.en:
Myassar is a 30-year-old mother of 3 children, married to Jamal, an employee at the Ministry of Education. Myassar is also a hard-working mother who has a full-time job as a nurse in a clinic in their area.

Myassar has just started a small business by opening a small food store at home that she can work at after getting off her full-time job. Jamal also helps her in the store selling different kinds of spices, rice, canned vegetables, etc.

Since Myassar is just starting her business she applied for this loan to buy more food products so she will be able to serve most of the people in the area.

Myassar is from a conservative family, so she asked her husband Jamal to be in the picture.

loans.use: To add new types of food products for her food store.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has five children. She has been a baker at Elmina for 10 years. She also sells maize. Her husband is a driver. 

Ama wants to grow her maize business and so needs a loan of 400 Ghana Cedi (GHS) to buy two sacks of maize to sell. Ama plans to invest the new profits from her expanded business back into the business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of maize to sell.

loans.name: Clara Inés

texts.es:
Clara Inés de 47 años de edad vive en Sabanagrande,  un municipio localizado en la región centro oriental del Departamento del Atlántico, a 20 kilómetros de su Distrito Capital Barranquilla; allí vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de  20 y 22  años;  Clara inició su negocio de venta de jugos y empanadas,  hace 17 años cuando su esposo quedó sin trabajo y aprovechó las fiestas patronales para hacer su mejor debut; en su primer intento generó los ingresos que requería para el sostenimiento de sus familia  y así continuó agregando a su clientela informal, la de la alcaldía y otros negocios muy cercanos al sitio donde se ubica en la actualidad. 
Este es el tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materias primas e insumos en mayor volumen y poder preparar suficientes productos para atender su demanda. Con sus anteriores financiamiento logró invertirlos y posteriormente comprar un lote donde ha levantado su casa, con el fruto de su trabajo. Su meta más adelante es terminar su vivienda, adecuando un espacio para una refresquería bien dotada. Mientras esto ocurre Clara Inés continua trabajando en su negocio rotando sus cuentas por cobrar cada 13 dias y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas del 22%.
texts.en:
Clara Inés, 47, lives in Sabanagrande, a town in the central eastern part of the department of Atlántico, 20 kilometers from the capital city Barranquilla.  She lives with her husband and two children, ages 20 and 22.  Clara began selling juices and empanadas (meat pies) 17 years ago when her husband was layed off.  She took advantage of the patron saint festivities to make her debut.  On her first try she generated enough income to maintain the family and so continued adding more and more customers, including the town hall and other nearby businesses.

This is her third loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She plans to use it to buy larger volumes of ingredients and supplies so she can meet demand.  With her previous loans she was able to invest in her business and afford to buy property where she has built her house.  Her goal is to finish her house and set up a well-equipped refreshment area.  Meanwhile Clara Inés will continue working with an accounts receivable turnover of 13 days and profit on sales of 22%.

loans.use: To buy larger volumes of ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es:
José de 26 años de edad, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

José desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias con la finalidad de solventar sus gastos diarios de su casa.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más animales como aves de corral y su respectivo alimento, con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida. José es una persona trabajadora y muy empeñosa en lo que hace y lo único que quiere es que su esposa tenga algunas comodidades en casa.
texts.en:
José is 26, and lives with his wife in their own house, which only has electricity.  It is located in the rural area of Olmos district in Lambayeque department. This area is characterized by farming, livestock-raising, and handicrafts.

José has been raising and selling sheep for 4 years.  His corral is located outside his house, and is large and suitable for this purpose.  He provides them with balanced feed, and natural grazing, and when his animals attain their optimal growth he sells them in the different markets in the area. In this way,   he makes very good profits, with the goal of meeting his daily household expenses.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to buy more animals, such as poultry and their feed. With the income he gets, he can pay back his loan, and improve his quality of life.  José  is a hard-working person and very determined in what he does. All he wants is for his wife to have a few home comforts.

loans.use: To buy more animals and their feed.

loans.name: Bihidu

texts.en:
Bihidu is a married woman with eight children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over 10 years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to become a leading supplier of charcoal and firewood in the future.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes and food for the festive season of Islam’s religion. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes and food for the festive season of Islam’s religion.

loans.name: Sadaqat

texts.en:
Sadaqat is 30 years old and a cattle breeder. She works at purchasing and reselling cattle with her brother. Sadaqat is a hard-working woman who has fought to provide for her family. 

She would like to request a loan of 1,000 AZN in order to purchase additional cattle to increase her inventory and to meet customer demands. Sadaqat believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. Her current monthly profit is about 150 USD and she wishes to increase it to 400 USD. 

In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business. She will then purchase additional livestock and increase her income further.

loans.use: to purchase three calves in order to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Las Cenicientas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes indígenas que lo que mas desean es superarse y tener un mejor futuro.
Este grupo se llama las cenicientas sus integrantes decidieron ponerle así por  que se relacioncionan con el cuento de la Cenicienta que gracias a un hada cambio su vida y ellas gracias al apoyo de fundacion  van a cambiar sus vidas para bien.
La representante de este grupo es la señora Juana  tiene la tiene la edad de cuarenta años de edad, esta casada con el señor  Andrés con quien tiene  dos hijos una estudia la primaria y el otro la secundaria.
Ella estudio la primaria le gustan  mucho  las matemáticas  le ayuda a  su hijo  para  realizar sus tareas  ya  uno de sus sueños es que terminen  una licenciatura.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de: hilos, aros, agujas y listones.
Ella se dedica a la elaboración de  servilletas bordadas para la venta, le gusta mucho su trabajo por que sus  clientes le comparan por mayoreo, y cuando las personas  de su pueblo tienen  algún compromiso le compran manteles que son a lo que le ganan más.
Esta muy contenta  ya que siempre  vende su mercancía  y no ha tenido problemas con sus clientes.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Maximina- se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas.
Antelma- se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas.
Justina- se dedica a la elaboración de tamales.
Lorenza- se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas.
Celiflora- se dedica a la elaboración de manteles.
Antonia  - se dedica a la elaboración de  servilletas.
Florina- se dedica a la elaboración de manteles.
Alicia- se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas.
Aurelia – se dedica a la elaboración de manteles.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion realidad por ayudar a las personas que más lo necesitan y por confiar en ellas.
texts.en:
This group is made up of ten members who are indigenous Indians.  What they most desire is to succeed in life and have a better future.

This group is called "Las Cenicientas" ("The Cinderellas").  The members decided on this name because of the story of Cinderella, who changed her life thanks to a fairy godmother, and because they will be changing their lives for the better thanks to the support of the Foundation.

The representative from this group is Señora Juana, who is 40 years old.  She is married to Señor Andrés, with whom she has two children.  One attends primary school, and the other secondary school.

Juana studied up to primary level, and very much enjoyed mathematics.  She helps her son to do his homework as one of her dreams is for him to get a degree.

She asked for this loan for the purchase of thread, hoops, pins and ribbons.  She works making embroidered napkins for sale.  She very much enjoys her work as her customers buy in bulk, and when the people in her village have some kind of engagement, they buy tablecloths which earn her even more.

She is very content with things, as she is always able to sell her merchandise and hasn't had any problems with her customers.

The other members of the group are:

Maximina- works making tortillas.
Antelma-  works making napkins.
Justina- works making tamales.
Lorenza- works making napkins.
Celiflora- works making tablecloths.
Antonia  - works making napkins.
Florina- works making tablecloths.
Alicia- works making napkins.
Aurelia – works making tablecloths.

They give thanks to Fundacion Realidad for helping those who need it and for trusting in them.

loans.use: to sell napkins and tablecloths.

loans.name: Jimena

texts.es: La señora Jimena tiene la actividad de venta de condimentos y otros, su puesto  esta ubicado en la zona de Villa Fátima de la ciudad de La Paz, el negocio de la señora Jimena es sacrificado porque tiene que levantarse a horas muy tempranas de la mañana para realizar su venta, su esposo es chofer asalariado de un taxi el se levanta desde la mañana hasta muy tarde, la pareja es un matrimonio joven tienen un hijo de apenas un año, la pareja lucha mucho para surgir en la vida, y quieren logran un futuro mejor para sus hijos, invertirá el crédito en la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio comprando ajo, comino,  ají, caldos saborizantes, etc., La Sra. Jimena esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Jimena sells condiments and other products.  Her stand is located in the city of La Paz’s Villa Fátima zone.  Her work is very demanding because she has to rise very early in the morning to carry out her sales.   Her husband’s a salaried taxi driver.  He’s up from very early in the morning until very late at night.  They are a young married couple with a son who is barely a year old.  They struggle much to get ahead in life and they want to attain a better future for their children.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her business.  She will buy garlic, cumin, chili, flavoring for soups, etc.  Jimena is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy garlic, cumin and chili.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with three school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mejumaa has operated a vegetable stall for the past four years. In addition, she sells charcoal. Her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, there is low demand for her business. She dreams of being a vegetables and charcoal supplier.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase cabbage, potatoes, spinach and a sack of charcoal. She decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase cabbage, potatoes, spinach and a sack of charcoal.

loans.name: Hường

texts.en:
Hường is a 35-year-old woman living in a town in the Yen Phong district - Bac Ninh province.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Hường owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from raising ducks for sale.  Hường has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Hường joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hường has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,288,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  Hường is now requesting a new loan of 9,632,000 VND which will be used to purchase poultry feed & other supplies.  This will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Hường plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hường H. là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, Hường Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi vịt để bán.  Hường thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hường kiếm được khoảng 6.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, Hường đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hường đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Hường dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Mrs. Chann and her husband are in the same business, cultivating rice crops for their livelihood. Chann is 52 years old now and has got 10 children. Three of her children live independently with their new families. However hard this couple strives to work on their farm, they are able to earn only a low income of $2.00 per day to support the whole family. Because of this tough situation,  three of her daughters decided to quit studying and start work as garment factory workers like other villagers in order to help their parents.

Chann has a pond next to her house. She made it for water but this year she intends to raise some fish there for more income. Now she is taking out a loan from Kiva to use on her farming business and buy some small fish to raise. She hopes that she’ll be able to expand her fish raising business and earn a better income from it in the future.

loans.use: in her farming business and will allow her to buy some small fish to raise.

loans.name: Las Tres Estrellas Group

texts.es:
El  grupo se llama las  tres estrellas y este integrado de tres señoras quienes viven en una localidad pequeña en donde se cosecha el durazno.
 La señora quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama María Candelaria quien es casada  con el señor Juan Gabriel y con quien procreo un hijo de la edad de un año y siete meses en la que vive en una casita muy humilde.

    Ella es la  primera vez que solicita un préstamo y es para invertirlo en la compra de  cosméticos como son: cremas, desodorantes, perfumes, labiales, entre otros de la marca Avon. En esta  actividad lleva  trabajando hace  seis meses en la que comenta que le va  bien ay que con ello ha mejorado sus ingresos.

    Para inspirarse en esta actividad la  animo una  amiga quien   también se dedica a  lo mismo  y le comento que si le gustaría vender para así apoyarse un poco mas con sus ingresos  y no verse limitada  en  algunas cosas para su familia.

    Lo que más  desea es que con esta pequeña actividad y el  préstamo pueda mejorar sus a horros para así con el tiempo tener su negocio de a barrotes  para seguir trabajando  un poco más.
 
 Quienes integran en el grupo son las señoras: Timotea quien invierte el prestamo enla compra y venta de pollos de rancho y la señora Trinidad tambien  invertira el prestamo en la compra y venta de pollos de rancho.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Tres Estrellas” (The Three Stars) and it’s made up of three women who live in a small place where peaches are grown.  The woman who gave the interview is called María Candelaria and she’s married to Juan Gabriel and they have a son who is a year and seven months old; they live in a small, very humble house.

This is the first time she’s requested a loan and she’ll use it to buy cosmetics like creams, deodorants, perfume and lipstick, among others of the Avon brand.  She’s been working in this occupation for six months and she comments that she does well and has been improving her income with it.

A girlfriend of hers encouraged her to go into this activity since she does the same thing and she commented that if she’d like to sell she could help herself a bit with more income and not be so limited in things for her family.

What she most wants from this small activity and from the loan is to improve her savings so that in time she can have a grocery store to continue working a bit more.

The group members are: Timotea who will use the loan to buy ranch-bred chickens to sell and Trinidad who will also use the loan to buy ranch-bred chickens to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics..

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mrs. Phon, 29, the mother of two school-age kids, is involved in an agricultural business. Phon and her husband work together on the existing farmland. Agriculture is the sole source of their income, and they typically earn an average of $5.00 per day to satisfy their financial needs. Mrs. Phon wants to take some time to raise piglets behind her house, but she really needs some funds to invest in this project. Thus, she is looking for a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase some piglets and feed for her pig-fattening business. With the rest of the funds, she will also buy crop seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to grow her farming business well as she strives to work.

loans.use: to purchase some piglets and feed for her pig-fattening business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: La Finquita Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Finquita lo conforman Janneth, Dreydy y María Feliz tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Janneth de 42 años quien se dedica al comercio de pinolillo en Honduras. Este negocio lo inicio por medio de un familiar quien la incentivo y le dio la idea, ya que es muy apetecido el pinolillo nica.  Ella invertirá el crédito en maíz, cacao, leña…etc.
Los otros integrantes son Dreydy quien vende ropa americana y María Félix tiene una licorería.
texts.en:
The group "La Finquita" is made up of Janneth, Dreydy and Maria Feliz, three hardworking and enterprising women.  Janneth is the coordinator of the group.  She is 42 years old and works selling pinolillo (a traditional Nicaraguan corn and cocoa-based beverage) in Honduras.  She started this business through a relative who motivated her and gave her the idea, since Nicaraguan pinolillo is a very appealing beverage.  Janneth will invest this loan in corn, cocoa, firewood and other supplies.  

The other members of this group are Dreydy, who sells American clothing, and Maria Feliz, who has a liquor store.

loans.use: to buy supplies, including: corn, cocoa, firewood, cinnamon, cloves, a spice grinder, etc.

loans.name: Zubayd

texts.ru: Зубайд житель города Турсунзаде. Он женат. Ему 32 года. У него один ребенок. Он занимается выращиванием овощей для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа семян.
texts.en: Zubayd is a resident of the city Tursun-zoda. He is married and 32 years old. He has one child. He works with growing vegetables for sale. He takes a loan for the purchase of seeds.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.  Aurelia's husband is a fisherman and she also sells the fish that he catches. She has had this business for 2 years. She has  requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish for sale.
Aurelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Aurelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 37 year old married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 4 years old to 8 years old. He describes himself to be honest, courageous and focused. He operates a grocery stall where he sells fruits, cereals and vegetables such as water melons, bananas, tomatoes, onions, beans, maize, black beans, oranges, potatoes etc. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located at a strategic place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortages of vegetables, fruits and cereals to sell. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy five bags of beans. Charles' business goal is to have expanded his grocery stall and own several similar outlets within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy five bags of beans for sale

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 31-year-old married man. He has 2 children, ages 4 years and 8 years. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail store where he supplies bread and also sells spare parts of bicycles and motorcycles. He has been involved in this business for 13 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more bread and spare parts for selling. His business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more bread and spare bicycle and motorcycle parts for resale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married and has 3 children, for whom he works hard to provide all by himself.

Ali owns a small bit of land that he uses as a place to wash cars. He has been providing his family through this business since 2010 and gained good experience in this field. He has 2 hired employees and has an excellent reputation in the neighborhood.

Ali is applying for a loan of 2,400 USD in order to buy and install a big water tank and new water taps, in order to increase the water flow to his workplace and thus improve the quality of his work. He is aiming to grow his business so he may open a garage one day and increase his profits so he may provide a good income for his family.

loans.use: to buy some new assets

loans.name: Pascaline's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pascaline (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 49 ans. Pascaline n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pascaline ne vit plus avec son mari. Pascaline a un enfant, qui n'est pas scolarisé et à leur charge. Pascaline vit seule avec son enfant. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Pascaline. Pour cette raison, Pascaline vend des chaussures de façon ambulante depuis vingt cinq ans. Pascaline vend également de façon secondaire, des assiettes et du gari, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de son enfant et à son éducation. Pascaline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Pascaline sollicite ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des chaussures, des assiettes et du gari.

loans.name: María Elidé

texts.en:
Maria is married to Ruben Angel Tun. Ruben was born in Ticul, a little town distinguished because many of its people work in shoe manufacturing. Because of this, Ruben learned shoe manufacturing 30 years ago.

Maria is very enterprising and she learned the same occupation as her husband. They now both handle their small business with 20 years of experience manufacturing shoes. They have three children and their business is the only source of their family's income.

Maria is requesting a loan for $375 USD to pay back over a term of 3-6 months to supply her business with raw materials and be prepared for Christmas sales. She is planning to set up her business formally in a permanent place in the future.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

María esta casada con Rubén Ángel Tun un Yucateco originario de Ticul, un poblado que se distingue porque la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la Fabricación de calzado; oficio que Rubén conoce desde hace mas de 30 años. María es muy emprendedora, por lo que al ver trabajar a su esposo ella también aprendió el oficio y entre los dos manejan su microempresa con 20 años de antigüedad en la Fabricación de calzado. De su matrimonio María procreo a tres hijos, siendo el negocio, la única fuente de ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia.

Esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de $375 USD a 3-6 meses para poder surtirse de materias primas y estar preparada para las ventas navideñas. Tiene como proyecto a futuro poder establecer formalmente su negocio en un local fijo.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Derme

texts.en:
Derme was born in Salyan region Yenikand village. She is married and has 3 children.
Derme has run this business for 30 years. She is the sole provider for her family’s livelihood.
She grows vegetables for sale at the local market.
She plans to intensify growing of vegetables and to grow fruits. 
Now she applies for a loan of $800 to buy good quality seeds and 4 sacks of fertilizer.
The success of her business will have a positive impact on Derme’s income level.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed and 4 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita lives with her two children, Irene and Cristian, who are 15 and 16 years old. They live in the 8th of December zone of the city of La Paz (a low-income neighborhood), and she sells coffee at a kiosk in the city’s bus station. The adobe house where she lives is her own property and has three rooms. The requested loan is for the construction of a wall in front of the house and a better door, because the current door doesn’t provide any security. This is her third loan with IMPRO and her previous good credit history and demonstrated ability to repay makes it possible for her to take out this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Benita, vive con sus dos hijos Irene y Cristian de 15 y 16 años en la zona 8 de Diciembre de la ciudad de La Paz (barrio marginal) y se dedica a la venta de café en un quiosco de la terminal de buses de la ciudad. La vivienda de su propiedad tiene tres habitaciones de adobe y el crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de muro frontal y puerta principal, la misma que ahora es de calamina y no le garantiza protección alguna. Es la tercera vez que tiene crédito en Impro y los antecedentes crediticios le permiten acceder a este crédito, demostrando que pueden cumplir con el préstamo.

loans.use: Necessary improvements to her house

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en:
Six months ago Johanna was running a business where she sold clothes in her area. She took out a loan from Mifex so she could invest in more products to sell and stimulate her business. The loan Johanna received for her business had a very surprising effect. She was able to invest in new merchandise as she planned, but once she was able to save enough money she decided to venture into a new and more profitable business. Johanna now owns a small restaurant where she makes lunch and dinner. She is happy with the change in her life as she has been able to make more money.

She is now seeking a second loan so that she can invest in her restaurant. Although she has a steady client base, she wants to attract new people by improving the appearance of her business. She will invest in utensils, chairs, tables and other necessary items for a restaurant.

Johanna is raising her two daughters on her own. Her husband left to go to Spain about a year ago because he could not find work in Ecuador. She lives with her mother who helps her take care of the children when she is out working. Before her husband left he bought them a large refrigerator so they would be able to sell sodas and other soft drinks out of their home. Johanna’s mom is the one that mostly tends to this business. Johanna’s dream is to have her husband come back to help her raise their two daughters.

loans.use: Fix up her restaurant

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Married and mother of five children, Bertha C. de Layme is the owner of a grocery store located in her home, in the region of Cosmos 79 of El Alto city. She belongs to the association “Rocío de la Mañana” of Pro Mujer, being one of the newest members, with only two years in the organization. She has been devoted to this business for four years and started it thanks to the collaboration of her son, who works as a public transportation driver. Her husband’s salary as a policeman and public service person is not enough. Bertha needs the capital to enlarge her store and incorporate a bookstore and a photocopy center, since the grocery store is only enough to cover her basic needs but not to venture into another business.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Casada y madre de cinco hijos, Bertha C. de Layme es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su propio domicilio, en la zona de Cosmos 79 en la ciudad de El Alto. Pertenece a la asociación Rocío de la Mañana de Pro Mujer, siendo una de las socias más nuevas, con tan solo dos años de permanencia en la organización. Hace 4 años ella se dedica a esta actividad, que logró establecer gracias a la colaboración de su hijo, quien trabaja como chofer de transporte público. El sueldo del esposo no es suficiente, por tratarse de un policía y servidor público. Bertha precisa de capital para poder ampliar su tienda con el fin de abrir una librería y una central de fotocopias, porque a la fecha el almacén solo le alcanza para cubrir sus necesidades básicas, pero no así para incursionar en otro negocio.

loans.use: Bertha needs the capital to enlarge her store and incorporate a bookstore and a photocopy center, since the grocery store is only enough to cover her basic needs but not to venture into another business.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is single. She lives in Izyum, Ukraine and owns a retail kiosk in the central market of the town. Tatyana sells a whole variety of hair accessories. She always chooses good quality inventory for her business and doesn’t buy big amounts of different items. Her trendy hair styling accessories attract many women to her stall which keep her sales rates relatively high.

Tatyana has been in this business for 6 years. She doesn’t earn big money but she feels happy because what she makes is enough to provide for all her needs. Moreover, Tatyana enjoys having contact with people which shows in her friendly ways with customers. Tatyana believes that lending services have always helped her business to remain sustainable and growing. At one point she was about to quit and close her business in the market because she didn’t have much needed $50 to cover her business expenses. She was able to get the necessary money, however, and has been able to continue working to develop her business.

loans.use: Tatyana would like to increase the inventory for her kiosk.

loans.name: Nuna

texts.en: Nuna is 22 years old and has four children (three boys and one girl).  Only the eldest goes to school.  Her husband works with dust carts to remove rubbish from the community. For more than five years, Nuna sold women’s clothing, but she had to close the business due to illness. Now she is ready to begin her business again, because her husband's income isn't enough to cover the family's expenses. She is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase initial stock of clothing and shoes. The additional income from her business will greatly improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and shoes to supply her business

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ángela M. C. is a single businesswoman with wishes to improve her business in order to support her family by offering a stable life and above all to be able to meet her grandson’s needs.

15 years ago Mrs. M. C. began a small convenience store which over the years has grown, being able to offer a variety of products. Her initial investment was US$350 from savings.

Mrs. M. C. has worked with Ceprodel for 3 years and she feels very satisfied by the support, she has been able to grow her business, meet her customer’s needs, and improve her children’s and grandson’s future. She has a history of 16 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Ángela M. C. es una mujer Soltera, emprendedora y con deseos de progresar en su negocio para poder apoyar a su familia ofreciéndole una vida estable y sobre todo poder satisfacer las necesidades de su nieto.

Hace Quince años la Sra. M. C. inició con una pequeña pulpería la cual al paso de los años ha ido incrementando, pudiendo ofrecer variedad de productos. Su capital inicial fue de U$350.00 (dólares) de ahorros.

La Sra. M. C. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace Tres años y se siente muy satisfecha por el apoyo ofrecido, ya que de esta manera ha podido incrementar su negocio, satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela y sacar adelante a sus hijos y nieto. Ella tiene un record de Dieciséis créditos.

loans.use: Invest in products to sell.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
“Sister! Give me a loaf of bread.” “Sis! Get me an order of sticky rice.” Those are familiar sound in early morning at the breakfast stand of Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Vân, who is a 50 years old, little plump but quick, pleasant woman. That is why her stand is always crowded. She joins the TYM Fund in 1995 with a small loan to help her open the stand. Things go smoothly and she keeps taking out loan after loan at the maximum limit to expand her breakfast stand. She likes the weekly repayment plan. It’s quick, convenient and small enough. In 2000, her husband opens a steel door shop. Their monthly income is 380USD. She is applying a loan of 1200USD to replenish both her breakfast stand and his shop ready for the upcoming Tết .

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


“Chị ơi! Cho em cái bánh mì”,“Chị ơi! Cho em gói xôi”,“Chị ơi!...” Đó là những âm thanh vô cùng quen thuộc tại quán ăn sáng của gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Vân. 50 tuổi, dáng người to béo, “đậm đà” nhưng nhanh nhẹn, đôi bàn tay khéo léo làm hàng một cách điêu luyện, và đăc biệt là nụ cười lúc nào cũng thường trực trên mội. Chẳng thế mà lúc nào quán của chị cũng đông khách tấp nập ra vào. Chị Vân tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 1995, mới đầu chỉ chỉ vay để bán hàng ăn sáng. Sau thấy việc bán hàng ăn có hiệu quả, chị liên tục vay tối đa các vòng vốn tiếp theo để đầu tư cho cửa hàng rộng rãi hơn, sạch sẽ và khang trang hơn. Chị rất thích cơ chế trả hàng tuần, vừa gọn nhẹ, lại có thể tiết kiệm. Năm 2000, anh Đạm, chồng chị, bàn với chị mở cửa hàng cơ khí để phát triển thêm về kinh tế, vừa là để đỡ bỏ phí nghề sẵn có trong tay. Chị đồng ý và mở cửa hàng cơ khí chuyên cửa hoa, cửa xếp, tường rào ... Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình hiện nay là 380USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị dự định vay 1200USD để mua thêm thực phẩm bán hàng, đồng thời mua thêm sắt và tôn để kịp hàng Tết khách đã đặt trước.

loans.use: Buy food for her restaurant, buy iron, corrugated iron

loans.name: Kireka C2 A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Christine A.. She is currently in the business of mushroom selling and is requesting a loan to add capital. Christine is 33 years old and is single. She has 3 children ranging from age 3.5 to 11 and her children go to school. Each week, Christine makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. Christine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Christine is joined in her small group by Jaliya N., Sarah N., Jackline K., and Sylvia K.. Jaliya N. has a business in poultry keeping and wants to expand her business. Sarah N. is currently operating a canteen business and wants a loan to increase stock. Jackline K. operates a retail shop business and wants to purchase a fridge. Sylvia K. is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth materials.

loans.use: To boost mushroom business

loans.name: Linda

texts.es:
Linda is a dedicated and enthusiastic mother. Since childhood, she has been associated with embroidery work as it was her dear mother’s and aunt’s occupation. Now, with her husband, she has established a seamstress business in her home and offers services to whomever wishes to convert their clothing into colorful and well-liked items. In a small amount of time, thanks to her dedication and the recommendations of her closest customers, she has been able to obtain a large order. She is requesting a loan so that she may acquire a greater quantity of raw material to satisfy the demand of her large client.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Linda, es una madre de familia dedicada y muy entusiasta, desde pequeña ha estado vinculada a la labor de los bordados debido al desempeño de su querida madre y tía. Ahora en sociedad con su querido esposo han puesto en su hogar un taller de bordados que presta servicios a todo aquel que quiera convertir su vestimenta en un artículo vistoso y de muy buen gusto.Hace poco tiempo gracias a su dedicación y a las recomendaciones de sus clientes más cercanos han podido obtener un gran pedido y solicitan un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima a fin de satisfacer la demanda de su nuevo gran cliente.

loans.use: Purchase raw material in order to continue making her beautiful embroidery.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 44 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 8 years old. Dorcas is a tailor and a hair dresser. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 54-year-old Neema M., who is married and has six children between the ages of 15 and 30. She has two dependents. In 2002, Neema established her poultry business and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional chicks in bulk as well as feed and preventative medicines. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku, the Swahili word for ‘chickens.’ Raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks, feed, and antibiotics.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is a 45-year-old hard-working lady and a mother of one son. She has been in business for the past ten years. She runs  a restaurant. . She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Liberacion- Group 6

texts.en:
Nemias C. M. is a 32-yr old married mother of a 7-yr old child whom she is trying to put through school. She was able to start her business 2 years ago with the help of loans. She has a small restaurant where she cooks and sells foods such as plantains and fried fish. She is a dedicated Christian who very much enjoys Christian music as well as reading the Bible when she is not working with her business. Mrs. C. M. has dreams of seeing her business grow so that she can provide for her family and continue the education of her child.

Mrs. Nemias C. M. is a member of a 5 person group, Group 6, which is part of a larger micro-bank called Liberacion. In the picture, Mrs. C. M. is second from the left along with three members of Liberacion. Her story is just one of a list of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of micro-credit loans of Esperanza. Together, this group has united with a common vision of a better life with faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit. The concept of group lending is to have loans paid in a group to reduce the risk of a person defaulting, as others pick up where a person may lag to receive the next loan. Each of the associates in this bank has a similar business whether it is a restaraunt or salon. Thank you for your support and awareness of this issue, and it is your concern and efforts that is able to bring a difference to the lives of people such as Mrs. C. M..

loans.use: This group of people would like to improve their various businesses, such as Nemias who would like to improve her restaurant.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Mr. René Gámez is applying for a loan to make slab for a spare room. He works as a truck driver all day as his parents are in his care; they are of age and not able to work anymore. (His mother is shown in the photo as the applicant was working).

Mr. Gámez has had a loan with FVP which was punctually repaid and now he is requesting one from KIVA to build a room for his parents as their present room is very small and they need more space and comfort to make it more accessible.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. René Gámez está solicitando un préstamo para la elaboración de la losa en un cuarto que le esta haciendo falta. El trabajo de chofer de un camión de carga trabajo todo el día ya que está a su cargo sus papás que son personas mayores de edad y no pueden ya trabajar. (En la foto aparece su mama porque el solicitante se encontraba trabajando).

El ha tenido préstamo en FVP el cual pago puntualmente y esta solicitándole uno a KIVA para la elaboración de una losa en un cuarto que es para sus papás ya que la habitación que están habitando es muy chica y necesitan mas espacio y acondicionarla a una manera que sea más accesible para ellos.

loans.use: Laying of concrete slab in a room.

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Maria G. tengo 25 años de edad, estoy casada, tenemos 2 hijos, los cuales hemos luchado por salir adelante junto con mi esposo, yo vivo en la colonia Ismael Acosta que es una comunidad ubicada al noreste de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
tengo 3 años y medio de dedicarme a esta actividad, tome la decision de vender tortillas ya que es un alimento que se vende mucho en nuestro pais ya que este es acompañante en los 3 tiempos de comida, y se vende muy bien.
en estos momentos necesito un credito para poder comprar mas materia prima para fabricar mis tortillas y asi tener una mejor venta y con las ganancias que tenga poder alimentar mi familia.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Maria G.. I am 25 years old and married. We have 2 children, for whom we have fought to help get ahead in life. I live in the Ismael Acosta neighborhood, which is a community located northeast of the city of San Lorenzo. I have been working in this business for 3 and-a-half years. I decided to sell tortillas because they are a food that sells well in our country, since they accompany all three meals. At this time, I need a loan to buy more ingredients to make my tortillas so that I can sell more. With the earnings I will be able to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy salt, water, corn, corn flour, and fire wood

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen inicio su negocio hace 2 años, desesperada por los gastos familiares y para apoyar a su marido con los gastos del hogar y de sus 2 hijos de 11 y 7 años, es por eso que decidió abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes la cual ha visto crecer poco a poco a base de su esfuerzo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $200 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir mejor su negocio. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Carmen started her business 2 years ago, desperate because of household costs and to be able to support her husband with their outgoings and the costs of their kids of 11 and 7 years old. This is why she decided to open a small grocery store which she has seen grow bit by bit due to her efforts.

She needs a loan of $200, which she will repay over a period of 3 months, to buy merchandise and to stock her business. With your help she will move forward.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise/comprar maercancia

loans.name: Nelly María

texts.es:
La señora Nelly pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Solteritas, ubicado en el Jr. Andrés Avelino Cáceres Nº. 605, distrito de Manantay, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como repartidor de arena y ripios. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de plátano. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa. Por las noches vende comida típica, el cual le brinda ganancias para cumplir con su responsabilidad de pago.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará, ½ saco de arroz, ½ saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de leche, detergentes, etc.

Nelly es una mujer que lucha constantemente por la vida, es trabajadora y optimista para sus negocios.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the Banco Comunal Las Solteritas, located in Jr. Andrés Avelino Cáceres Nº. 605 in the Manantay district of the province of Coronel Portillo, departament of Ucayali. She is 38 years old, and has 3 children who depend on her. She is married, and her husband works delivering sand and gravel. With her first loan of $300 nuevo soles from Manuela Ramos, she invested in selling plantains. She has been working with the communal bank for four years.

She is currently running a general store out of her house. At night she sells local dishes, which earns her the profits she needs to pay her loans on time.

With this loan of $2000 nuevo soles (US $650), which will be repaid in five months, she will buy half a sack of rice, half a sack of sugar, two crates of milk, detergents, etc.

Nelly is a hardworking woman who struggles constantly for a better life, and is optimistic about her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food and sundry items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đỗ Thị Hà năm nay 29 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Hiện nay công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ kinh doanh quần áo. Hàng tháng chồng chị đi lấy quần áo từ hà Nội về để chị bán cho các cửa hàng bán lẻ trong địa bàn huyện. Ngoài ra gia đình chị cũng có một cửa hàng bán lẻ để phục vụ cho nhu cầu của bà con. Công việc  kinh doanh của gia đình chị đang phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn mua thêm các loại quần áo thu đông  về cung cấp cho khách hàng.
texts.en:
Ms. Đỗ Thị Hà is 29 years old. She's been participating in the TYM Fund since 2007. Currently, the main source of income for her family is a clothing business. Every month, her husband goes to Hanoi to bring back clothes for her to resell to storefronts in her district. The family also has their own storefront selling general goods to the community. The family's business is growing well and provides an income of 4,000,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND to purchase more winter clothing to meet customers' demands.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more clothes

loans.name: Uefa

texts.en: Uefa M. is a farmer that sells her harvest to numerous village people.  Due to her lack of land she has a limited amount of produce items that she can sell.  Uefa plans to use the loan to expand her faming area.

loans.use: Purchase more land

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
La señora Rosalía es socia del banco comunal “Las brisas del río blanco” comunidad Chipana, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; D.  40 años D. edad, estado civil casada, con nueve hijos y solo estudio hasta primero D. primaria.
Trabaja hace 3 años  y seis meses con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en la compra y venta D. ovejas, toro y  cerdos  para engorD..
Con este préstamo S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles para poder comprar más animales (toros, cerdos y ovejas); D. esta manera contribuirá ayudar con los gastos D. su hogar, brindado ayuda en la educación D. sus hijos, finalmente  se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a member of "Las Brisas del Río Blanco" Communal Bank in the community of Chipana located in the Pilcuyo district of the province of Collao in the state of Puno. She is 40 years old, married with nine children and has a 1st graD. education. She has worked for three years and six months with the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her first loan of 300 soles was invested in purchasing and selling sheep, a bull and pigs. With this loan of 3,000 soles she will be able to purchase more animals (bulls, pigs and sheep) and will therefore contribute to help with household expenses and give her children an education. She promises to repay the loan on time in five monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals

loans.name: Phum's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of three people. Its leader, Mrs. S., age 35, is a domestic rice trader. She usually collects rice from rice farmers in the village to stock and later on resell to gain income. She only makes a daily income of around $5 each day to help meet the family's expenses. She is married with three children; all three of whom are teenagers and under her care, whilst her husband, Sean, 54, works as a staff member for a ministry of telecommunication. S.'s investment is going well because it is a profitable investment for the family. To enlarge the business, she is asking for a loan to buy additional rice stocks to sell. 
The other two borrowers are:
S., 26, who sells groceries. She is requesting a loan to buy grocery inventory to sell.
S. M., age 46, is a widow. She currently sells soybean juice, and she needs a loan to expand her business. 
The borrowers all live in the Battambang Province of Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy additional rice stocks to sell

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha A. H., 24, is a dedicated wife and mother. She lives in Nablus city in Palestine. In order to better support her three children since her husband does not earn much in his work, Suha decided to open a small store where she can sells gifts, perfumes, and other goods.

Suha is interested in expanding her main financial source by purchasing more goods for her store. She is requesting a loan of 1000 USD. Suha thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Purchase more gifts and perfumes for her store

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina A. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to six children. Two of them have completed senior high school while the rest are still in senior high and junior high schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Georgina is a food vendor. She sells a local food called ‘apitie’. Apitie is prepared by mixing ripe plantain with maize and then baking it. She prepares the food in the house and sells in the local market square. She procures the raw materials, maize and plantain, from the local market. She has been in this business for five years and wants a loan to procure raw materials in bulk.

loans.use: To procure maize and ripe plantain.

loans.name: Olmoshon

texts.ru: Олмосхон торгует косточками от абрикосов. Она занимается этим уже давно и получает хорошую прибыль, которая идет на содержание семьи. Олмосхон 34 года, имеет 3 детей. Ее муж работает в России и каждый месяц присылает денежные переводы. Олмосхон собирается закупить оптовую партию косточек которую ей предложили недавно и поэтому подала заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Olmoshon sells apricot pits. She has been doing this for a long time and earns good profits that go toward supporting her family. Olmoshon is 34 years old and has 3 children. Her husband works in Russia and every month sends a money transfer. Olmoshon plans to purchase a wholesale quantity of pits which was offered to her recently and this is why she has applied to KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pits for resale

loans.name: Ni Made Lina Rahayu

texts.en:
Ni Made Lina Rahayu (DNR.M-0656) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Manistutu, Melaya. She is married and has an infant. To making a living, Ni Made Lina Rahayu owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ni Made Lina Rahayu has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 300,000 - 450,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Made Lina Rahayu joined DINARI, Kiva's partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ni Made Lina Rahayu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from DINARI. The previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

Ni Made Lina Rahayu is now requesting a new loan of 3,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni Made Lina Rahayu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Made Lina Rahayu - (DNR.M-0656) merupakan 29 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia balita. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Made Lina Rahayu memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Made Lina Rahayu sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Made Lina Rahayu menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 - 450,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Made Lina Rahayu bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Made Lina Rahayu meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Made Lina Rahayu berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .
