Las integrantes del grupo le dan las gracias a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad por sus préstamos, gracias por ayudarnos a realizar los sueños de nuestros negocios.
texts.en:
The Hanny communal bank is comprised of:

Dolores, who will use her loan to buy paper, pencils, notebooks, and bond paper.

Silvestra, who will buy chocolates and milk cream candy.

Erika, who will buy bras, panties, and t-shirts.

Guadalupe, who will buy bags of cosmetics and hair scruncies.

Virginia, who will buy herbs, packaging, droppers, and pomade containers in order to make syrup and pomades. 

Dolores, age 42, is married, and her husband works in the fruit gardens.  They have three children; two girls and a boy.  The girls attend the university, and the boy is in high school.  

She has a business selling stationery items.  She requested her loan to buy pencils, pens, gift bags, stuffed animals, gift boxes, and novelty items.  She started her business six years ago; her mother-in-law sold it to her.  With the sale she continued stocking it.  Her business is important because of the income she gets.

She likes attending to her customers, and she is proud when her customers tell her that they find the majority of items they are looking for.  Her business is popular for being in the market and for the good treatment she gives her customers.  She invests her earnings in the business, and she takes advantage of the income during the Día de Muertos or Christmas seasons.

Her hopes and dreams are for her children to complete their career studies.  

The members of the group thank Kiva and the Fundación Realidad for the loans.  “Thanks for helping us fulfill our dreams for out businesses.”

loans.use: to buy pencils, pens, gift bags, stuffed animals, gift boxes, and novelty items, etc.

loans.name: Metodia

texts.en:
Metodia is 62 years old and married. She runs a sari-sari store in Baclayon, Bohol. Metodia sells various items like soft drinks, chips, and coffee. Aside from the store, Metodia also provides catering and tailoring services to her community. 

Metodia requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods. She plans to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 48 years old, married, and has three adult children. She lives with her family in Murang'a, Central Kenya, where she has been practicing mixed farming and selling her produce of coffee and tea, among other horticultural products, to the local market.

Janet has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy poultry birds and expand her farming business. She is optimistic that the poultry business will grow quickly to a farm of 2,000 birds. She is glad that farming will now be her main source of income. She says the good work of Juhudi Kilimo is uplifting the living standards of her children. 

To Janet, high cost of animal food is a major challenge.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey and her husband, Sos, are rice farmers. They grow rice on their farmland in the village where they live. In addition, Srey also sells grocery items at home. She is asking for another loan again to assist in her rice farm by buying seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm. 

The couple has been married since 1991 and has five children-three sons and two daughters. Four are in school and one is still too young for school. They live in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Photo: Srey is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 45 years old, married and has six children ranging from twelve to thirty two. He describes himself as a determined man. He runs a retail store and sells items such as sugar, milk, bread, airtime, cooking fat etc. He has been in this business for the last three years. His business challenge is insufficient funds to improve the business. He will be using the KES 20,000 loan to buy more sugar and wheat flour. In the next five years, Patrick hopes and plan to run another retail store in his town area.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sarah wants to add stock of sacks of maize, beans, flour and green grams

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en: Natiq R. owns a small stand in the town of Devechi, just south of Khachmaz, located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Natiq’s store sells newspapers and general school supply/stationary items. He would like to invest in a more diversified inventory so that he can offer his current customers as well as attract new customers.

loans.use: To incresase and diversify his store's inventory.

loans.name: Ginger

texts.en:
Ginger sells clothing and bookbags door to door in the north of the city. Ginger began her business with the help of her ex-husband who loaned her $100.00 to start her business. At the start she only sold clothing for women and children. Now she continues to sell these items along with men's clothing. Ginger wishes to also sell electric domestic devices that her current customers ask for. She has faith that this new product would help her business grow. She is separated and has 2 children in school. She is 37. Ginger depends on her business to completely support her children's education. Ginger is confident that his loan will allow her to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Ginger se dedica a la venta de ropa y mochilas puerta a puerta al norte de la ciudad. Ginger empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su ex esposo quien le facilito 100 dólares para que emprendiera su negocio. Al principio solo vendía ropa para niños y damas. Ahora sigue vendiendo este producto junto con ropa de caballeros. Ginger aspira vender pequeños electrodomésticos que le solicitan sus clientes. Ella tiene fe que con este nuevo producto su negocio crecerá. Ella esta separada de su esposo tiene dos hijos que estudian. Ella tiene 37 años. Ginger depende de su negocio completamente para apoyar a la educación de sus hijos. Ginger tiene la confianza que este préstamo le permitirá ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: Invest in electronic domestic devices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify and increase her inventory

loans.name: Mulimai

texts.en:
Mulimai is a married and has two children.  She lives in the village of Siuniu and earns money from working her husband's plantation.
She joined the loan program in 2005 when she needed help to set up her plantation. She is now into paying off her third loan of $1750.00. She sells 3-4 bags of taro at Fugalei Market twice a month which earns her between $600.00 and $800.00 per month .

loans.use: To purchase chemicals & tools and equipment to upgrade her plantation

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia is 24 years old, a mother of a 2 year old boy, entrepreneurial and very home-loving. She lives with Jorge, her husband in a rented room. Jorge had to leave the city in search of a more profitable and secure job and thus be able to offer his family a better life quality. Lidia, on the other hand, decided to sell used clothes in the street from 7:00 a.m to 5:00 p.m, 6 days a week. Doña Lidia´s wish is to get a stand at the "Manco Cápac" market from which she can offer her variety of clothing to more visitors on a daily basis. To make her dream come true, Doña Lidia needs your generous support, and asks for a loan of $500 to invest in her new project. It is her plan to repay the loan in 6 months. "Let us all contribute to make Lidía´s dreams come true as soon as possible."

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Lidia tiene 24 años es madre de un niño de 2 años de edad, emprendedora y muy hogareña, actualmente vive junto a su esposo, Jorge, en una habitación alquilada, quién para ver prosperar a su familia tuvo que salir de su ciudad en busca de un trabajo más rentable y seguro y así tener la satisfacción de ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida; por su parte Lidia decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa de segundo uso, trabajo que realiza desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:30 de la tarde en forma ambulatoria durante 6 días a la semana.El deseo de Lidia es tener un puesto estable en el mercado “Manco Cápac”, lugar donde podrá ofrecer su gran variedad de prendas de vestir por la cantidad de personas que visitan este lugar diariamente; para hacer realidad sus sueños Lidia recurre a tu ayuda generosa y solicita un préstamo de 500 dólares, dinero que invertirá en su nuevo proyecto y se compromete hacer la devolución del préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses.“contribuyamos para que los sueños de Lidia puedan concretarse lo más pronto posible”

loans.use: Purchase of a stand to sell used clothing at the most popular marketplace of the region

loans.name: Francisca Juana

texts.es:
Francisca is an entrepreneurial woman who always trying to occupy herself to clear her mind and forget her worries. She views work as a distraction and keeps up vigorously everyday. She is a native of Jauja. From her youth, she has worked at various jobs. Her parents taught her that with hard work, she can succeed in whatever she does. She has translated these values to her children who currently fend for themselves. She and her husband are very content to see that their work has contributed to their children's upbringing. To support themselves, she opened a small store within their home taking advantage of an opportunity and her daughter's help. Currently, her store has grown because it is the only customer friendly one in the area. She desires to improve her store's condition and enlarge its space. Thus, she seeks your support via a loan. Help Francisca reach a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Francisca, es una mujer emprendedora que siempre a procurado estar ocupada para poder despejarse y olvidarse D. las preocupaciones; ve el trabajo como una distracción que la mantiene con vigor todos los días.Ella es natural D. jauja y desD. su juventud se ha dedicado a diversas labores, sus padres le enseñaron que sólo con el trabajo diligente se pueD. lograr el éxito en lo que se propone, y esto también lo ha transmitido a sus hijos que actualmente se pueden valer por si mismos. Ella en compañía D. su esposo se siente muy satisfecha D. haber contribuido a la formación D. sus hijos con su trabajo.Ahora para sostenerse ha aperturado en su propia casa una pequeña bodeguita ya que aprovechó la oportunidad y la ayuda D. su hija; actualmente su tienda ha crecido porque es la única que está disponible para atenderlo amablemente en su zona.Sus deseos D. mejorar las instalaciones D. su pequeño espacio D. ventas la conducen a solicitar tu ayuda a través D. un préstamo.Colabora para que Doña Francisca pueda acceder a una mejor calidad D. vida.

loans.use: To enlarge her store space to offer better service to her customers

loans.name: Juana Petrona

texts.es:
Juana Petrona M. G. is a married businesswoman with wishes to develop her business in order to support her family and offer them a stable life. She has to take care of her parents and meet their needs as they are very old and unable to take care of themselves.

10 years ago Mrs. M. G. began a small convenience store and over the years it has been growing, she has been able to offer a variety of products. Her initial investment was US $450.00 from savings.

Mrs. M. G. has worked with Ceprodel for 6 years and she feels very satisfied with the support, and because of this she has been able to grow her business, meet her customers’ needs and provide a future for her children. She has a history of 28 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Juana Petrona M. G. es una mujer casada, emprendedora con deseos de desarrollar su negocio para poder apoyar a su familia ofreciéndole una vida estable. Tiene la obligación de asistir a sus padres y satisfacer sus necesidades por el hecho de que son ancianos y no pueden cuidarse solos.

Hace Diez años la Sra. M. G. inicio con una pequeña pulpería la cual al paso de los años ha ido incrementando, pudiendo ofrecer variedad de productos. Su capital inicial fue de U$450.00 (dólares) de ahorros.

La Sra. M. G. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace Seis años y se siente muy satisfecha por el apoyo ofrecido, ya que de esta manera ha podido incrementar su negocio, satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella tiene un record de Veintiocho créditos.

loans.use: Invest in items to sell in her store

loans.name: Hait

texts.ru:
Hait M. is 69 years old, has a high school diploma and works as a security guard in the Varzob's school. He is married and has 2 children. Mr. M. supplements his salary by raising and selling cattle. He is planning to use this loan to purchase a calf for fattening and sale. He will be selling the calves after 40-45 days of feeding and use the money to purchase new animals. Mr. M. will use the profits made from his business to support his family, since the salary of a security guard is very small and is not sufficient for basic human needs. With this loan he will have a second source of income. Mr. M. is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Мухидинов Хаит, возраст – 69 лет, образование – среднее, работает сторожем в средней школе Варзобского района, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Хаит занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести 1 молодого бычка для откормки и продажи. Он планирует продавать бычков после 40-45 дней откорма, на вырученные деньги приобретать новых, а полученную прибыль использовать на содержание семьи, так как получаемая заработная плата очень маленькая и не хватает на удовлетворение своих нужд. Получив данный кредит он получит дополнительный источник дохода. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Mbalwa C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Getrude I.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine. Getrude is 33 years old and is married. Her husband is an artist. She has 2 children aged 15 and 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Getrude makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save it for her children's education. Getrude has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 800000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Getrude is joined in her small group by Grace N., Maria N., Christine N., and Justine K.. Grace N. has a business in brick laying and wants to expand the business. Maria N. is currently operating a canteen business and wants a loan to add capital stock. Christine N. operates a beauty salon business and wants to purchase more salon equipment. Justine K. is currently in the business of poultry keeping and is requesting a loan to construct another poultry house and purchase more chicks.

loans.use: To boost tailoring business

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda is a very determined woman. She is the owner of a “mototaxi”, the same she rents. In a short time, she has turned into a woman with a business vision, since she sells products to the different bordering hamlets to her city. She also sells carved wood all the different places of her area. She is a teacher elementary school. She is 34 years old and she is a mother of a son. He wants to keep her working tools in good shape and for this she wants to buy spare parts and repair them. Furthermore she wants to open a restaurant to sell the typical dishes of her region. In order to achieve this objective she needs a working capital that will make her wishes come true. You can help this hard-working mother make her dreams become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Amanda, es una muy decidida, es propietaria de un mototaxi, el mismo que alquila y en poco tiempo se ha convertido en una mujer con visiones de negocio, puesto que también lleva a vender productos de primera necesidad a los diferentes caseríos aledaños a su ciudad, también vende maderas talladas por todos los lugares de su zona. Ella es maestra de educación primaria, tiene de 34 años de edad y es madre de un hijo. Quiere tener en buen estado su herramienta de trabajo y para ello quiere comprar repuestos y repararlo, también más adelante desea instalar un restaurante donde quiere vender los platos típicos de la región, para lograr este objetivo le urge un capital el mismo que hará realidad su sueño esperado. Con tu ayuda harás realidad el propósito de esta madre trabajadora.

loans.use: Buy spare parts to improve the state of her working tools.

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en: Kwadwo B. is thirty-five years old. He sells secondhand (used) shoes in one of the busiest local markets. "I used to obtain my supplies on credit at relatively expensive cost, but the previous loan provided me with working capital to obtain cash supplies. I am very grateful," says Kwadwo. He wants to use the new loan to build a small shop to store his goods to reduce frequent thefts that disturb his business. This will also provide him with enough space to increase his stock and make additional profit. Kwadwo is single and he hopes to increase his business income to provide him with the means to get married. He belongs to a community group called Love Trust Group. The group members agree in principle as social collateral to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 46-year-old Anne S., who is married and has five children aged between 18 and 27. In 2000, Anne established her crop wholesaling business. Assisted by her husband, and working six days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $40 every month from this business. Anne has already received and repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional bulk stocks of rice. In the future, Anne plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

This client is a perfect example of why microfinance works and why the overwhelming majority of clients repay their loans. Many people who hear about microfinance (or kiva.org) for the first time ask anxiously, “How do you make sure people pay back? Won’t they just take the money?” Firstly, most MFIs have due diligence processes in place to assess client risk, as well as measures such as collateral arrangements and group lending (where a defaulted loan is borne by the group as a whole) to address this risk. More important than any of these deterrents, however, is the incentive clients have to start a business, build a business, and repay their loan so that they can get another and another and another… The incentive to have on-going access to financial services from which they had previously been excluded is a powerful one.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Djidia ( Perseverance ) Group

texts.fr:
The women of Djidia Group, between 24 and 30 years of age and all married, live in polygamous families with an average of 4 children in the village of Koumantou, Bougouni Prefecture. The members of the group made each other 's acquaintance because they are neighbors and particpate in traditional group tasks together. As they trust each other, they decided to become members of the Soro Yiriwaso loan program two years ago. Djidia Group is on its third loan with Soro Yiriwaso and the preceding loans were reimbursed correctly.

They retail various small items (cocoyams, yams, cereals, locally manufactured soap, etc.), buying their inventories at the Koumantou market. They buy wholesale from providers coming from Sikasso. With this loan, each of them intends to buy 5-10 sacks of various yams and 4 sacks of cereals. Their sales, to an essentially female clientele, are made either at the Koumantou market or out of their homes. They plan on substantially increasing their profit with this loan, but also on diversifying their supply sources.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Les femmes du groupe Djidia, agées de 24 à 30 ans et toutes mariées; vivent dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 4 enfants au village de Koumantou Préfecture de Bougouni . Les membres du groupe se sont connus en raison du voisinage et la participation commune aux activités associatives traditionnelles. Se faisant mutuellement confiance, elles décidèrent d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Le groupe Djidia est à son troisième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prets précédents ont été bien remboursés.

Elles exercent le pétit commerce d’articles divers (Ignames, patates, céreales, savon local etc) et s’approvisoinnent dans le marché de Koumantou. Elles achètent en gros auprès des forrains venant de Sikasso. Avec ce prêt elles comptent achéter chacune 5 à 10 sacs de divers tubercules, 4 sacs de céreales. Les ventes sont effectuées soit au marché de Koumantou soit à la maison à une clientèle locale feminine. Elles envisagent augmenter substantiellement leur profit avec ce prêt mais aussi diversifier leurs sources d’approvisionnement.

loans.use:
Purchase of yams, cereals, and various other articles for re-sale

Achat de Tubrecules de Céreales et de divres autres articles

loans.name: Bienestar En Dios (Well-Being In God) Groups Ii-3, I-4&5

texts.en:
Yuly R. R. lives in a Haitian batey, a housing community provided by the sugarcane companies for their poor field workers. In her little wooden house with a tin roof and cement floor, Yuly lives with her husband and two children, ages 4 and 6.

In order to contribute to the family income, especially in the sugarcane off season, Yuly has a small business selling clothing. She buys the clothing in the capital of Santo Domingo, about 2 hours away from where she lives, and sells the clothing in the touristy beach city of Bavaro, another two hours of travel in the opposite direction. When she travels for work, her mother cares for her two children.

Yuly has successfully repaid 3 loans to Esperanza International and is now requesting her fourth. With the money she hopes to continue growing her business so that she can one day afford her own house and send her children to college so that they can have professional careers.

Note: This is a group loan for 13 people.

loans.use: To be able to sell more clothing and care for her two kids.

loans.name: Fatma's Tujitahidi Group

texts.en:
Fatma is 43 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 21, 18, 15, and 12 years old. She became a food seller in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 40 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more food items such as rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables, and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with charcoal and juice sales, bites sales, cassava sales, and fish sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: El Gran Poder De Dios Group

texts.en: Maria Leonard is one of five women hoping to start a business. This collection of women is called "El Gran Poder de Dios." Maria is a hardworking mother of five who is looking to better her life through this loan. She wants to start a small business of selling chicken. Her dream is to raise enough money to put her family in a house of their own. On behalf of Maria, the group, and the all of Esperanza International----Thank you for your support!

loans.use: To buy chicken to sell

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.es: Epifanio tiene 39 años, vive con su pareja Gladis de 37 años y su hija Sintia de 15.  La familia de Epifanio se mantiene gracias a su trabajo de triciclista, actividad que viene realizando hace 10 años, pudiendo obtener su propio triciclo hace dos años, actividad en la cual viene trabajando incansablemente para mantener a su familia, en compañía de su esposa, la cual se dedica al comercio. Empieza una jornada diaria usualmente desde las 7 de la mañana, hasta las 7 u 8 de la noche para recaudar los ingresos suficientes, siendo lo más difícil, el esfuerzo físico que demanda manejar un triciclo, pero para Julián, sin esfuerzo no hay recompensa, es así que le pone mucho empeño en realizar su trabajo, gustándole mucho. Epifanio quiere que su familia no sufra incomodidades, es así que  quiere ofrecerles lo mejor, para que tengan mejores oportunidades futuras. Con el dinero solicitado arreglará algunos imperfectos de su triciclo y comprará mayor mercadería para que su esposa comercialice, y así juntar capital para poner una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
texts.en:
Epifanio is 39 years old, lives with his 37 year old wife, Gladis, and his 15 year old daughter, Sintia. Epifanio’s family is supported by his work as a cyclist, an activity that he has been doing for the past 10 years. Having obtained his own tricycle 2 years ago, he has worked tirelessly to support his family along with his wife who works in sales. He starts his daily routine around 7:00 in the morning and works until 7:00 or 8:00 at night in order to earn enough income. The most difficult part is the physical effort that his job demands, but there is no reward without effort and this is why he strives to do his job with pleasure. Epifanio does not want his family to suffer discomforts and wants to offer them the best so they have a future of better opportunities. With the requested funds, he will fix the flaws of his tricycle and will buy merchandise at wholesale for his wife to sell. With this capital, they can establish a small grocery store in their house.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix flaws of tri-cycle and purchase merchandise for his wife to sell

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna pertenece al Banco Comunal Pastaza ubicado con el Jr. 2 de Mayo Nº 196, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años de edad, es madre de un hijo mayor de edad, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el alquiler de Internet. Se dedica a la administración de su negocio, el cual le brinda ganancias para pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses lo invertirá en el arreglo y mantenimiento de sus maquinas de trabajo, las computadoras.

Reyna manifiesta que el esfuerzo de una mujer trabajadora y luchadora es valioso, por eso agradece al banco comunal por la ayuda que siempre le brinda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reyna belongs to the Pastaza Community Bank, and she lives at Jr. 2 de Mayo Nº 196 in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province in the department of Ucayalo. She is 42 years old and has one son, who is grown up and married. Reyna's husband works independently. Reyna used her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos to invest in soft drink sales. She has been working with the community bank for three years. Now Reyna runs an internet cafe. She manages the business, which earns enough for Reyna to make her loan payments in a punctual manner. With this loan of 1,000 soles Reyna will invest in the maintenance and repair of her computers. She'll repay the loan in five months. Reyna believes that the efforts of a hard-working woman are valuable, and for this she thanks the community bank for the help that it always gives her.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She'll invest it in the maintenance and repair of the computers.

loans.name: Sumaq Huaytas Group

texts.en:
The Sumaq Huaytas (“Beautiful Flowers” in Quechua) Village Bank is located in the Arizona Village of Huamanga Province in the Ayacucho Department of central Peru, about 3,200 meters above sea level and about 50 km outsiD. the city of Ayacucho. It is located on a major highway, so most of the village is involved in commerce. The zone also produces corn, potatoes, and barley, and some villagers raise livestock. 
	
Leonor and Luzmila are two members of the Sumaq Huaytas Village Bank:

Leonor, married with four children who are 17, 16, 13 and 11 years old, runs a small dry goods store, a business she launched two years ago. She plans to use her loan portion to buy more merchandise for her dry gods store as well as sheep to take to Ayacucho to sell for meat.  Her dreams for the future are that her children will graduate with professional degrees and that her business will grow. She is saving for any emergencies that might arise involving her family.  

Luzmila, married with six children between the ages of 27 and 12, buys small pigs and fattens them up to sell for a higher price. She also raises guinea pigs, a local delicacy, to sell in the city of Ayacucho. A veteran of this business, Luzmila says that when she was first starting out, her lack of experience led to some mistakes, but now she knows the business very well. With the help of loans from FINCA, she has increased her income and improved her business. 

Luzmila plans to use her portion of the loan to buy more young pigs, and dreams of her children growing up to be working professionals so that they don’t have to face the same hardships she has endured. She would also like to open up a large dry goods store. She is currently saving up to buy more commodities such as rice and sugar to sell door-to-door and to traD. for barley and wheat which she can grind up and use to fatten up her pigs.

loans.use: To buy young pigs, sheep and dry goods

loans.name: Polota Kakira Development Association Group

texts.en: Salama M., in her mid 30’s, is the chairperson of Polota Kakira development association in Kakira. She is a hard working business lady with a salon that she has owned since 2000. She has rented the same premises since then. In the salon, she does all sorts of hairstyles like braiding, weaving, retouch, treatments and plus so much more.  She uses mostly  materials and chemicals that she buys from the moving beauty product trucks.This  means that she does not have to spend money on transport. In addition to the salon, Salama also sells cold soft drinks and beers from a fridge in her salon selling to mostly her salon customers, neighbors and passers by. She sells soda, mineral water, juice and beers as another way of increasing her income. In the salon, Salama employs 3 girls who help to attend to the customers. She also has two  more girls who are learning hairstyling from her.  For each to learn, they pay about $120 for the six months course. Salama is grateful for her loans for the four years she has been in this association and this time round, she needs a loan to help her buy more weaves, braids and chemicals for her salon since most of them were used up during the festive season.

loans.use: Weaves, braids, chemicals, and cold drinks to sell in her salon.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca L. is 31 years old. She is married and has given birth to 3 children. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a suburb of Accra. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits, etc. in the local market. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supplies to expand her business. Rebecca hopes to make a good income from the expanded business to enable her to provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: To buy bulk supplies for her grocery shop

loans.name: Roeuy

texts.en:
S. is 31 years old and a resident of Battambong Province. She has four children; all of them are single and under her care. She had married to Phat, 36, who is a wedding priest. S. is a vegetable seller selling potatoes, salad, cucumbers etc. She is a responsible mother and neighbor. She has gained a lot of customers from her store because her store is located in the busy market.

S. uses her old motorbike for her business but it is broken very often. S. is applying for a loan of $500 to buy a motor to replace the old one for her and her husband. The loan will help the family have a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy a motor to replace the old one for her and her husband

loans.name: Peme

texts.en:
Peme O. is a rice grower. She is 32 years old and has 2 children. She started her business in 1991, using a 2-hectare plot that they rented from their friends. Her husband, Jerry O., is also a farmer. They work very hard to support the needs of their family. Aside from rice, Peme also grows pigs. They got themselves into hog raising because, aside from the fact that they enjoy the work, they earn a lot of money from their pigs. The income has helped the family to pay the tuition, books and other school costs of their children.

Peme is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and herbicides. She is also willing to venture into another line of business. In this way, she could support her family well. CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start their own business. They provide not only credit but also training and insurance coverage to help their small business to grow.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Macario

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Macario C. le está haciendo falta la barda al rededor de ella, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar el material que necesita. Él se dedica a la construcción y se encargara de elaborar la barda en horario adicionales a su trabajo. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para llevar a cabo la mejora lo más pronto posible, para que su familia esté segura cuando no se encuantre en su casa.  La persona que aparece en la foto es la esposa del Sr. C. y es la señora María De Jesús Puentes fue ella quien atendió la visita, ya que Don Macario le fue imposible estar presente en la fotografía pues se encontraba trabajando.
texts.en:
At the home of Mr. Macario C., the wall around the house is missing, but he does not have the necessary capital to buy the materials he needs, since he is working on building the house and will be in charge of making the wall in addition to his regular work schedule. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan to complete the improvements as soon as possible, so that his family is safe when he is not at home. The person appearing in the photo is his wife, Mrs. Maria De Jesus Puentes, who met with us since Mr. Macario was working.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Putchase of material for building the wall around his house.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: Leonarda tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años respectivamente, Leonarda junto con su esposo se dedican a la fabricación y venta de cocinas solares, esto es normalmente a pedio sin embargo por ser novedoso y práctico tiene gran aceptación en la mayoría de la gente del campo ya que sus ventas las realizan en ese medio.  No tienen mucha competencia ya que este tipo de cocinas son innovadoras y bien aceptadas por los consumidores.  Con el crédito otorgado por Agrocapital, se esta incrementando su capital de operaciones  ya que su negocio ha estado incrementando su capacidad de producción y ventas, por otra parte, Leonarda ha venido cancelando con toda normalidad y buen cumplimiento. La familia de Leonarda se identifica con la institución ya que su primer crédito fue con Agrocapital  y en la actualidad solo trabaja con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Leonarda has 2 children who are 12 and 8 respectively. Leonarda and her husband dedicate themselves to the production and sale of solar kitchens; this is usually done on order, nevertheless, for being novel and practical it has become well accepted by the majority of people living in rural areas given that their sale is carried out in this setting. They do not have a lot of competition given that these types of kitchens are innovative and well accepted by consumers. With the credit granted by Agrocapital, they are increasing their capital for operations given that their business has been growing in both production and sales, on the other hand, Leonarda has been paying back her first loan regularly and fulfilling her commitment well. Leonarda’s family identifies with this institution given that their first loan was with Agrocapital and currently she only works with this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.ru: Эшбоев Абдумачид-мужчина 48 лет. Женат отец 2-х детей. Занимается откормом и перепродажей скота. Абдумачиду помогает его жена и дети. Абдумачид имеет 20 летный стаж работы и у него большой опыт. Жена Абдумачида занимается переработкой молока. Абдумачид хочет на полученный займ купить два средних бычка также купить корм для них. Абдумачид продает свой скот мясникам на рынке Кансая.
texts.en:
Abdumajid E. is a 48 year old man. He is married and has 2 children. He fattens and resells livestock. Abdumajid’s wife and children help him. Abdumajid has been working for 20 years and has a lot of experience. Abdumajid’s wife processes milk. Abdumajid would like to use his loan to purchase two medium bulls and also to purchase feed for them. Abdumajid sells his livestock to butchers at the market in Kansaya.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten and sell livestock

loans.name: Alda Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora Alda M. tiene 51 años de edad, vive en Laureles Sur
En la capital de Managua, tiene tres hijos su compañero le ayuda económicamente.Los planes es tener un patrimonio seguro en donde exista la protección que seria la terminación de su casa.Se desempeña trabajando en su profesión de modista, tiene 10 años de experiencia.  Iniciando desde muy joven y con sus fondos propios en la compra de la maquina de coser y las primeras telas para elaborar vestidos y venderlos.Unos de los proyectos que tiene es montar su propio taller en donde también parta clase de costura.Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra construir una pared y entechar un cuarto para brindar seguridad a sus seres queridos, este es su noveno ciclo en la institución y se ha beneficiado para hacer mejoras a su casa, a si como en su negocio. Su meta es lograr tener una casa digna.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer una pared

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen, a 45-year-old married mother of six children, sells provisions such as beverages, bathing soap, noodles, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. Queen says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Tuon

texts.en: Tuon Y. is 32 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is married with one young child who is enrolled in school, while her husband works as a security guard in the Angkor Wat Temple. Tuon Y. is currently a teller for a company and gets a set salary to better meet her family’s daily foods needs. She will be using this loan to add to her savings to purchase tools for a carpenter to build them a new house. This new home will make her family’s living conditions more comfortable.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Rice farming is the business of Fe S.'s family. When Fe married her husband Jurlito S., she learned the whole process of farming. Fe is now 31 years old and has four children, and she wants to achieve something in her business so that she can help send her kids to college.

Fe is seeking a loan to buy all of the fertilizers and herbicides needed for her farm, so that she can improve the likelihood of an abundant harvest.

Fe is happy to be with the CEVI program. Through CEVI, she has easy access to loans whenever needed and to business training and insurance coverage for herself and her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Yolanda Orfelinda

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 92661&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Yolanda es socia del Bancomunal  Unidas Triunfaremos.
Yolanda tiene su  picantería, ella ha  empezado a vender por las noches salchi-papas y anticuchos los fines de semana  por que la gente le esta pidiendo. 
Los préstamos que Finca da son  un respaldo para el negocio
Yolanda necesita un crédito  de 3000 soles, para invertirlos en cerveza, gaseosa, pescado y mariscos. 
El sueño de Yolanda es seguir trabajando, ella siente que ha logrado todo lo que anhelo en la vida y ahora quiere ver surgir  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Unidas Triumfaremos Community Bank. Yolanda has her “picanteria” (a restaurant specializing in Ecuadorian soup). She has started to sell “salchipapas” (fast food made from fried sausages and fried potatoes) and kebobs on the weekends because people were asking for them. The loans that Finca gives are a support for the business. Yolanda needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy beer, soft drinks, fish, and shellfish. Yolanda’s dream is to keep working. She feels that she has achieved all that she has longed to do in life. Now she wants to see her children excel.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer, soft drinks, fish, and shellfish

loans.name: Julgen

texts.en:
Julgen Z. is from the village of Balintawak. She is 28 years old, married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Julgen runs a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income from the business is from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Julgen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Julgen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julgen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which she will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Julgen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Adedoyin

texts.en:
Adedoyin sells foodstuffs and provisions in her shop and has been in this business for five years. She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.

Adedoyin is 45 years old and married with seven children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann L. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Ann owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
El señor José Manuel O. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual el pudo ayudar a su papá con el tratamiento que necesita ya esta mucho mejor y se esta tratando su enfermedad.
Nuevamente esta solicitando un préstamo y este será para darle mas seguridad a su familia ya que le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor de la casa y por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora. 
Es por eso que solicita nuevamente su cooperación para este préstamo y así su familia va estar mas segura cundo el este trabajando.
La persona que aparece en la foto es su hijo el mayor ya que cuando fuimos a realizar la visita el señor José Manuel y sus esposa la señora Laura Navarro no se encontraban en la casa, fueron  por lo otros niños a la escuela es por eso quien nos atendió fue su hijo.

loans.use: Elaboración de la barda alrededor de la casa

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr: E. Yolande est née le 03/08/1964 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Yolande est mariée à GONDJOU Cyrille. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis onze ans à Sègbèya à Cotonou. C'est le mari de Yolande qui assure les charges de la famille. Ainsi, Yolande utilise les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. En effet, Yolande vend des tissus, des chaussures et des bols en série. Yolande vend ses produits dans ses boutiques à son domicile et à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. C'est à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin que Yolande achète ses produits. Yolande est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Yolande a eu déjà trois crédits de ALIDé pour le compte de son activité. Pendant cette période de fêtes de fin d'année, Yolande veut renforcer son fonds de roulement pour répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi Yolande sollicite ce quatrième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
E. Yolande was born on August 3, 1964 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to GONDJOU Cyrille. The couple has two children who are both in school. The family has been living in Sègbèya in Cotonou for eleven years. Yolande’s husband is the one who ensures that family expenses are covered. Thus, Yolande uses her revenues to develop her business further. Basically, Yolande sells cloth, shoes, and nested bowls. She does so in her shops located in her home and in Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country neighboring Benin, is where she purchases her goods. Yolande is a former ALIDé client who indeed repays her loans. She has already had three ALIDé loans for her business account. During this year-end holiday season, she wants to bolster her working capital for responding to customer demands. This is why she’s requesting this fourth ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, shoes, and bowls

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.es:
El socio Cayetano, pertenece al banco “ALLIN MUJU”; este banco se encuentra en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Huanchac.

Nuestra socio tiene 65 años de edad, el es viudo y tiene 4 hijos, nuestro socio alterna sus actividades cotidianas con la mecánica, el actualmente solo asesora el trabajo de sus hijos que le heredaron el arte de los fieros, nos manifiesta que eles enseño todo a sus hijos y que ellos ahora saben mucho y que continuaron la labor que el hace años comenzó, nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar algunas maquinas de pulir para los autos.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Cayetano belongs to the “ALLIN MUJU” bank, which is located in the Huanchac district in the city of Cusco. Cayetano is 65 years old and is a widower with 4 children. He alternates his daily activities with work as a mechanic. He is currently teaching his children the art of metalworking, since they will inherit his business. He tells us that he has taught his children everything and that they now know a great deal and are continuing the work that he began many years ago. Cayetano is requesting a loan so that he can purchase some buffing machines for cars. Cayetano appreciates the loan that is being offered here and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing buffing machines for cars

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander A. R., tiene la edad de 39 años, es casado, y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tiene 8 y 2 años respectivamente. El quiere alquilar pasto en otro lugar y asi se ahora ese dinero. Además, él trabaja como peon algunas veces y el resto del tiemp la ganadería. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El también tiene el deseo de tratar de obtener un mejor futuro para todo su familia. 
About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Alexander A. R., 39, is married and has two children, who are his first priority in life. The children are 8 and 2-years-old respectively. He wants to lease pasture land somewhere so that he can save money. He works as a laborer sometimes and the rest of the time he raises cattle. He has worked his farm for many years and would like to expand. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He had no problems with his property but does want to see his farm be productive. FUDECOSUR offered the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate. He hopes to provide a better future for his entire family. The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lease additional pasture land.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Mr. A. Tom owns a pub in Ibanda Town Council, Katooma 2 Cell.  He is 31 years old and married with three children, two of whom are going to school. 

He wants to use the loan to purchase more soft drinks for his pub business. He aspires to obtain a large scale pub to attract the best customers, which will help him achieve a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks for his pub business.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
El señor Blas tiene 54 años de edad, está casado con la señora Celestina quien tiene 47 años de edad, ambos  nacidos en la ciudad de Itá, distante a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad capital. 

Tienen 2 hijos que ya son independientes, viven en un barrio muy cercano al centro de la ciudad de Itá donde posee una carpintería hace más de 18 años, allí fabrica y vende todo tipo de muebles como sillas, roperos, placares, mesas y otros, sus clientes en su mayoría son macateros (Revendedores de todo tipo de artículos) de la zona y particulares. 

El señor Blas opera con la Fundación Paraguaya hace 3 años demostrando buen pago en sus préstamos cancelados. En esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para la compra de madera, ya que tienen varios pedidos de ropero y necesita para capital operativo.
texts.en:
Blas, 54, is married to Celestina, 47. Both were born in he city of Itá, which is a few kilometers away from the capital They have two adult sons. They live in a neighborhood that's very close to dowtown Itá where he has had a carpentry shop for over 18 years. He manufactures all kinds of furniture like: chairs, wardrobes, built-ins, tables, etc. His customers are, for the most part, "macateros" (people who resell all kinds of articles) from the area and private individuals. Blas has worked with Fundación Paraguaya for 3 years now and has always paid back his loans punctually. On this occasion, he is asking for funds to buy lumber since he has several wardrobes on order and he needs working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria Auxiliadora E. R., vive en el Barrio Marginado de las Laureles Norte, ella es casada y tiene 6 hijos de las edades de 32, 30, 27 25, 24 y 19 años de edad, todas estan casadas y viven de forma independiente, por tanto ahora su prioridad es terminar la construcción de su casa. La señora  E. se dedica a la venta de zapatos, ropa de capa y variedades para el hogar, tiene 4 años de trabajar consiguiendo clientela para su tienda y dentro de las dificulatades que ha enfrentado han sido los problemas económicos que atraviesa el país, con ayuda de su marido ha logrado surtir su tienda, pero ahora necesita  de un capital mayor para la compra de ropa y zapatos para aprovechar la temporada escolar, con esta inversion podría recuperar el capital de manera rapida y generar mejores utilidades que le beneficien a toda la familia para poder alcanzar una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora E. R. lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is married and has 6 children, ages 32, 30, 27 25, 24 and 19. All of her children are married and live independently, so her current priority is finishing construction on her home. Maria sells shoes, clothing, and other household items. She has been developing her shop and building a customer base for four years and among the difficulties she has encountered are the economic problems in her country. With her husband's help, she has been able to supply the shop, but now she needs more working capital to purchase clothing and shoes to take advantage of the new school year. This investment in merchandise will enable her to repay her loan quickly and generate more income. This will provide her family more financial security.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Tath

texts.en:
Tath S. was born in 1951. She is a widow whose husband died several years ago. She now has three teenage children who are working at different jobs. Two work in the garment industry and other one stays home and works on the farm to earn a living.

Tath S. cultivates several types of crops on her own farmland, located nearby her house. Recently she has lacked supplies and does not have the capital to buy all the supplies she needs for the farm. Tath requests a loan to buy fertilizer which will enable her to improve and increase her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of soy beans

loans.name: Mrs. Leang Sok Ngem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has 13 members who live in Prasat village in Kandal province. Leang Sok N. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members; they will use the loan for different purposes. 

Leang Sok N. raises cattle in the local village, while her husband, Sokea Morn, is a policeman. Leang Sok N. is seeking a loan to buy some piglets for breeding, which will help her to increase her income. Through this activity they support their five children, two of whom are policemen, while another is too young to attend school or work, and the others attend the local public school. 

All the members are shown in the picture, but some of tH. are blocked.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: Carolina María

texts.es: La señora R. N., es una señora dedicada al trabajo, ya que de lunes a viernes se dedica a la costura, los fines de semana vende fritanga o comida en su casa, además tiene un Bixi que lo alquila diario que le genera ingresos adicionales. Tiene dos hijos uno está estudiando en la universidad y la hija menor que está en secundaria. El préstamo lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de verduras para la venta de comida y repuestos para el Bixi.
texts.en:
Sra. R. N. is woman who is dedicated to her work. She works Monday to Friday as a seamstress. On the weekends, she sells fried snacks and other foods from her home. Carolina also has a bicycle that she rents out to generate additional income. She has two children, one is studying at the university and her younger daughter is in high school.

This loan will used to purchase vegetables for her food business and spare parts for the rental bicycle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables for her food business & spare parts for her rental bicycle

loans.name: Kilangira Development Group Of  Mukono

texts.en:
S. Florence is 42 years old and is married with eight children ranging in age from 25 to 2. The children are all pursuing an education.

To support her children, Florence works in a stone quarry in Kirangira in Mukono district. She has been doing this for the last three years. In a week, she reveals, she is able to make 60,000 Ugandan shillings.

In these three years of operation, Florence has faced a number of challenges, overriding among these being the changes in seasonal customer preferences. During construction booms, her business, which has a reputation for producing good stone quarry products, basks in the glow of increased profits; at other times the reverse is true.

Florence’s future plan is not only to boost her fledgling business but also to open up a retail business. This she thinks will come to pass once she is able to obtain a loan.

loans.use: To buy new stone-breaking equipment to help ease her work

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy N. is a 47-year-old married mother of four children. She lives in Mombasa and operates a stall where she sells spices and tea leaves as a supplier in the busy Kongowea market. Nancy is popularly known as Mama Wa Majani by the locals. She has been in this business within the same market for 14 years. This business has been a source of her family income, providing for all her family needs for all this while. 

Nancy is borrowing her first loan from KADET to finance her business and she plans to purchase more stock of spices and tea leaves to meet her clients’ demands. She hopes to repay her loan well as her goods have a ready market.

She has been able to improve her living standards over the years and hopes to maintain that.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of spices and tea leaves

loans.name: Yemi

texts.en:
Yemi is married with 3 children and she is 46 years of age. Her husband is a Police officer and they lives in Lagos. She sells cooked food, sachet water, drinks and groceries in her shop in order to make earns meet. She has been in the business for the past 5 years. 

She hopes to rent a bigger shop in future where she can attend to more costumers. She is requesting for the loan amount of NGN80, 000 to purchase a deep freezer which can be use to cool drinks and sachet water for her customers thereby attracting more costumers and improve her profit margin. She appreciates all lenders for great support.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer to cool her drinks to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es soltera, tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando, vive en L. casa D. su mama y sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casa, para lo cual viene ahorrando, Esther pertenece al Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en quechua.
Esther hace 3 años inicio con L. venta D. verduras, frutas, pescado, productos que comercializa en las ferias D. L. región y D. allá adquiere quesos, cereales, producto que venD. en los mercados D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Los prestamos que obtuvo le ayudaron para seguir ampliando su negocio, actualmente necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles con lo cual comprara plátano, trigo, cebada.
texts.en:
Esther is single and has 2 children who are in school. She lives in her mother’s house and dreams of buying a piece of land where she can build her house, which she is saving for. Esther belongs to the Llapanchik communal bank, which means “Everyone” in Quechua. For 3 years Esther has been selling vegetables, fruits, and fish, which she sells at markets in the region. At those markets she buys cheeses and grains, which she sells in markets in the city of Ayacucho. The loans that she has obtained have helped her to continue growing her business. She now needs a loan of PEN 2,000.00, with which she will buy plantains, wheat, and barley.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plantains, wheat, and barley

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel tiene 57 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo dependiente que se encuentra en edad escolar, vive junto a su familia en el anexo Los Sanchez del caserío Lagartera, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población situada en zonas rurales que distan mucho una de la otra.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en labores agícolas, suele sembrar con maíz una pequeña parcela de su propiedad y también trabaja como peón agrícola en los campos cultivo de la zona, el realiza esta actividad diariamente y con ella solventa los gastos diarios de su familia, adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales para complementar sus ingresos y sacar a su familia adelante.

Angel suele criar ganado ovino y porcino en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

Angel desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindarle mantenimiento a su maíz y también alimento balanceado para que sus animales se desarrollen correctamente, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Angel es una persona honrada y trabajadora, se ha esforzado siempre para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Angel is 57 years old, he is married and has a son who, being of school age, is still economically dependent on him. He lives with his family in Los Sanchez, an outbuilding of the Lagartera country house, in a rural area of the Mórrope district, a region where the largest part of the population lives in rural areas scattered far away from one another. He has been working in the agricultural business since he was very young. He usually sows corn in a small portion of his land, on top of working as farm labourer in the crop fields of the area. This is his daily activity, thanks to which he settles the daily expenses of his family. He moreover breeds and sells animals to increase his earnings and thus provide for his family. Angel normally breeds sheep and pigs in some farmyards located close to his house: once they have reached the proper age, he sells them to the traders always visiting the area where he lives. Angel wishes to buy fertilizers to protect his corn, as well as balanced food to feed his animals and have them grow in the correct way. To reach his goal he has asked a loan of 1200 nuevo soles to Edpyme Alternativa. Angel is an honest and hard-working man, who has always made efforts to offer his family a better quality of life. He has already worked with our institution, proving himself to be punctual and responsible whit his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to protect his corn crops.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn G. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 36 years-old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Emelyn owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Emelyn has been engaged in her business for over 14 years. She says the reason she works hard is for her family to have nutritious food on the table and to provide for their other needs.

Emelyn joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and fertilizers. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Emelyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family income.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith A. is 34 years old, married to Gordon Ouma, and has four children. The family live in the Oruba area of Migori town.

Judith has run a cereals business for the past seven years. Her business is located at Moi bridge and her customers are usually boarding schools. She is applying for her second loan from Kiva partner, KADET, after completing her first one successfully. She normally uses the profits made to cater for her family's upkeep and pay her children's school fees. She hopes to own a cereals shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to stock her business

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina G. is a married woman who lives in Sta. Catalina, Barangay Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and as a dried fish vendor. Her husband Samson G., who is 72 years old, works as a dried fish vendor to earn his living. They have 3 children who are 34 to 40 years old. Catalina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Catalina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she could continue to save up for their future and for the business. Catalina G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team page and become a part of our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina nació en la Provincia de Paruro departamento del Cusco y tiene 23 años. Actualmente,  Ernestina vive junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos en la asociación Puerto Rico del distrito de Poroy de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Ernestina es ama de casa y se dedica al cuidado de los hijos, ella y su esposo Braulio  tienen un negocio familiar que es brindar servicio de transportes. Antes, Ernestina se dedicaba a la venta de pollipapas de forma ambulatoria en su carretilla, en la urbanización  Tica Tica. La podían encontrar, los 7 días de la semana,  desde las 2 de la tarde hasta las 9 de la noche. Ella vendía de 28 a 30 platos de pollipapas. A sus clientes les gustaba la preparación de la comida, la buena atención y la limpieza que tenia la socia. Por motivos  de salud tuvo que dejar de vender poliplanas porque iba nacer su bebe. Ernestina dentro de dos meses se reincorporara a su trabajo. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Ernestina que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro, ella desea comprar repuestos como por ejemplo frenos, parachoques, faros y otras cosas más. El anhelo de la socia es vender el carro viejo y después comprar un carro nuevo o comprar un carro para más pasajeros. 

El banco comunal “Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero” tiene dos años y medio de funcionamiento, Ernestina pertenece desde hace dos años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. El nombre del banco comunal es un término que en quechua (el idioma autóctono) significa “Princesa Hermosa de Chichero”.
texts.en:
Ernestina was born in Paruro Province in the Department of Cusco. She is 23 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Puerto Rico Association of the Poroy District in the city of Cusco.

Ernestina is a homemaker and spends her time taking care of her children. She and her husband Braulio have a family business providing transportation services. Previously she worked as a street vendor, selling “pollipapas” (fried chicken and potatoes) out of a push cart in the city of Tica Tica. She was able to do this seven days a week, from 2pm to 9pm, selling 28-30 dishes of chicken and potatoes. Her customers liked how she prepared the food, the good service she provided, and her cleanliness. Due to health reasons, she had to quit her food business in order to have her baby. Ernestina will be ready to return to work within two months.

With this next loan, Ernestina will receive 1000 PEN. She plans to use the money to make repairs to her existing vehicle. Ernestina will buy spare parts such as brakes, bumpers, headlights, and other items. Her plan is to sell her old car and then buy a new one or at least a vehicle that can hold more passengers.

The Communal Bank “Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero” has been in existence for 2½ years. Ernestina has been a member for two years and has performed very well. The name of the Communal Bank is derived from Quechua (an indigenous language) and means “Beautiful Princess of Chinchero”.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts to repair her existing vehicle

loans.name: Bok Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOK JOM est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 08 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Ces femmes se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. 

Madame Aminta F., debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo, de grand boubou blanc vêtue, est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse de tissus et de vêtements pour homme. Comme activité secondaire elle vend de l'encens. Elle vend souvent sa marchandise à crédit et le recouvrement se fait à la fin de chaque mois. Elle a 04 ans dans ce domaine d'expérience.

Avec son crédit elle va acheter de la marchandise (ci-dessus)
Son objectif principal est de prendre en charge la maladie de sa fille de 17 ans (élève en classe de 3è secondaire et admise au concours du Brevet de Fin d'Études Moyennes).
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bok Jom was created on December 4, 2007. It is made up of 8 women who are all from the same neighborhood. These women know each other through friendship and neighborly ties. Mrs. Aminta F., standing at the far right in the photo, wearing a white Grand Boubou, is the group's leader. She is 56 years old. She is married and has 9 children. She sells fabrics and men's clothing. She also sells incense. She often sells her goods on credit and collects at the end of each month. She has 4 years of experience at this job. With her loan she is going to purchase the above-mentioned merchandise. Her main goal is to take care of her sick 17-year-old daughter (a student in the equivalent of 10th grade, she has been invited to continue her studies through the equivalent of the end of High School).

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, men's clothing, and incense

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida T. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old. Loida is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Loida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Loida has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Loida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loida is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Loida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Susana Marcelina Fernanda

texts.es: La señora Susana Marcelina L. Aragón cuenta con negocio de abarrotes desde hace 6 años donde vende botanas, refrescos, leche, tortillas y mas. Ella comenta que hace un año por cuestiones de salud la operaron de su brazos y se le coloco platino lo cual no puede trabajar en alguna empresa maquiladora u oficina. Ella requiere de un préstamo para surtir su negocio ya que es de la manera que puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos.
texts.en: Susan Marcelina L. A. has had her grocery store for the past 6 years. She sells foods, drinks, milk, tortillas and more. She says that about a year ago she had surgery in her arms and she had plates put in and it prevented her from working elsewhere in a factory or office. She requires a loan to purchase inventory for her business and to be able to contribute with her husband towards their expenses.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Kipkemboi

texts.en: Kipkemboi K. has been selling ready-made clothes for the past 14 years. He is 46 years old, married to Josphine Jepkosgei and they have five children, ages 22, 18, 16, 14 and 9 years old. Kipkemboi earns a profit of 9,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month from his clothes business. He is applying for his fifth loan of 35,000 KES from KADET after having successfully paid back his other loans. He plans to use this loan to buy more clothes. With the anticipated profits from the expanded business, he plans to buy a plot of land. Kipkemboi hopes to operate a dairy farm and also see his children get enlightened through education and become successful in life.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge es un padre D. familia D. 38 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposa y sus hijos en un sector urbano marginal D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo, una D. las zonas mas comerciales del norte del país.

Se dedica desD. hace cuatro años a brindar servicio D. reparación D. llantas y venta D. repuestos para moticiletas en un pequeño taller ubicado cerca a su domicilio, su negocio goza D. muy buena acogida ya que por L. zona no existen otros parecidos. El negocio es su única fuente D. ingresos por lo que siempre trata D. brindar lo mejor D. si para salir adelante.

Jorge desea adquirir algunos repuestos para contar con un stock estable D. productos que le permita mejorar L. atención que brinda, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Sus vecinos y clientes le consideran una persona bastante responsable y tranquiL.. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y poder instalar otros talleres en L. ciudad.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 38 year-old father who lives together with his wife and children in a marginal urban area of the city of Chiclayo, on of the most important commercial areas in the north of the country.

He has been working for four years providing tire repairs and selling spare parts for motorcycles in a small workshop located near his home.  His business is very popular since there are no other similar businesses in his area.  The business is his only source of income which is why he always provides the very best of himself so that he can get ahead.

Jorge would like to acquire some spare parts so that he can have a stable stock of products which will allow him to proviD. his customers with a better service.  For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 nuevos soles.

His neighbors and customers consider him to be quite a responsible and quiet man.  His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman and to  set up other workshops in the city.

loans.use: To acquire some spare parts so that he has a stable stock of products

loans.name: Glenda Beatriz

texts.es:
Glenda de 48 años, tiene un restaurante en donde vende pollos asados donde vende cada plato a $ 1.50. Vive con sus dos hijos en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Inicio su restaurante vendiendo almuerzos. Pero como quería tener más ingreso inicio las ventas de pollos asados comprando un horno. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00 de hasta el anochecer todos los días vendiendo arroz con menestra y pollo, pollos asados enteros con plátanos y ensalada. Cada plato según que contenga lo vende a partir de $ 1.50 hasta $ 2.50 c/u.
