Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, arroz, pollos para tener más volumen de ventas. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa e implementar nuevos platos.
texts.en:
Glenda, age 48, has a restaurant where she sells roasted chicken for $1.50 per plate. She lives with her two children in a periurban area with all the basic services. This place is located along the Perimetral Highway of Guayaquil and surrounded by a marsh.

She started her restaurant by selling lunches. When she needed to generate more income, Glenda bought an oven so that she could sell roasted chickens. She currently works every day from 7am to dusk selling rice with mixed vegetables and chicken, whole roasted chickens with plantains, and salads. Each dish ranges from $1.50 to $2.50 each based on the type of food that is served.

Glenda wants to use this loan to buy drinks, rice, and chicken to increase her sales volume. In the future, she wants to finish the construction of her house and introduce new dishes.

loans.use: Purchase drinks, rice, and chicken

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.es: Cresencia C. D. T. D. 55 años D. edad, resiD. en Ilobasco, ubicado en el departamento D. Cabañas. Ella vive junto a su esposo y un hijo. Cresencia posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, un negocio muy estable, ya que no cuenta con mucha competencia y así mismo tiene muchos años D. dedicarse a este trabajo por lo que es muy conocida en el lugar. Cresencia solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en nuevos productos para la tienda como: nuevas golosinas, bebidas, y así mismo aumentar la cantidad D. productos principales los cuales poseen mayor cantidad D. demanda como: pan, leche, huevos y detergentes. Ella es una madre D. familia muy responsable la cual desea mejorar su estabilidad económica y poder vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Crescencia C. D. T. is 55 years old.  She lives in Ilobasco, in Cabañas department.  She lives with her husband and child.  Crescencia has a store where she sells perishable goods.  It is a very stable business since she doesn't have a lot of competition and she has been in the business for a lot of years which means that she is very well known in her town.

Crescencia is requesting a loan from Integral so that she can have the money she needs to invest in buying new products for her store such as: new candy and drinks.  She would also like to be able to increase the quantity of the main products she sells that are in most demand such as: bread, milk, eggs and detergents.  Crescencia is a very responsible mother who would like to improve her financial stability and be able to live more comfortably.

loans.use: To buy food products to sell

loans.name: Gombo

texts.en: Gombo S. is 71 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His one child attends university while his wife and oldest son both help him with the business. He operates a vegetable growing and trading business where he plants and grows a variety of vegetables in his own 800 m/square field. With the help of his son and his wife, he sells those vegetables out of a rented stall at the local markets. He has been engaged this business for the past 15 years and has since built a stable and successful operation. Before starting his own business, he worked as an agronomist for the agricultural department until 1995, after graduating from Agricultural University as an agronomist. After many years of owing his business, he has gained a lot experience as a farmer and his earnings have enabled him to build a greenhouse in 2009. They plant a variety of special vegetables in the greenhouse. Gombo is a hardworking and experienced businessman and says, "People, when they are retired, they just stay at home and do nothing. People can not be retired, they can still work."  He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary materials and supplies in order to pickle their vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials and supplies to pickle vegetables

loans.name: Dory

texts.en:
Dory R. is from the village of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is 50 years old. Dory is single. To make a living, Dory owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Dory has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Dory joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dory has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Dory is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Dory from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This lender is 52 years old and lives with her husband and five of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who works for less than 1 USD per day, while her husband is a construction worker building houses. On average, he is able to make about 6 USD each day. Three of their children work in construction, and two are in school. She needs a loan to expand her business. She is asking for a loan of 1200 USD to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to school and to purchase a plot of farmland to grow yams. She hopes this loan will help her family grow more yams, and therefore, earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and farmland

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PROGRESO” iniciará el ciclo número cuatro en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes, la banca comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  una presidenta, la senora Susana.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados:  costura de chamarras, elaboración de papas fritas, venta de carne de cerdo, tienda de barrio, artesania en matas, mantas de hilo, tejido de mantas.
 
La señora Susana, presidenta de la asociacion comunal, indica que forma parte de la 
A.C. “Progreso”  3 ciclos, aproximadamente  año y medio, su negocio es artesania en manta, el mismo es desarrollado en su domicilio desde hace diez anos aproximadamente, las ventas tambien son realizadas en su domicilio.  Esta actividad le permite trabajar y al mismo tiempo cuidar de su familia.
La asociación tenía muchas espectativas con respecto al crédito, en la fotografía está incluida una señora que estaba pensando solicitar un crédito adicional.
texts.en:
The “PROGRESO” (Progress) communal association is starting its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Focal Center.  It has nine members and is led by a governing board at the head of which is a President, Susana.

The business which the members of the communal bank run are varied: jacket making, fried potato making, sale of pork, neighborhood store, blanket making, weaving and decorating.

Susana is the President of the communal association.  She indicates that she’s been part of the “Progreso” communal association for three cycles, approximately a year and a half.  Her business is blanket crafts which she has done at home for about ten years now.  Her sales are also home-based.  This activity allows her to work while caring for her family.

The association had great expectations with regard to the loan.  A woman who was thinking about asking for an additional loan is included in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fabric and fringe.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is from the village of Napurog Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, married and has three adult children. To make a living, Rosario runs an agricultural business, raising crops in the local community. Rosario has been engaged in her business for 3 months and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities. 

Rosario joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, with which, she will purchase additional inventory and use towards working capital. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Rosario from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa K. sells palm oil at the Jukwa Market near Abura, Cape Coast.  To supplement her earnings, she also sells food items such as garden eggs (shown in the photograph). Widowed with four children, Adwoa has been making her living in this fashion for a number of years now. 

She is solely responsible for providing for her family. To improve her earnings, she intends to purchase more bags of garden eggs to deliver to her increasing customers so she can increase her sales. She plans to save up the extra earnings for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of garden eggs

loans.name: Clemantine

texts.en: Clemantine is 36 years old, married to a driver and has four children aged between two and eight. They are all in school apart from the youngest. Clemantine owns a general store in which she sells several products such as rice, Irish potatoes, soap, sugar etc. She has been in this business for one year and it enables her to feed her family. Clemantine is requesting a loan to buy more items for her store.

loans.use: to buy more food items for her store

loans.name: Carmen Alicia

texts.es:
Carmen A. es una mujer de 35 años de edad que vive en una población del municipio de Bolívar, donde las artesanías son parte de la cultura productiva de esa región, allí se dedica a fabricar en tejido vertical hamacas, bolsos y mochilas que hace con sus propias manos; esta actividad la aprendió de su suegra hace muchos años y desde hace dos se dedico a ella. Su hogar está conformado por su esposo, gran admirador de sus tejidos, que se desempeña como profesor y entre los dos apoyan el sostenimiento de su hogar, en el que tienen tres hijos en las edades de 2 a 16 años.   
Carmen es una mujer que le gusta el negocio y siempre está en la búsqueda de nuevos clientes, su poco capital de trabajo no le deja responder a los pedidos de una manera mas competitiva, porque muchas veces debe acudir a los almacenes de venta de estos productos, cuando no cuenta con ellos; sus clientes se encuentran  en la ciudad de Barranquilla y también cuenta con turistas, a los que siempre se esmera por cumplirles, aunque algunas veces no lo hace con los buenos precios de venta que ella quisiera. Carmen ha recibido dos créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con ellos ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo y adicionar un negocio de venta de minutos a celulares, como otra forma de generar ingresos adicionales. Con su credikiva, comprará materia prima para hacer hamacas, bolsos y mochilas, pues tiene familiares en Barranquillas  que le ayudan con la venta de sus productos y han solicitado pedidos. Su máximo desafío es poder responderle a sus clientes con los diseños que ellos exigen, por eso cada día trabaja para aumentar su capital de trabajo,  mientras aumenta su rentabilidad que es no inferior a un 52%.
texts.en: Carmen A. is a 35-year-old woman who lives in a town in the Bolívar municipality where handicrafts are part of the region’s economic culture.  There she works weaving vertical hammocks, bags, and backpacks that she makes herself with her hands.  She learned this work from her mother-in-law many years ago and since then has worked at this.  Her home is made up of her husband, a big admirer of her weavings, who works as a teacher and between the two of them they support the maintenance of their home where they have three children between the ages of two and 16-years-old.  Carmen is a woman who enjoys business and is always looking for new customers.  Her limited working capital doesn’t allow her to respond to orders in a competitive manner because she often has to go to the stores selling materials because she doesn’t have them.  Her customers are located in the city of Barranquilla and she also has tourist customers who she always tries to meet the needs of, though sometimes without getting the good selling prices she would like.  Carmen has received two loans from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and with these has been able to increase her working capital and add a business selling cell phone minutes as another way to generate additional income.  With her credikiva she will buy basic materials to make hammocks, bags, and backpacks.  She has family members in Barranquilla who help her sell her products and who have requested orders.  Her biggest challenge is responding to her customers with the designs that they request, because of this she works every day to increase her working capital while increasing her profits which are at or above 52%.

loans.use: to buy string and materials for production.

loans.name: Joseph S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you teachers of the Yoni-Banna Secondary School in Mile Ninety-One, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Yoni-Banna Secondary School was founded in 1964 by the UMC Mission. Currently, the school is staffed with 45 employees and has an enrollment of 1,500 pupils. 

Joseph S. S. is a teacher at the school and leader of this group of borrowers. The 43-year-old Joseph was born in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. He has been in the teaching profession for 17 years. He is married and has four children – one in primary school, two in secondary school and one in college. Joseph has requested this loan in order to buy household materials - a generator and chairs. 

Staff from this institution, like many other schools within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

(Also pictured in the bottom right corner of the photo is Daniel A. F., a borrower who was not able to be present for a group photo.)

loans.use: to buy a generator and chairs.

loans.name: Nayavesupat Enole

texts.en:
Nayavesupat Enole N. is 45 years old and married with five children. She is a businesswoman who has been operating a food kiosk for the past five years.

She was introduced to KADET LTD through advertisement done by the KADET staff. This is the first loan she has applied for from KADET. She is planning to use the loan to buy more stock like sugar, rice, wheat flour, and maize flour. 

She hopes to make a profit from the loan and use it to expand her kiosk to a wholesale store. She dreams of being a prominent business lady. She is a hardworking woman who can achieve more if funded.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Bella Amira

texts.es:
Bella de 59 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Es viuda y tiene una hija mayor de edad discapacitada. Se dedica a a la venta de ropa.

Comenzó su actividad desde muy joven vendiendo ropa a créditos con su mama pero desde que se caso siguió con el negocio con su conyugue hasta abrir un atienda de ropa. Con el pasar del tiempo su esposo la dejo y ella no se dio por vencido que siguió con su actividad hasta que su conyugue murió pero ella vive con su hija que es discapacitada . Labora desde las 6H00 am a 7H00 am de ahí ya se queda en su tienda desde las 6H00 pm. De 6h00 pm a 7H00 pm sale a a cobrar su ropa a crédito a sus clientela. Con la ayuda del préstamo va a comprar víveres y ropa por docena para mejorar sus ingresos. La cliente desea tener una tienda mas grande para ya no dejar mucho tiempo sola a su hija que la deja en su casa. Con respecto a su familia solo le pide a Dios que le de los años que mas pueda para poder cuidar a a su hija hasta su ultimo aliento de vida.
texts.en:
Bella is 59 years old and lives in Playas canton.  This is one of Ecuador's tourist destinations and is known for its wide variety of seafood.  Bella is a widow and has a grown-up, disabled daughter.  Her business is selling clothes.

Bella started her business at a very young age, selling clothes on credit with her mom.  However, when she got married, she continued in her business together with her husband and eventually opened a clothes store.  Bella's husband left her but she did not give up.  She continued in her business until her husband died.  Bella lives with her daughter who is disabled.  She starts work at 6.00 or 7.00am and stays in her store until 6.00pm.  From 6.00pm to 7.00pm she goes out to deliver clothes on credit to her customers and collect payment.  With the help of this loan, Bella will buy food products and clothes in bulk so that she can increase her income.

Bella would like to have a larger store so that she no longer has to leave her daughter alone for long as she leaves her at home.  As regards her family, Bella only asks God to grant her as many years as he can so that she can continue to care for her daughter until she draws her last breath.

loans.use: to buy food products and clothes in bulk for her business

loans.name: Adiza

texts.fr: Revendeuse de céréales depuis 1998, Mme Adiza est mère de 02 enfants  et son conjoint est gendarme. Elle achète ses céréales à Anié et revend à Agoé Assiyéyé. Ce troisième prêt lui servira à acheter des céréales pour revendre  à toute personne et assurer un avenir à ses enfants.
texts.en: A retailer of cereals since 1998, Madam Adiza is the mother of two children and the wife of a policeman.  She buys her grains in Anié and resells them in Agoé Assiyéyé.  This third loan will allow her to purchase cereals for resale and to ensure a future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cereals.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 39 años de edad, ella tiene 03 hijos bajo su responsabilidad.  Ella vive cerca de la casa de sus padres en el distrito de Reque, a 20 minutos dela ciudad de Chiclayo. La zona donde vive es rural y la actividad principal es la agricultura, seguido de la ganadería.

Santos se dedica a la venta de leche  el cual se encarga de venderla a los pobladores de la zona y en mercados pues ella cuenta con varios años de experiencia en este negocio, esta actividad le genera buenos ingresos y además la realiza desde de su casa.

Santos está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales(vacas) para la cría y producción de leche. 

Santos es una persona  hogareña y estimada por las personas que la conocen la describen como un persona amable y trabajadora en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Santos is 39 years old and she is responsible for three children. She lives close to her parents’ house in the district of Reque, 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. The region where she lives is rural and her principle activity is agriculture, followed by animal husbandry.

Santos sells milk for a living. she sees to the sale of the milk to the residents in the area and in markets. She has several years of experience in this business. This business generates a good income for her, plus she runs the business from her house.

Santos is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals (cows) for breeding and milk production.

Santos is a home-loving person and is respected by the people that know her. They describe her as friendly and hard-working in her community.

loans.use: to buy more cows for milk production.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margret has been in the tailoring business for the last 10 years. She is a hardworking 42-year-old business woman. She is married and blessed with three children. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for supporting her finances to inject into her business. In the next five years, she wants to be a well-known tailor in her local community.

She wants a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fabric, threads and canvas for her business.

loans.use: to buy dress materials, threads and canvas.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: A divorced mother taking care of four children has not been easy for Esi, who is shown in the photo displaying the palm kernels she uses to make oil. She now wants to increase the quantity of oil she makes through a Kiva loan to purchase large quantities of palm kernels to process. Esi plans to reinvest the profit for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of palm kernels to process into oil for sale.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es: Anastacia tiene 43 años, vive en el caserío de Yanama Alto. Ahí formó su familia junto a Paulino, su esposo desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero viven solo con 2 de ellos: Karol y Ángela en su casa propia. Ella es el pilar de su familia y su asociación. El ser tesorera de su banco comunal, le ayudó a ser responsable y a comprometerse con el desarrollo de cada uno de sus miembros. Todos estos nuevos aprendizajes los practica en sus diferentes actividades económicas. Hace 22 años que comenzó con la agricultura, sembrando arveja y papa en todas sus variedades. Según cuenta tiene diferentes terrenos agrícolas que se sitúan en los caseríos de Huancamarca, Manchay Alto y la costa peruana de Chancay. A mediados de año, que es cosecha grande, ella se dirige a la capital donde vende los alimentos que produce a un mayor precio. Además de dedicarse a la ganadería, donde ara la tierra con la ayuda de sus 2 toros y vende la leche que produce las 2 vacas que posee. Toda esta actividad los realiza con el apoyo de su esposo, ya que hace poco incursionó en el negocio de abarrotes, donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los diferentes pobladores del lugar. Por lo que desea ahorrar lo necesario para adquirir una movilidad y poder trasladarse con mayor facilidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Manantiales de Yanama” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además se compromete en pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas. Anastacia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en completar el capital necesario para la compra de 8 bolsas de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para comenzar la temporada de siembra grande que se avecina.
texts.en: Anastacia is 43 years old and lives in the village of Yanama Alto.  There she started her family with Paulino, her husband of 8 years.  They have 6 children, but they live with only two of them, Karol and Ángela, in their own home.  She is the pillar of her family and her association.  Being treasurer of her communal bank helped her be responsible and to commit herself to the development of each one of its members.  She applies all that she has learned to her various business activities. She started farming 22 years ago, planting peas and potatoes of all varieties.  She says she has different farmlands in the villages of Huancamarca, Manchay Alto, and the Peruvian coast of Chancay. In the middle of the year, which is a large harvest, she goes to the capital, where she sells the food she produces at a high price.  She also raises livestock; she plows the land with the help of her two bulls, and sells the milk her two cows produce.  She does all of these activities with the help of her husband, who not long ago began a grocery business, where he sells staple products to people who live in the area.  She wants to save enough to acquire transportation and be able to move around more easily.  She belongs to the "Manantiales de Yanama" communal bank, and this is her sixth loan with MFP.  She hopes for the support of all of you in order to continue with her goals.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  Anastacia, upon receiving this support, will use the money she is asking for to purchase 8 bags of pea seed and several bags of natural fertilizer to begin the big planting season that is approaching.

loans.use: to purchase 8 bags of pea seed and several bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Awah

texts.en:
He is married with three children. All his children are below fifteen years of age. He lives in Nchualam, a quarter in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. He has been a GHAPE member since 2001. He has successfully managed and repaid his loans since he join GHAPE.

However, he will not stop thinking about a car accident that he was involved in that has affected his hand till today. Also the difficulties he encounters with the family, especially sickness. However the loans he has been obtaining from GHAPE have enabled him to provide some basic needs to his family.  Given a loan, he plans to purchase firewood (wood used in Cooking) and buy palm wine. Palm wine is a type of locally consumed wine gotten from the Raffia palm. It is usually white in color and very sweet when it is it fresh. It becomes more fermented as time passes. He will also buy kola nuts to retail. He hopes that his business will succeed since he has been doing this business for so many years. Also there is a ready market for his products since his business site is located in one of the small squares where many people gather for daily business activities. Also his site is not far from the main town.

He will plough back his profit into his business and use part to care for his family.He will also take care of himself to ensure that their family situation improved.   He prefers GHAPE because of the training he frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan

loans.use: to purchase firewood, palm wine, Maggi  and kola nuts.

loans.name: Nyabiherere Bakyara Tutungukye Group

texts.en:
Nine years of unwavering resolve and efficacy have brought dividends to 37-year-old Benon's produce sales business in Ibanda. The sturdy father of five speaks glowingly of how he has been able to bring a new lease of life to his family. Benon is invariably firm in purpose. Notwithstanding the hardships he has faced, he has not wavered.

Benon plies his trade in one of the biggest food markets in Ibanda. What has helped his cause is the fact that he is a farmer. On his farms, he grows and harvests crops such as maize, rice, bananas and yams. At length, these are the crops he sells. Weekly his business's gross sales income is to the tune of Uganda shillings 80,000.

He says he intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more maize and bean seeds to grow.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and beans seeds to grow.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 30 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Eunice runs a retail kiosk in Kilifi. She has been in this business for the last three years and she earns good income.  

Eunice has been a KADET client and this will be her third loan to finance her business. She successfully paid back the previous loans. With this loan, she plans to expand her business by purchasing sugar, rice, maize meal, fruits, carrots, tomatoes and onions. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, fruits, carrots, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: Gina tiene 30 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, es madre soltera de un niño de diez años, quien es el motivo de vivir y trabajar, ya que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación. Juntas habitan en su casa propia, donde comparte con sus dos hermanas que le ayudan en algunos gastos del hogar. EL trabajo de Gina consiste en la venta de ropa, dicha mercadería lo trae de la ciudad de Lima, y que son ofrecidos a amistades, vecinos y familiares, y compañeros de trabajo, pues labora para una institución local. Durante 10 años que continua trabajando, trayendo diseños muy novedosos y que son del gusto de la mayoría de sus clientes. Por ello espera la puedan ayudar nuevamente para poder invertir en su negocio. Su fin es tener una tienda de abarrotes y un puesto de venta de ropa en algún mercado de su ciudad. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, y por tanto espera la ayuda de ustedes para desarrollar su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería para tener en exhibición y que sus clientes tengan más opción de escorger.
texts.en:
Gina is 30 years old.  She is an entrepreneurial and very hard-working woman.  She is the single mother of a 10-year-old boy who is her motivation to live and work as she would like to provide him with a better quality of life and a good education.  They live together in their own home which they shares with her two sisters who help her with some of the household expenses.  Gina's business is selling clothes which she buys in the city of Lima and then sells to friends, neighbors, family members, and work colleagues as she works for a local institution.

Gina has been working for ten years, selling the very latest designs which are to the taste of most of her customers.  She hopes that you will help her once again so that she can invest in her business.  Her goal is to have a grocery store and a clothes stall in a market in her town.  This will be her fourth loan from MFP and she hopes that you will help her to develop her business.  Gina will use the sum she has requested to buy merchandise to display so that her customers have more choices.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 46 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with five children. To earn a living, Rosalinda has a business selling different kinds of fish and other seafood products when they are available. She sells fish within her own community as well as neighboring areas. She has been successfully managing her business for six years and earns 5,000 PHP each month. Rosalinda has been a member of GDMPC since 2010.

Rosalinda is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to purchase variety of fish and fish products to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rent a marketplace stall to gain more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish and fish products to sell

loans.name: Enedi

texts.en: Enedi is a 30-year-old widow with four children renting a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava flour for 15 years. She started with 500,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings as working capital. Her hardship is bad debts and her vision is having her own sheltered shop, buying a plot and building a house. Enedi needs the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 36 years old and is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 16 years old. Maribeth's husband works as a driver.

Maribeth sells hotdogs and ham to the people in her community. She and her husband also make "empanada" (a kind of small meat pie) to sell. Maribeth requested this loan to buy more hotdogs and ham to sell. Maribeth hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more hotdogs and ham to sell.

loans.name: Karlygash's Group

texts.en:
Karlygash leads this three-person loan group. She is 21, married to a taxi driver and has two children, a daughter and a son, neither of whom is yet old enough to attend school. She cares for her children at home during the day but also works on the side as a livestock breeder. She started this business five years ago with an investment of 5,000 soms, and is applying for this loan to buy more animals for her herd. In the future, she plans to buy furniture to improve her family's living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Pasuc Group

texts.es:
La señora Pascuala Confesora es casada, tiene 52 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 8 hijos 1 D. los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a la crianza D. animales doméstiC., específicamente a la crianza D. cerdos, inició criando gallina ponedoras ya hasta el momento lleva 10 años D. experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para compra D. cerdos, alimentación y vacunas para mantenerlos en buenas salud, en el futuro espera contar con una graja. Los demás integrantes se dedica a la confección D. prendas, crianza D. animales.
texts.en:
Sra. Pascuala Confesora is 52 years old, married, and did not have the opportunity to study. She has eight children, one of whom is in school. Pascuala raises domesticated animals, specifically pigs. She started out raising egg-laying hens and now has 10 years of experience.

Pascuala organized a group so that she could request a loan. She plans to buy pigs, feed, and vaccines so that she can keep her animals in good health. In the future, she hopes to have a farm.

The other members have businesses that involve making clothes and raising animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs, concentrated feed, and vaccines.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem, 63, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Rem sells morning glories.
 
Rem is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase drinks and groceries for her daughter to sell. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income.
 
In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy drinks and groceries for her daughter to sell.

loans.name: Bokoli Rural Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bokoli Rural Group in Western Kenya! Doris is the facilitator of the Bokoli Rural group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Doris takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Doris had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Doris was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Doris  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Doris will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Bokoli Rural group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Vilma tiene 36 años de edad y vive en El Cielito, una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Santa Barbara. Ella tiene 3 años de estar con su pareja Fredy. Vilma tiene tres hijos – un bebe de 15 meses, una hija de 20 y un hijo de 17 años de edad, lo cual está estudiando. 

Vilma especializa en la siembra y producción de café. Posee dos manzanas de tierra donde produce café pergamino húmedo. Ella tiene 15 años de ser caficultora. Vilma empezó a sembrar con esfuerzos propios con el objetivo de sacar adelante a su familia y darles una mejor educación. 

Solicitó este crédito de L16,000 para pagar la recolección de la cosecha y para invertir en fertilizante y la siembra de vivero de café.
texts.en:
Sra. Vilma is 36 years old and lives in El Cielito, a neighborhood in the municipality of Santa Barbara. She has been with her partner Fredy for three years. She has three children: a 15-month-old baby, a 20-year-old daughter, and a 17-year-old son who is in school.

Vilma specializes in growing and producing coffee. She has two plots of land on which she produces Pergamino coffee. Vilma has been a coffee grower for 15 years. She began planting crops through her own efforts so that she could help her family move forward and provide her children with a better education.

Vilma is requesting a loan of 16,000 HNL to pay for the gathering of her harvest and to invest in fertilizers and a coffee nursery.

loans.use: to pay for the gathering of her harvest and to invest in fertilizers and a coffee nursery.

loans.name: Gabriel Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Gabriel se dedica  al confección de ropa deportiva, es su  primer crédito dentro la institución, fue invitado por su hermana,  trabaja en el área de producción de deportivos hace ya dos años, vive en casa familiar con sus hermanos y dos de sus hijos  jóvenes su taller se encuentra en la misma casa y en algunos momentos realiza contrato con colegios y otras instituciones  a quienes entrega por cantidad, con el dinero del crédito comprar telas e hilos para la confección de prendas deportivas,   una de sus metas  es comprar su casa para poder irse con sus hijos y poder independizarse y así también brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, el Sr Gabriel, es una persona muy trabajadora, con el tiempo desea ofrecer sus productos en la ciudades de Cochabamba y Oruro, se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Gabriel manufactures sportswear.  This is his first loan from the institution.  His sister invited him.  He’s been working making sportswear for two years now.  He lives in the family home with his siblings and two of his young children.  His workshop is located at home and occasionally he negotiates contracts with schools and other institutions to which he sells in quantity.  

Money from the loan will be used to buy fabric and thread to make the sportswear.  One of his goals is to buy a house so that he can go there with his children and become independent while providing more comfort for his family at the same time.  

Gabriel is a very hardworking person.  In time, he’d like to sell his products in the cities of Cochabamba and Oruro.  He feels very grateful for the opportunity he’s being given.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Mercelyn, 37 years old, is married and has five children, four of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 12 years, Mercelyn has operated  a food vending business in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Mercelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

Note: Please change her name to Mercelyn not Marcelina.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finish up the building

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy 20 chickens and their feed

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en: Chhoeun R. N. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  She runs a small grocery store in her village and can make about $2.50 per day.  Her husband is an electrician and can make about $3.50 in a day.  R. N. hopes to use this loan to expand her grocery business by purchasing more products to sell.  In the future, R. N. hopes to generate enough money from her grocery business to send her two children to university.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to expand business

loans.name: Ogieva

texts.en: This woman is proud to be a member of LAPO. She has a business worth 100,000 NGN (about $785), and she promises to expand it with an additional funds. She is from the Edo State in Nigeria and is requesting to borrow the sum of $450.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Ramiz has sold agricultural produce in a  local market for about a year. He is from Khachmaz town, is married, and has two children. He is 57 years old.
Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy more products.

loans.use: to increase agricultural produce

loans.name: Akhmadaga

texts.en: Akhmadaga Ahmadov is a 48-year-old trader who sells flour to the local bakers. He lives in the Sabirabad region, which is situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Akhmadaga lives with his wife and five children. He has twelve years of experience of selling flour. During these years Akhmadaga enrolled a lot of permanent clients and now he is going to open his small windmill and start making flour himself. He believes that for the money he has  applied for he could build a windmill and become an owner of a big business. He is planning to expand his activity not only in Sabirabad, and surrounding villages, but also in Baku and other big cities of Azerbaijan. He needs 1000 USD to build his own windmill.

loans.use: Going to build his own windmill

loans.name: Alina Primitiva

texts.es:
Since she was young, Alina has always demonstrated a special gift for raising domestic animals in her home. She maintains an affable and enterprising spirit in the midst of such activities. Her acquired experience and success in raising animals has enabled her to contribute satisfactorily to the raising of her children. She also sells vegetables sporadically in the city of Carhuamayo, and that provides additional assistance. Alina sees in her three young daughters an interminable source of motivation that pushes her to move forward through hard work and dedication in order to give them an adequate education. She is asking for a loan with the goal of traveling more regularly to Carhuamayo and increasing the quantity of the products that she sells in the city, as well as improving the stock of her animals through modifying raising methods and through the purchase of better foods. These steps will provide economic benefits. Help this noble woman obtain her dreams and succeed in her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Alina desde niña siempre mostró un carisma especial por la crianza de pequeños animales domésticos en su casa, mostrando siempre un espíritu afable y emprendedor en esta actividad, razón por la cual ahora, toda esa experiencia adquirida le ha permitido contribuir satisfactoriamente en el desarrollo de sus hijos a través de esta labor y también de la venta de verduras que realiza esporádicamente en la ciudad de Carhuamayo. Ella ve en sus tres pequeñas hijas una fuente de interminable motivación que la impulsa a salir adelante a través de su esfuerzo y dedicación por brindarles una educación adecuada. Solicita un préstamo con el objetivo de viajar constantemente a Carhuamayo e incrementar la cantidad de los productos que comercializa en esa ciudad, así también mejorar la raza de sus animales por medio de la reparación de sus módulos de crianza y la compra de mejores alimentos, que serán propicios para obtener mayores beneficios económicos.Ayudemos a esta noble mujer en la obtención de sus anhelos y proyectos.

loans.use: To increase the capital of two small businesses in order to consolidate them and generate more family income.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
When we visited Teodora’s house, we found her working enthusiastically and diligently in her vocation as a teacher reviewing and refilling the notebooks of the children she teaches in her small garden. She is a single mother with one eleven-year-old daughter. She works very hard at her endeavors because she believes the best gift she can give her young daughter is a good education. Given her immense desire to provide all the best for her daughter, she has for some time now contemplated the possibility of opening a small store in their home. Her goal is to supplement her income during her free time, so she can improve their standard of living. For this reason, she turns to you for your support in helping her reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuando visitamos la casa de doña Teodora, la observamos trabajando con un muy buen ánimo y empeño en sus labores de maestra revisando y rellenando las libretas de los niños a quienes imparte educación en un modesto jardín.Ella es madre soltera con una hija de once años, quien aún está en etapa escolar, razón por la cual trabaja constantemente por que considera que el mejor regalo que le puede otorgar a su pequeña hija es una educación adecuada. Debido a su inmenso deseo de querer ofrecerle lo mejor a su hija desde hace mucho ha contemplado la posibilidad de aperturar una pequeña tienda en su domicilio, con el objetivo de incrementar sus ingresos para elevar su nivel de vida familiar durante su período de horas libres, por esta razón recurre a vosotros en busca de tu ayuda a fin de cristalizar su anhelo en corto tiempo con tu importante aporte.

loans.use: Open a small store/bodega in her home.

loans.name: Ashurbi

texts.ru:
Ashurbi H., 48, is married and has 3 children. Ashurbi takes care of the household and tends to a cattle farm. Ashurbi has been farming for 5 years. She plans to use this loan to purchase young bulls. Every 40-45 days, Ashurbi resells the animals earning a living for her family. Ashurbi plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Халимова Ашурби, возраст – 48 лет, образование – среднее, замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Ашурби домохозяйка и занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать на приобретение нескольких молодых бычков. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 5 лет. Она откармливает и через каждые 40-45 дней продаёт бычков, таким образом она зарабатывает на содержание семьи и чувствует себя независимой, приобретая в дом необходимые вещи как для себя так и для своего мужа и детей. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is a craftsman, he makes hats for the Cholitas* and his wife weaves shawls for them.

Together, they also have a groceries store in the area of Villa Ingenio, city of El Alto. These 2 activities generate an income that allows them to support their 4 children (ages 12, 9, 5 and 2).

Antonio would like to use the loan to buy more supplies for his grocery store in order to increase his sales and income. He currently sells basic commodity products like bread, eggs, candies and drinks.

This is the first time he asks for a loan and the credit evaluation of Impro authorizes him to get it.

(*Note from the translator: Cholita is a Bolivian native woman that wears her waist-length hair in braids connected together at the ends with tassled tullmas, a traditional multilayered skirt (called pollera), a wide shawl (called manta) that accompanies the skirt and a small felt bowler hat balanced on top of her head. For an image you can check: http://www.lubbockonline.com/images/20070815/82730_512.jpg)

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Description Antonio es artesano; él confecciona sombreros para cholitas y la esposa teje mantas de cholitas; también tienen una tienda de abarrotes. Estas dos actividades generan sus ingresos económicos para cubrir la manutención de sus cuatro hijos de 12, 9, 5 y 2 años de edad; viven en la zona Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito que Antonio requiere en esta oportunidad será utilizado para comprar mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes de esa forma incrementara sus ingresos familiares. Una tienda de abarrotes es una tienda de barrio donde los vecinos encuentran pan, refrescos, huevos, jugos, dulces, y otros productos básicos de la canasta familiar.

Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada le faculta para acceder al mismo. .

loans.use: To buy more supplies for his grocery store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Señora Rosa is 41 years old. She is immersed in commercial labor thanks to the management of her little convenient food store, through which she satisfies the needs of her dear family. She tells us that at this time she has attended to every one of her clients requests, but nevertheless, due to her capital, she has had difficulties attending to all the orders, which have been increasing steadily. For this reason she is requesting a loan so she may start giving attention to the requests of her clients in order to not lose their confidence in her.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Rosa de 41 años de edad, está inmersa en la labor comercial gracias a la administración de su pequeña bodeguita a través de la cual satisface las necesidades de su querida familia. Nos comenta que a lo largo de este tiempo ha atendido cada una de las peticiones de sus clientes, sin embargo conforme su cartera se ha ido incrementando tiene dificultades para atender las peticiones de sus clientes.Por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de iniciar la atención de los pedidos de sus clientes a fin de no perder su confianza.

loans.use: Boost of capital to increase the quantity and variety of her products.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 37 year old woman. She lives in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Souad sells clothes to earn a living. This is the first time she has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua. With the loan, she is planning to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Witness

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Witness K.. She is single and has two children who are 12-year-old twins. In 2007, Witness opened a crop wholesale business from which she earns $90 a month. She has applied for a loan to buy additional stocks of sunflower seeds in bulk for this business, and thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy sunflower seeds in bulk.

loans.name: Mujeres De Potrero Group

texts.es:
The committee consists of 18 working women from the Potrero neighborhood in the city of Caacupé. The group is currently in the 5th cycle of the Mujeres Emprededoras (Enterprising Women) Program and the great majority of the women sell goods from their own homes, using them as stockrooms and stalls. They sell cold drinks and both new and second hand clothes.

The group currently has a loan of around 555.000 Paraguayan guaranis (PYG) per member through La Fundación Paraguaya's Committee of Enterprising Women Program.

The committee was formed thanks for Mrs. María C., the current secretary of the group, who found out through a client of La Fundación that there was a local committees program and that a committee of women had already been formed in her neighborhood. Once she had all the information, she began her campaign, inviting her neighbours to join and that's how the group was formed.

María G., the committee's president has said she is very happy with the Fundación Paraguaya's program because it gives them access to a formal loans, and it is well known that people of scarce means such as those who are part of the committee do not usually have access to formal loans.

Today they are looking for a new loan which they will use to purchase products such as sugar, grass, milk, biscuits, starch, beef, sodas, beer and drinks of all kinds as well as clothes for men, women and children.

Translated by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer

El comité está integrado por 18 señoras trabajadoras del barrio Potrero de la ciudad de Caacupé, el grupo esta actualmente en el 5to. Ciclo del programa Mujeres Emprededoras, la gran mayoría de las señoras se dedican al comercio, que lo explotan en su misma casa familiar, como ser despensa, kiosko, venta de bebidas heladas, venta de ropas nuevas y usadas.

Las integrantes de comité están manejando una línea de crédito promedio de gs. 555.000 por cada integrante a través del programa de comités de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya.

Los inicios y la formación del comité fue gracias a que la señora María C., actual secretaria del grupo, se entero a través de un cliente de La Fundación de que había un programa denominado comités vecinales y que en su barrio ya se había formado un comités de mujeres, una vez que tuvo toda la información se puso en campaña y empezó a invitarle a vecinas y así llegaron a así se conformo el grupo.

María G., la presidenta del comités manifestó estar muy contenta con este programa que emprende la Fundación Paraguaya porque les permite acceder a un crédito formal, ya que es sabido que gente de escasos recursos como las que integramos el comités no tienen acceso a un crédito formal.

Hoy están en busca de un nuevo crédito que desean invertirlo en la compra de productos tales como, azúcar, yerba, leche, galletas, almidón, carne vacuna, gaseosa, cerveza, bebidas de todo tipo, como así también la compra de ropas para damas, caballeros, y niños.

loans.use: To purchase products such as sugar, grass, milk, biscuits, starch, beef, sodas, beer and drinks of all kinds as well as clothes for men, women and children

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa is 38 years old, and she completed her education up to the first year of secondary school. She speaks Aymará and understands Spanish. She is married with four children, one of whom is grown and lives independently. Her other three children are still in school. Her house is located in the Maquera section of the El Collao province.

She dedicates herself to buying and selling sheep at the markets in Ilave on Sundays, and on Fridays in the city of Camiachi. She also travels to Arequipa twice a month, carrying sheep meat and potato products and quinoa, which she sells at the various markets within that city. She takes advantage of her trips to Arequipa to see her children, who live there.

She belongs to the communal bank “22nd of September” which granted her an initial loan of 300 soles, which she invested into the purchase of three sheep. With this loan of 1,000 soles, to be repaid over four months, she will buy ten sheep to raise and sell. She has dedicated herself to this business since she was a youngster, starting with the sale of products such as chuño (a potato derivative), potatoes, and beans.

She tells us that, being a member of a communal bank, she has learned to be punctual and responsible about her loan payments. Her dreams are to buy a house in Arequipa, for her children continue their studies and to continue successfully with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Nicolasa tiene 38 años, estudio hasta primero D. secundaria, habla el aymará y entienD. el castellano, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, uno D. ellos ya es independiente y tres están estudiando en la escuela, su casa queda en la Parcialidad Maquera D. la provincia D. El Collao. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. ovejas, en las ferias D. Ilave los domingos y los viernes en Camicachi. También viaja a la Región D. Arequipa dos veces al mes, llevando carne D. ovino, productos como chuño, papa, quinua, que los venD. en los diferentes mercados D. la ciudad y a su vez aprovecha en visitar a sus hijos que se encuentran en esa ciudad. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “22 D. Setiembre” donD. tuvo un crédito inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra D. tres ovejas. Con este crédito D. S/.1000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 4 meses; comprarà diez ovejas D. engorD., las cuales serán vendidas; ella se dedica a esta actividad desD. muy joven, inicio con la venta D. productos como chuño, papa, habas. Ella nos cuenta que siendo socia del Banco Comunal aprendió a ser puntual y responsable en sus pagos. El sueño que ella tiene es comprar a una casa en Arequipa, que sus hijos sigan estudiando y trabajen y ella pueda seguir con el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of sheep.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu  is a 40-year-old married woman with 3 children, aged 12, 7, and 5 years. She has been selling chips and fruit since 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $US400 from her sales.
 
Tatu  now hopes for a loan to expand her business by increasing her stock.

loans.use: To expand inventory

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en:
Mr. Voeun R., 28, is businessman who sells oxen and buffalo. He buys oxen from farmers and stocks to resell for a profit. He has been growing his business since 2005 and earns approximately around 12,000 Riel (US$3) per day. 

His wife, Mrs. Sokhon Pat, 28, is farmer who grows rice. Voeun lives with his wife and two children in Ptasrong Commune, Pursat Province. 

To sustain and improve his business, Voeun needs a loan of 2,000,000 Riel ($500 USD) to use as capital for his oxen and buffalo-selling business.

loans.use: To use as capital for his ox and buffalo-selling business

loans.name: Channoeurn's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group loan and there are three members. Channoeurn P. is group leader and is a garment worker in Chak Angre Krom Commune in the Phnom Penh City. She can earn US$120 per month. Channoeurn is married to Mr. Pov Khim, 33, also a garment worker, and they have one child. For another source of income, Channoeurn needs a loan of US$150 to repair her house to rent and she sees that the majority of her clients are garment workers. The loan will allow her to increase her family's income. The other two group members are:

1- Touch C., who grows vegetables to sell and she needs a loan of US$250 to purchase more seeds to grow vegetables.

2- Phalla P., who is a widowed garment worker and needs a loan of US$150 to add to her saved money to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to drive to her work.

They are all people who live in Prek Talong Village, Chak Angre Krom Commune, Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To decorate her house to rent

loans.name: Hien Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đinh Thị Hiền 43 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1994. Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đều đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi, ban đầu do số vốn còn ít nên gia đình chị tập trung vốn vào đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn nái, chăn nuôi phát triển gia đình chị đã mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi ngoài chăn nuôi lợn nái gia đình chị còn nuôi thêm lợn thịt, gà và ngan. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang nuôi 30 con lợn thịt, 2 lợn nái, 200 con vừa gà và ngan thu nhập hàng năm từ chăn nuôi bình quân 40.000.000đ/ năm. Chị có 3 con, 1 con đang đi học, 2 con hiện đã đi làm thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hien Thi D., 43 years old, joined the TYM fund in 1994. She used all the loans to invest in livestock. At first, when the loans were still small, she focused on raising female pigs. Later, she expanded the size of the farm, including male pigs, and poultry. At the moment, her family is taking care of 30 male pigs, 2 female pigs, and 200 poultry. The business brings in annual income of 40,000,000 Vietnamese Dong. She has 3 children, one of whom is still going to school. The other two are working and have an income of 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. She plans to make the next loan of 9,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in more livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: invest in livestock

loans.name: Redina

texts.en:
Redina C. A. is a member of the Azucenas (“White Lilies”) Village Bank. Redina is 32 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. She and her husband sell shoes in the April 12th Market in the city of Ayacucho. They own two market stands, one of which they own, while the other is rented. They work every day of the week, and buy the shoes in Lima. Her husband also travels around to different regional fairs.  Redina needs a loan of $650 to buy sneakers and children’s shoes.  Redina’s dreams are to educate her children, to buy a car to transport her products, and to improve her home. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow.

loans.use: To buy sneakers and children's shoes

loans.name: Hoang Thi Ha Group

texts.vi:
Hoàng Thị Hà sinh năm 1964. ( Mã số:010107050001). Vợ chồng chị có hai con còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học. Chồng chị là công nhân có thu  nhập ổn định. Ngoài công việc đồng áng, chị còn đi chợ bán đồ ăn sẵn( giò, chả, nem,…). Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng. chị là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có:
 Nguyễn Thị T.ềm sinh năm 1972 ( Mã số: 010107050005 ). Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đi chợ bán hang quần áo. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 250.000 vnđ.
 Đào Thị Phượng sinh năm1977, ( Mã số: 010107050004 )  Chị tham gia mức vay: 3.270.000 vnđ để mở để chăn nuôi gà đẻ trứng.
 Hoàng Thị M. sinh năm 1978, ( Mã số: 010107050006)  Chị là công nhân có thu nhập theo tháng. Chị vay vốn mức vay: 3.270.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi.
 Hoàng Thị D. sinh năm 1972 ( Mã số: 010107050003 )  ngoài chăn nuôi, chị còn trồng cây cảnh. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 250.000 vnđ/ngày. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi.
 Nguyễn Thị Hạnh sinh năm 1978 ( Mã số: 010107050002 ). Gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp. Ngoài ra chị còn chồng cây cảnh, cây ăn quả. Chị vay mức: 4.142.000 vnđ để mua giống cây trồng và cây ăn quả.

loans.use: raising animals

loans.name: Claudia Pamela

texts.es:
CLAUDIA PAMELA P. CÁRDENAS, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Guerreras”, ubicado en el Jr. Fernando Stall N° 187 en la ciudad de Pucallpa, en el Distrito de callería, tiene 21 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora, no tiene niños, es soltera, su actividad es la cocina y repostería.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró moldes para hacer tortas y galletas y venderlos en un billar en el que trabaja su papá.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá para comprar más moldes, y materia prima para realizar su preparación como: un honor moderno, para tortas, esencias, azúcar, brinda servicios de alimentos bufetes, comidas varias.

Está muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos, porque le da un gran apoyo a las mujeres para poder trabajar.
texts.en:
Claudia Pamela P. Cardenas belongs to the Communal Bank 'Las Guerreras," located on Jr. Fernando Stall No. 187 in the city of Pucallpa, in the Calleria district. She is 21 years old, and is a very hardworking young owman,. She does not have children, is single, and her activity is cooking and baking. The first loan she received was for 200 Nuevos Soles, she bought molds to make cake and chickens and sold them at her father's work. With this loan of 1500 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in buying more molds and raw material to complete her perparation like: a modern oven for cakes, spices, sugar, and various foods. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos, because it gives a lot of support to women to be able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying molds and ingredients for cakes

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Норов Абдулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Возратс 33 года , женат и имеет двоих детей. Имеет высшее образование, по специальности учитель. Работает на центральном рынке района. Имеет небольшой грузовой автомобиль , который использует в качестве такси. Кредит планирует получить для ремонта автомашины. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdullo N. lives in Gissar. He is 33 years old and is married with two children. He has a university degree and is a teacher by training. He works at the central market as a taxi driver in a small truck that he uses as a taxi. He is applying for a loan in order to do car maintenance. He would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: car maintenance

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.fr: Rosaline S. est revendeuse de légumes et fruits au marché d’Atakpamé. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 4 ans et elle demeure sa principale source de revenus. Son cativité consiste à acheter les marchandises dans les fermes auprès des agriculteurs et venir les livrer aux détaillants. Avec ce crédit, elle espère augmenter la taille de son activité pour mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. Agée de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants.
texts.en:
Rosaline S. sells vegetables and fruit at the Atakpamé market. She has been in this business for four years, and it remains her principal source of income. Her work consists in buying farm produce from growers and coming to deliver them to retailers. With this loan, she hopes to expand her business to respond to the needs of her customers. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of three.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Flora Idania

texts.es:
La microempresaria Flora Idania C. C. tiene 30 años de edad es casada con dos hijos menores de edad los cuales estudian en nivel primario y secundario. Esta joven madre se dedica a la administración de una pulpería que tiene en el barrio Santa Rosa de esta ciudad de Bluefields desde hace 4 años. Con este negocio aporta para el sustento diario de su hogar, ya que aunque su marido trabaja su salario no alcanza para todos los gastos.

Esta microempresaria habita en un sector en donde no existen muchas pulperías por lo cual le permite obtener buenas ventas, sin embargo las utilidades son pocas ya que no puede comprar los productos en cantidades, por tal razón necesita financiamiento para poder obtener a un menor precio las mercaderías y obtener mejores ganancias.

Requiere se le financie para comprar: 3 quintales de Arroz americano a US 64 cada quintal, 3 quintales de azúcar a US 30 cada quintal, 5 quintales de  harina a US 45 cada quintal, 5 bolsones de  papel higiénico a US 35 cada bolsón, 4 cajas de sopa maruchan a US 12 cada caja, 3 cajas de leche la lechera a US 45 cada caja  y 3 quintales de frijoles a US 45 cada quintal.
texts.en:
Micro-entrepreneur Flora Idania C. C. is 30 years old, married and has 2 young children who are studying at primary and secondary school. This young mother has run a small grocery store in the Santa Rosa neighbourhood in Bluefields for 4 years. This business helps her provide for her family; although her husband works, his salary is not enough to cover all their expenses

Since this micro-entrepreneur lives in an area where there aren’t many grocery stores, her sales are good. However, her profits are small since she isn’t able to purchase products in large quantities. She needs this loan to get merchandise at a lower price and to make better profits.

She is requesting this loan to purchase: 3 quintals of American rice at $64 each, 3 quintals of sugar at $30 each, 5 quintals of flour at $45 each, 5 packages of toilet paper at $35 each, 4 cases of instant soup at $12 each, 3 cases of La Lechera milk at $45 each and 3 quintals of beans at $45 each.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, flour, toilet paper, instant soup, milk and beans.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: one son and four daughters. She says her son dropped out of school for no apparent reason. The rest are still in the junior high and the primary schools. She says she lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Yaa works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a retired agriculturalist.

Yaa is a trader. She runs a provision store in the market square. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns.

Yaa has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful she will achieve this expansion.

loans.use: To procure goods in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Ni Putu Oka Sumawartini

texts.en: Ni Putu Oka Sumawartini - (DNR.M-0669) is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Candikusuma - Melaya. She is married and has two infant-aged children. Ni Putu Oka Sumawartini raises pigs for sale and has been engaged in this business for over 10 years earning approximately 200,000 IDR a month. In 2008, Ni Putu Oka Sumawartini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her 2nd loan from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni Putu Oka Sumawartini - (DNR.M-0669) merupakan 28 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Candikusuma - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia balita. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Putu Oka Sumawartini memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Putu Oka Sumawartini sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu Oka Sumawartini menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2008, Ni Putu Oka Sumawartini bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Putu Oka Sumawartini telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Putu Oka Sumawartini berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Dorothea

texts.en: Dorothea A. is from the village of Canicapan, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old, married, and has six adult children. Dorothea raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Dorothea joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Dorothea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Dorothea is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Samina Muhammad Arshad Group

texts.en:
Majeedan begum baji wants a loan to buy goats for her butcher shop. Khalida parveen baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Nargis baji wants a loan to buy another sewing machine for her tailoring center. Haleema baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her dairy business.

Samina baji has been a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband's name is M. A.. He has a business selling spare auto parts. Samina baji knows that it’s very hectic work and has spent long hours been on this work. She takes care of him and spends her time in service of him. She is applying for a loan to buy more spare auto parts to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy spare auto parts to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario B. is requesting a loan of PHP30,000 from Kiva lenders to aid in the development of her general store, hoping to eventually expand it in order to increase her daily income for her family. She has also been managing a hog-raising business for 10 years.

Rosario, 52, is married to Pedro, a simple farmer in their village, and they are blessed with five children: Arnel, now 32 years old; Arnold, 29 years old; Aaron, 27 years old; Karen, 22, and Romalyn, who is 11 years old. Two of them are already married and live separately while the other three are still single. Romalyn, the youngest, is the only one who is studying. Rosario has always wanted a better life for her children, so she is doing her best to become successful in her chosen livelihoods.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira M. grows rice. She is 42 years old and has four children. Her husband, Raul, is also a farmer. Both of them work at the farm to provide for the family needs.

She has applied for a loan of 7,000 Php from Community Economic Ventures Inc. because she needs additional capital for her business.  She plans to buy fertilizers and chemicals in order to have an abundant harvest.

CEVI provides various services. Aside from loans, all CEVI clients including Elvira M. receive training and an insurance coverage package.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 89353&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Yolanda es socia del Bancomunal Mi buen Pastor.
Yolanda   se dedica a la venta D.  productos D. belleza por  catalogo, también hace marcianos y  los venD. en su casa, también ella se esta dedicando a la venta D. ropa por pedidos.  
Los prestamos son D. mucha ayuda  pueD. invertir.
Ella necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, para la compra D. ropa.  
El sueño D. Yolanda  tener un puesto  propio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Mi Buen Pastor Community Bank. She makes a living selling beauty products via catalog and also makes marcianos (traditional regional popsicles) and sells them out of her home. She also sells clothing by order. The loans she has received have helped her a lot in investing in her businesses. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (approximately $350) to purchase clothing. Yolanda's dream is to have her own sales post in the market. Previous loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 89353&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
