Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Codou

texts.fr: Codou  D. est une femme de 40 ans, divorcée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vend des fruits de saison et actuellement fait du commerce de mangues. Les revenus générés lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Codou D. is a 40-year-old woman who is divorced and the mother of four children. She sells seasonal fruit and is currently doing commerce in mangoes. The income generated enables her to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For selling fruit in season

loans.name: Elyse

texts.fr: Cette dame a ouvert une grande boutique de vente de pagnes de qualité. Elle a ouvert sa boutique l’année dernière grâce à l’aide financière de son mari. Sa boutique se situe dans le quartier de Baguida à Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne le plus souvent au Grand Marché de Lomé. Actuellement elle dispose de beaucoup de vendeuses ambulantes, ce qui fait qu’elle arrive à vite écouler son stock. Beaucoup de femmes fonctionnaires et même les grandes femmes d’affaire de la capitale viennent faire leur choix de pagnes dans sa boutique. Elle a un réel besoin de renouveler son stock en ce moment ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 46 pièces de pagnes de qualité Hitarget, 02 pièces de pagnes de qualité moyenne Lessi, 15 pièces de pagnes Bazin. Elle est mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This lady opened a large store selling quality pagnes (colorful West African cloth).  She opened it last year, thanks to her husband's financial help.  Her store is located in the Baguida district in Lomé.  She usually stocks up at the Grand Market of Lomé.  Currently she has many saleswomen going door-to-door, which means she manages to sell her inventory quickly. Many women civil servants and even the major business women in the capital come to her store and have their choice.  At present, she has a real need to replenish her stock.  For this reason, she's requesting a WAGES loan to buy 46 bolts of quality Hitarget pagnes, 2 bolts of medium quality Lessi pagnes, and 15 bolts of Bazin pagnes.  She is the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy quality cloth

loans.name: Bilsam

texts.en:
Bilsam Bisoy is a rice farmer in Bunawan Agusan Del Sur.  He was blessed with three children. His eldest child is four years old and ready for preschool. He would like to be a success in his rice farm business. 

He is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to purchase the farming necessities to support the growth of rice plants.

He likes CEVI because of the low interest rate of 2% a month.  He is impressed by CEVI.

loans.use: Farm support

loans.name: Quamvi Amétépé

texts.fr: Cet homme est marié et a 02 enfants à sa charge. Pour subvenir aux besoins de son foyer, il a ouvert en 2003 dans le quartier d’Attikpa à Lomé une boutique de vente des produits d’alimentation générale, dans laquelle il vend aussi certains produits de beauté pour femmes. Cet homme est plein de dynamisme et a une passion pour ce commerce. Beaucoup de ses clients apprécient le bon accueil et le sourire avec lesquels il les accueille. Il approvisionne presque tout son voisinage. Il souhaite en ce moment renouveler son stock ; pour cela il voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 cartons de savons en poudre pour la lessive, 15 cartons de savons de toilettes, 05 cartons de pâtes dentifrices, 20 cartons de tomates en boîtes et bien d’autres produits indispensables pour son commerce.
texts.en:
This man is marrid and he has 2 children in his care. In order to fill the needs of his household, in 2003 he opened a general food store in the Attikpa district of Lome. There he also sells certain beauty products for women. This man is full of energy and he has a passion for his business. His clients appreciate the good customer service and the smile with which he serves them. He supplies to almost his entire neighborhood. Currently he wants to resupply his stocks. For this he would like to have a loan from Wages (Kiva Field Partner) in order to purchase 15 boxes of powdered laundry soap, 15 boxes of bath soaps, 5 cartons of toothpaste, 20 cartons of boxes tomatoes, as well as other daily use products for his business.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food items.

loans.name: Libertad

texts.en:
Libertad is 82 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Libertad receives a monthly pension of 6,800 and operates a cocoland receiving a monthly income of 2,000 per month. She is from the town of Calamba, Misamis Occidental.

In 2009, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Libertad is requesting a new loan of 5000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase materials for her housing activity. This will be Libertad's first loan from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for  housing purposes

loans.name: Liliana Agustina

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio está ubicado en el cantón Montecristi en la bella y productiva provincia de Manabí en la región costa del Ecuador,  ésta región se caracteriza por la elaboración de artesanías sobre todo se tejen los mejores sombreros de paja toquilla  del mundo, sus platos típicos, la belleza natural y la amabilidad de la gente. Este banco lo formaron mujeres emprendedoras en busca de una mejor calidad de vida junto a sus familias.

La señora Liliana  P. es socia del  banco comunal Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio, vive en el cantón Montecristi, está casada pero su esposo  y dos de sus hijos vive en Estados Unidos desde hace quince años

 
Liliana se dedica a los quehaceres del  hogar y a la venta de prendas de vestir tanto a  amigos y familiares, ofrece mercadería para damas, caballeros y niños, prendas como blusas, ropa intima, pantalones licras y mas, trabaja a crédito para dar facilidad a sus clientes, los cobros los realiza cada quince días con ese dinero compra mercadería nuevamente para entregar los pedios pendientes de sus clientes.

En esta ocasión la señora Liliana esta solicitando un crédito a la fundación para comprar pantalones jeans, camisas, carteras, calzado para damas, caballeros y niños para mantener un stock surtido  para la época navideña
texts.en:
The Women of the New Millennium Communal Bank is located in the Montecristi division of the beautiful and bountiful province of Manabí, located in Ecuador’s coastal region. This area is known for its handicrafts (the best straw hats in the world), traditional dishes, natural beauty, and friendly people. This Communal Bank consists of enterprising women who are looking to provide their families with a better quality of life.

Sra. Liliana P. is a member of the Women of the New Millennium Communal Bank and a resident of Montecristi. She is married, but her husband and two children have been living in the United States for 15 years.

Liliana engages in her household chores and her business selling clothing to friends and family. She offers clothing for men, women, and children. Her merchandise includes blouses, undergarments, spandex pants, and other items. Liliana works on credit to make it easy for her customers. She collects payments every two weeks and uses the money to buy goods to fulfill her outstanding customer orders.

On this occasion, Sra. Liliana is requesting a loan from the Foundation to buy jeans, shirts, handbags, and shoes for men, women, and children. She wants to maintain an assortment of products for the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an assortment of clothing for the holiday season

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus S. U., tiene la edad de 41 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tiene 16, 12 y 2 años respectivamente. El  quiere comprar fertilizantes y otros materiales para la producion para mejorar su finca. Además, su finca es de 3.5 hectárea. Dos hectarías son de cafe y el otro es de maís y frijoles. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR.  También, el ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales pero hace varios años que no lo hace. El no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. El también tiene el deseo de tener mas ingresos economicos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y poder mandar sus hijos a estudiar. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jesus S. U., 41, is married and has three children, who are his main priority in life. His children are 16, 12, and 2-years-old, respectively. He wants to buy fertilizer and other supplies to improve his farm's production. His farm is 3.5 hectares of which two are planted with coffee and the rest with corn and beans. He has farmed for several years and wants to see his farm grow. This is his first loan received from FUDECOSUR. He has negotiated loans in the past with state banks but hasn't done so in several years. He had no problems with his property but does wish to see his farm be productive. He also hopes for increased earnings in order to improve his family's economic condition and to be able to send his children to school. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other supplies for his crops.

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is a 32 year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife. Mhammad has been driving a van since 2000. He transports students, employees and passers-by. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mhammad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van and save some money to start a new business that will help him increase his income. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

Mhammad is special in his work because of his punctuality. Mhammad decided to start his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans to improve his business.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: Natividad Natalia

texts.es: Natividad tiene 56 años, es viuda, vive con sus hijos en su vivienda. Ella inicio el negocio de venta de comida hace aproximadamente 3 años, así mismo acaba de iniciarse en la venta de golosinas. Natividad atiende su negocio de manera muy acogedora por este motivo es que los clientes que en la mayoría son estudiantes universitarios  los que concurren a su negocio. Natividad requiere el crédito para la compra de mercadería y así poder implementar un poco más su negocio, y así poder reconstruir su vivienda ya que se vio afectada por el terremoto.
texts.en:
Natividad is 56 years old, a widow, and lives with her children in her own home. She began a business selling food approximately 3 years ago. And, now, she has begun to sell sweets. Natividad attends her business in a very welcoming way. For this reason, her customers, who are in the majority university students, come to her business. Natividad needs a loan to buy merchandise and, thus, be able to expand her business. And then she can rebuild her house, which was damaged by the earthquake.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE TO SELL

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
El Sr. Santos Vive en casa familiar,  en la localidad de puerto Rico municipio de El torno, distante 39 Km de la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, su actividad principal es la servicio de mototaxista en la comunidad, también tiene  como profesion  educador, es soltero con mucha ganas de seguir superándose, por lo cual el destino del crédito fue para aumentar y comprar un vehiculo, y a si poder construir su propia vivienda y formar un hogar. 
						
Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Santos lives in his family home en the town of Puerto Rico in the El Torno district, about 39 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. He runs a motorcycle taxi service in his town; he is also trained as a teacher. He is single and really wants to improve his life; that is why he is requesting this loan in order to purchase a vehicle to eventually build his own house and form a home. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in him by offering him a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is a 55-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Moussa has owned a grocery store for two years. He sells canned food, candies, drinks, pasta and rice, bread, home cleaning products, etc…as well as fruits and vegetables. Moussa is good at his work because of his experience. His clients are mainly his friends and neighbors. 

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. When Moussa first started his business, he had some financial issues and he had to face competition. He decided to start his business because he wanted to have independent work, and because he had experience in the field. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr:
Madame Ndeye N. est une femme âgée de 50 ans. Elle habite a Bambilor et est membre de la caisse depuis janvier 2010. 
Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle évolue dans le commerce de légumes (tomate mil, carottes, etc.) depuis très longtemps. Elle pratique aussi la vente d’eau dans un robinet publique depuis 4 ans. Elle n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit. La gérance du robinet publique lui procure des ressources importantes et cette gérance elle l’a obtenu par le biais du chef de village. Madame N. a été victime d’un détournement de son encaisse mensuelle durant son absence par celui qu’elle avait confie la gestion. Par conséquent elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour payer son arriéré de facture. Ce crédit lui permettra de reprendre son activiste de vente d’eau aux familles environnantes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndeye N. is a 50 year-old woman who lives in Bambilor. She is married and has four children. She joined the credit union in January 2010 and has never taken out a loan. She has been selling vegetables (tomatoes, carrots, etc.) for a very long time. For the past four years, she has also been selling water from a public faucet. The management of the public water faucet was assigned to her by the chief of the village and provides her with significant revenues. Mrs. N. was embezzled of her monthly cash payments by the person she had asked to stand in for her while she was away. As a consequence, she is requesting a loan of 150 000 francs to settle her overdue bill. This loan will allow her to resume the sale of water to families in the neighbourhood.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinforce her business

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves N. is a married woman who supports her family with her general store and jewelry retailing. She lives in Cabangahan, Siaton, Negros Oriental with her husband and their two children. Her children are 10 and 12 years old and are currently going to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and her buy and sell jewelry business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 11,000.

Nieves is now borrowing PHP 13,000 so that she can expand her general store and her buy and sell jewelry business. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Nieves aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Mrs. Pheap H., 44, lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo Province. She is a noodle seller in the local village and her husband, Mr. Noeurn Chear, is a farmer who owns 1.3-hectares of land to cultivate rice to support his family. Through these activities, the couple supports three children: one is a clothes seller who earns a small salary and the others attend school far from their home. In order to improve their children's education, Mrs. Pheap H. decided to seek a loan to buy a new motorbike. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to support their children's education

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en: Mwanaidi is a 30 year old married woman with two daughters, who are 9 years old and 9 months old. Her older daughter is attending fourth grade in school. She has been running her poultry business raising broilers (which are chicken for consumption) for five years already and owns 200 chicken currently. With the 70,000 KSH loan she hopes to repair her poultry farm which was damaged recently by termites, and buy more chicken. Her customers are mainly hotels and restaurants. She hopes to start another business someday, perhaps in cosmetics. Mwanaidi describes herself as a hardworking woman and hopes to provide her children with a good life.

loans.use: More chicken and to repair poultry farm

loans.name: Kinyugunyu Turibamwe, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
K. Scovia is a friendly and very hardworking single lady with several orphans she takes care of.

Scovia’s business story began way back in 2007. She started a tailoring business in Kyinyugunyu trading centre, Ibanda district, and this earns her a profit of seventy thousand shillings on a monthly basis.

This loan is to help Scovia purchase more stock of good-quality materials that are eye-catching to bring customers into her business. With that she will be able to realize more sales and profits that will trigger her development economically, and enable her to meet the day-to-day life and general welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more good-quality materials

loans.name: El Futuro 1,2,3,4 Group

texts.en:
Yahaira is the coordinator of her group El Futuro (The Future), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the areas surrounding La Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their three children.

Yahaira is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, running a beauty salon, by purchasing the necessary shampoos, conditioners, dyes and straighteners. She will use the profits to invest in the education of her children by purchasing school supplies. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase conditioner, shampoo, straightener, and hair dye

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various cosmetics

loans.name: Ahoto Firi Nyame Group

texts.en:
Sakina describes herself as a very focused woman. She is 45 years old and she is the leader of the “Ahoto Firi Nyame” (translated as 'Good living comes from God') borrower group. Sakina is a petty trader who has been selling foodstuffs like maize, plantains, and peppers for the past 4 years. She also engages in farming as her secondary business to make extra income. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase plantains, bags of maize, and baskets of peppers in bulk. She dreams of being able to extend her trade to major market centers in the country.  She is married to a farmer and together they have two children who are 4 and 12 years old. Sakina hopes to support her children to attain an advanced education.

The other members are also engaged in trades such as food selling, maize and rice selling and the sale of footwear.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: In the small town of Karuguuza, Uganda, lives a young man called Jimmy. Jimmy, like majority of his village mates, is business oriented and sells the local brew which is known as waragi. Jimmy is 30 years old and married. He says business is good so far; only that transportation of the brew is still a challenge, as roads are bad and vehicles are scarce. He says he would like to have bigger stores so as to be a bigger supplier of the local brew. This is Jimmy’s first loan cycle and he intends to purchase local brew to sell.

loans.use: To purchase local brew to sell

loans.name: Joesita

texts.en:
Joesita P. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan, South Cotabato, Philippines. She is 44 years old. Joesita is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Joesita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Joesita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joesita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joesita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Joesita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. is a 56-year-old married who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  a general store and selling personal collection products. She lives in Prk 4, Brgy Cabacungan, La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1993 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and personal collection sales, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. 

Since her business is located near the municipal school, she has added different kinds of food for kids to her product offerings. Mary is now borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she has additional working capital.  This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Mary aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma vive en la comunidad de Cajamarca junto con su esposo y sus siete hijos de las cuales tres son independientes y cuatro todavía depende de ella.

La Sra. Vilma se dedica;  a la venta de chicha, a la venta de abarrotes y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y cuyes. Hace cuatro meses que abrió una pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde también vende cerveza y muchas cosas más. La pueden encontrar en su tienda  que está ubicado en su domicilio, los 7 días de las semana, desde las 6 de  la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche o hasta que se agote el suministro de pan. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Vilma que espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc.

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Vilma pertenece desde hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Vilma lives in the community of Cajamarca with her husband and their 7 children, of whom 3 are independent and 4 still depend upon her. Vilma sells chicha (the local home-made beer) and groceries, plus she raises animals such as hens and guinea pigs. Just 4 months ago, she opened a small food store where she sells beer and many other things. You can find her in her store, located in her home, 7 days a week, from 6:00 in the morning until 7:00 in the evening, or until she runs out of bread. With this loan, Vilma hopes to receive 1,500 new sols. She would like to use the money to buy more merchandise, including, for example, rice, sugar, beans, etc. The “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” Communal Bank has functioned for 3 ½ years. Vilma has belonged to this communal bank for 3 years and its going well. The members are devotees of Taytacho Ccoyllority (The Lord of the Brilliant Snow) and for this reason, they gave the bank that name.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE SUCH AS RICE, SUGAR, BEANS, ETC. FOR HER NEW STORE

loans.name: Perla Rosana

texts.es:
Perla, tiene 23 años ella es técnico en instrumentación quirúrgica  y está cursando el tercer año de la carrera de Licenciatura en enfermería en la U.N.I.S.A.L.

Ella  tiene 9 hermanos mayores quienes ya culminaron sus estudios y ella es la única que está  estudiando actualmente en la familia.
Su madre es ama de casa y su padre es comerciante.
Perla actualmente trabaja como técnica enfermera en I.P.S., donde se encuentra adquiriendo experiencia y al mismo tiempo obtiene un ingreso para sus estudios.
Ella  viaja todos los días en bus aproximadamente 1 hora hasta su Facultad ya que la misma queda a 40 km de su casa.
Perla  tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera y ejercer su profesión y ayudar a su familia, especialmente a su madre quien es una mujer muy sacrificada.
Perla quiere culminar sus estudios como sus hermano y así progresar en la vida.
La carrera de enfermería actualmente en Paraguay tiene buena salida laboral ya que muchas de la terminan sus estudios en el país, viajan hasta otros países para ejercer la profesión.
Actualmente tiene algunos gasto en cuanto a materiales de estudio y transporte, además de la mensualidad que debe pagar ya que asiste en una Facultad privada, para cubrir estos gasto solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
Perla, age 23, is a surgical instrument technician. She is in her third year of studying for a nursing degree in the U.N.I.S.A.L (San Lorenzo University). She has nine older siblings who have finished their education. She is the only one in the family who is still in school. Her mother is a housewife, and her father is a merchant. Perla currently works as a nursing technician at I.P.S. (Health and Welfare Institute). She is gaining experience there, and she is getting income for her education at the same time. Everyday she travels approximately one hour by bus to get to her school, which is 40 kilometers from her house. Perla has a great desire to finish her career studies, practice her profession, and help her family. She especially wants to help her mother, who is a very self-sacrificing woman. Perla wants to complete her education like her siblings in order to progress in life. Currently there are good job opportunities for those in the nursing profession in Paraguay. Many people finish their studies in the country and travel to other countries to practice their profession. She currently has some expenses for educational materials, transportation, and monthly payments that she needs to pay because she goes to a private school. She is requesting the loan to cover these expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two books, pay for transportation, and for the montly payments

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia P. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Ignacia is married. To make a living, Ignacia owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Ignacia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ignacia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ignacia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ignacia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Niyomwizero Group

texts.fr:
Véronique I. est une femme commerçante âgée de 37 ans qui habite la localité de Gatumba  dans la Province de Bujumbura Rural. Elle fait le commerce des produits alimentaires dans un restaurant qu’elle tient à la frontière avec le Congo(RDC) voisin depuis 10ans. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau du secondaire mais n’a pas pu obtenir son diplome.Son mari est un fonctionnaire. Elle arrivait au 4e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame, mais elle intègre maintenant le crédit solidaire. 

Elle est mère de 4enfants qui sont adultes âgés de plus de 20 ans qui étudient à l’Université.
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  et varier son business en ajoutant des pagnes qu’elle compte acheter et revendre aux clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Elle a préféré demander le crédit à Turame car elle a beaucoup d’opportunités de devenir indépendante financièrement. Elle espère avoir un grand capital dans l’avenir qui lui permettra de faire un grand business. 

 Elle  est une des membres du groupe  solidaire« Niyomwizero».
texts.en:
Véronique I. is a 37 year old business woman who lives in the town of Gatumba in the province of rural Bujumbura.  For ten years, she has sold basic foodstuffs in a restaurant that she runs on the border with neighboring Congo (DRC).  She attended school through the secondary level but did not receive her diploma. Her husband is a civil servant. She is in her her fourth cycle of group loans with Turame, but now also incorporates an individual loan.

She is the mother of four adult children, each over 20 years old, who study at the university.

She is requesting this Kiva loan to increase her capital and diversify her business by adding pieces of cloth which she can buy and resell to customers and thus be able to increase her savings.  She preferred to ask for the loan from Turame because she has many opportunities to become financially independent.  She hopes to have a large stock of capital in the future, which will allow her to have a large business practice.

She is one of the members of the group "Niyomwizero."

loans.use: increasing capital and diversifying business in order to increase savings

loans.name: Blanca Ysolina

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a mas de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año aproximadamente a la venta de frutas en un puesto ubicado en el interior del mercado de su localidad. El negocio nació de la idea de obtener una fuente estable de ingresos con los cuales sustentar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a que el mercado donde expende sus productos es frecuentado por los pobladores de la zonas rurales del distrito.

Blanca desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir un mayor numero de ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Blanca es una joven alegre y de trato amable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y poder ampliar su puesto poco a poco.
texts.en:
Blanca, 28, is single and lives with her family in Mochumí district, a farming area belonging to Lambayeque province, located over half an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For about a year she has been selling fruit in a stand in her local market.  The business idea arose because she wanted to have a stable source of income both for her personal expenses and to help with family support.  The business is well received because the market where she sells her products is frequented by people living in the rural areas of the district.

Blanca wants to expand her business buying more products so that sales and profits will increase.  Thus she has deemed it advisable to request her first, 2000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

Blanca is a cheerful young woman with a kind attitude.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and to gradually enlarge her sales stand.

loans.use: To buy more stock merchandise.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A., 24-year-old widowed mother of three children aged 10, 8, and 5 years, is a businesswoman who has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last two years. Rose learned about KADET LTD from market awareness done by KADET staff in Narok town, and this will be her second loan with which she will buy more fruits and vegetables to increase her stock. With the anticipated profit from this loan, she hopes to rent a permanent building to operate her business from.

Despite her being a widow, Rose is hardworking and determined to achieve her set goal.

loans.use: To spend Ksh 20,000 to buy more bananas, spinach and a variety of fruits

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras” ubicado en el distrito D. Cabanilla, provincia D. Lampa, departamento D. Puno, tiene 50 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y con 02 hijos (01 dependiente), la señora tiene estudios D. educación primaria incompleta.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para incrementar el capital D.  su negocio D. venta D. prendas D. vestir.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar más mercaderías para su negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro es construir una casa en Juliaca y mejorar su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y  la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Domitila is a member of the “Mujeres Triumfadoras” (Triumphant Women) Communal Bank.  It is located in the Cabanilla district, Lampa province, Puno department.  She is 50 years old, married, and has two children (one independent).  She did not complete elementary school.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles.  She used the money to increase her working capital to buy articles of clothing.

She is requesting a new loan for 2,000 soles.  She will use the money to buy more merchandise for her business.

Her dream for the future is to build a house in Juliaca and to improve her business.

What she likes the most about her communal bank are the meetings and the punctuality.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal de “Libertad” está iniciando su primer ciclo en el centro focal de Germán Busch. Esta banca comunal cuenta con la participación de nueve integrantes, las mismas que desembolsaran  por primera vez. La mesa directiva para este ciclo tiene como presidenta a la señora Asunta, como tesorera Martha y como secretaria de actas a la señora Alicia. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: venta de cinturones, venta de café, venta de carne, venta de chompas, ventas de cosméticos, venta de chompas, tienda de barrio, venta de carne, venta de juguetes.

La presidenta, la señora Asunta es una mujer joven, convive con su pareja y tiene cinco hijos.  
Con respecto al negocio de la señora presidenta, ella tiene el negocio de venta de cinturones. 
Ella compra cinturones por mayor y los vende por menor de manera ambulante por la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto.
Lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer es la oportunidad de contar con la atención en salud y la posibilidad de ahorrar.
Las señoras de la banca comunal "Libertad" salen en la foto con una visita que las acompaña.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Libertad” or ‘Liberty’ is starting on its first loan cycle in the Germán Busch focal center. This communal bank has the participation of new members who will be taking out loans for the first time. The board of directors for this loan cycle has Asunta as president, Martha as treasurer, and Alicia as secretary. The women’s businesses are all different. They include a neighborhood store and sales of belts, coffee, meat, sweaters, cosmetics, and games.

The president, Asunta, is a young woman who lives with her partner and five children. As for her business, Asunta has a business selling belts. She purchases wholesale belts and sells them retail in the Ceja market in the city of El Alto. 

What she likes best about Pro Mujer is the opportunity for health services and the possibility of saving money. 

The woman of the “Libertad” communal bank are shown in the photo during a meeting that they attend.

loans.use: To purchase belts

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret W. lives in the Kamwokya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  She lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.   

Margaret has been in the tailoring business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days a week. She sells her products from home, by means of retail.    She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of cloth. The main business challenges for Margaret include the rainy season and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations are to have her own tailoring school and to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van O., 35, is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1.60 per day. O. is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. Her husband is a recycler, earning an income of USD 4.10 per day. The family has to spend USD 70 on food, USD 2 on electricity, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month. 

O. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike to transport recyclable materials to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to transport recyclable materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: George Mutahi

texts.en:
George Mutahi N. is 52 years old, married to Joyce Wambui, and they have one child. He has farmed in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last ten years.

George was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend. This will be his second loan; he paid his first loan of 40,000 KES well and in good time. He plans to use his loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

In the future, George plans to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina, de 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Emilio de 30 años y su querido hijo Yonifer de 8 años, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. A través de estos años Delfina ha trabajado muy duro para que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad, todas las mañanas con la ayuda de su esposo, trabaja sus tierras, para que sean mas productivas. Los productos, como la papa y arveja que cultiva, lo vende en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde le ofrecen mejores precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta los mercados donde los vende. Con el tiempo, espera poder sembrar todas sus tierras, para poder incrementar su producción. Es el octavo crédito con MFP y quiere pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos, con lo cuales pueda mejorar su negocio, sabe que en su banco comunal la apoyaran y la guiaran, ya que es una socia muy querida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas, para mejorar la productividad de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Delfina is 30 years old and a very simple and hardworking woman.  She lives in a rented house with her husband Emilio, 30, and their beloved son Yonifer, who is 8.  They want to give him a better quality of life.

Delfina has worked very hard for many years to ensure that her crops are of a good quality.  Every morning her husband heps her work her land so it is more productive.  She sells the crops she grows, such as potatoes and peas, in the market in the city of Tarma, because that is where she can get the best prices.  The part of her work that she likes best is the harvest.  She has done this for 8 years and thinks the most difficult part is transporting her crops to the markets where they are sold.  In time she would like to plant all of her fields to increase her production.

This is her eighth loan with MFP and she wants to pay her loan back on time so that she can take out more loans that can help improve her business.  She knows that the community bank will support and guide her because she is a well-liked member of the group.  With the 2000 nuevos soles she is requesting, she will purchase fertilizer and insecticides to improve the productivity of her farm.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 32 years old, married and supports her family by operating two business ventures:  soft drinks and water refilling.  She lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her soft drinks and water refilling businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,600. Elsie is borrowing PHP 15,000 to fund her business operations. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elsie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more softdrinks to sell

loans.name: Livinston Jahir

texts.es:
Livinston Jahir M. J. tiene 24 años, Es soltero vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Livinston se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es superarse y mejorar su estilo de vida.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Livinston Jahir M. J. is 24 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He doesn't have any children.

The 'San José de los Amarillos' community bank is located in Amarillos community, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Livinston is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his products in the Murillo shopping area and sells his products in the same place.

Livinston is requesting this loan for growing corn and rice.  He would like to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his business such as insect infestations, plant disease and changes in the weather.  His dream is to get ahead in life and improve his lifestyle.

Livinston likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
Zoila Rosa M. G. tiene 37 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Zoila se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar la situación económica.

Le gustan las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Zoila Rosa M. G. is 37 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the Guaranda canton of Bolivar province. She has 5 children.

The members of the rural communal bank "Grupo de Mujeres Muschuc Nan" meet in the community of Guanto Cruz in the Guanujo parish in the canton of Guaranda. This communal bank has 22 members who farm raspberries and corn and raise poultry and dairy cows in order to make cheese.

Zoila cultivates raspberries and corn and raises poultry. She buys her products in Guaranda, and she sells her products in the Guaranda market.

She requests a loan to purchase supplies and animals to raise, and also to buy feed for the animals. The support of this loan will help her financially to obtain the supplies she needs. In her work she must deal with challenges such as pests, changing weather conditions and diseases that affect her crops. Her dream is to improve her economic situation.

She enjoys the festivals that are held in her community.

loans.use: to buy supplies and animals to raise, and feed for the animals

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La señora Luz, es socia del banco comunal Manos Unidas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos.
Lleva 11 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, todos estos años ha estado trabajando para implementar su negocio de venta de productos comestibles, pero hace algunos días toda su casa se inundó de agua y tuvieron que guardar toda la mercadería para poder limpiar, hecho que ha ocasionado una baja en sus ingresos..
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles, comprará: 1 caja de café en sobre, 1 caja de té, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de mayonesa,1 caja de vela, 1 paquete de sal, 1 caja de aceite, 5 paquetes de papel higiénico, ½ caja de conservas.
Espera que en algunas semanas pueda volver a su casa para abrir nuevamente su pequeño negocio.  Luz está muy agradecida  con Manuela Ramos por todos los años en que la viene apoyando.
texts.en:
Sra. Luz is a member of the Communal Bank “Manos Unidas” (United Hands) which is in the District of Calleria in the Department of Ucayali. She is 49 years old, married, and has five children.

Luz has worked with the loans from Manuela Ramos for eleven years. Through all these years, she has worked in her business selling food products. A few days ago, her entire house was flooded so she had to store all of her merchandise during the cleanup process. As a result of this event, her income has decreased.

With this new loan of 2500 PEN, she will buy one case of coffee, one case of tea, one sack of sugar, one sack of rice, one case of mayonnaise, one box of candles, one packet of salt, one case of oil, five boxes of toilet paper, and a half case of preserves. Luz hopes that she will be able to return home in a few weeks and reopen her small business. She is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for all the years in which she has received assistance.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Marina Lizzeth

texts.es: La Sra. Marina requiere  de  nuestro  apoyo para  realizar   su proyecto  ya  que ella decea invertir en  la  compra de mercancía para la apertura de una tienda de abarrotes ya que   con  esfuezo y recursos propios adquirio el mobiliario, pero  le  hace   falta  el  capital para   realizar   la compra  de los  productos  que   venderá, agradece  el   apoyo  que  a  recibido  de  nuestra parte  para  hacer de  su   sueño una realidad.
texts.en: Marina needs our support to carry out her project.  She would like to invest in buying merchandise to open a grocery store.  With effort and her own resources, she acquired the furnishings for her store but she doesn't have enough capital to buy the products that she will sell.  She is grateful for the support that she has received from us which will enable her to make her dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Peter Kimani

texts.en: Peter T., 45 years old and single, has run an electronics shop for about three years, earning a monthly income of 16,000 Kenya shillings. Having repaid his previous ones well and in good time, Peter is requesting his third loan in order to buy more electrical items and accessories to sell. He hopes to eventually have a big electronics shop and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy electrical items and accessories to sell.

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es: La Alcancia Comunal “ La Union Hace la Fuerza” se inaguro recientemente y la electa presidenta es Liana quien es madre soltera con un hijo, a sus 31 anos de edad se dedica  al negocio de alquiler de cabinas para tener acceso al internet, ademas realiza diversos trabajos de tipeos para escolares en general desde hace siete anos. Liana desea ahorrar para casos de emergencia en su familia y nos manifiesta que su anhelo es  ampliar su negocio a un bazar librería. El prestamo sera invertido en la compra de algunos articulos como: papeleria, lapices y adornos para regalos. Liana junto a sus vecinos que la invitaron a participar del programa Prosperidad de Edaprospo desean adquirir un capital que les ayude cada vez en lograr adquirir ingresos para el bienestar de sus familias.
texts.en: The communal bank "La Union Hace la Fuerza" was formed recently, and they elected Liana as president of the group.  She is a 31 year-old single mother of one who has an internet cafe business.  She has also been doing various types of typing work for schools for 7 years.  Liana wants to save up an emergency fund for her family, and she tells us that she also wants to expand her business into a stationery shop.  She will invest the proceeds of this loan in the purchase of some items, including: stationery, pencils and gift wrap.  Liana and her group members, the neighbors who invited her to join the Prosperity Program from EDAPROSPO, want to acquire capital that will help them each day to generate income for the well-being of their families.

loans.use: to buy stationery, pencils and gift wrap

loans.name: Mukuvisi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 43 year old Febi (holding the yellow file) from Masvingo.  She is widowed with three children, one attending school. She also cares for four dependents. 

Febi runs a retail business selling clothes and firewood at a fixed location and from door to door.  The business has been in operation for 9 years.  She says the main challenges she faces are competition from other suppliers.  Febi has requested a loan of $400 to purchase more clothes and firewood. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to send her children to school and equip them with the right food and clothing.  In the future Febi plans to operate a shop employing workers.

loans.use: to purchase stock of firewood and clothes

loans.name: Iruguincho Group

texts.en: Luis, Maria Angelita and Anita are the members of Iruguincho Group located near the city of Ibarra in northern Ecuador. Luis, 22, is the group leader. He is single and lives with his family. He has one son who is three -years-old. He is a hard-working man who wants to get married soon, have another child, and continue forward with his girlfriend. Luis is a farmer, currently growing beans on his parents' land. He is seeking this loan to grow corn and some more beans. He began his life as a farmer when he finished school. His father and brother brought him to the country and taught him all they knew about farming. Since then, he has dedicated himself to farming and still works alongside his father. He hopes that this loan will help change his business, his life, and the life of his family. With hard work everyday, he has hopes to build his own house and get some of his own land. His goal is to live with his family in his own house and hire workers to help him with his farming work.

loans.use: to plant corn and additional bean crops

loans.name: Aminatu

texts.en: Aminatu is married and has six dependents. She sells gari, maize and rice at Abura, which she has done for 10 years. Her husband is an Agric officer. She adds her income to that of her husband’s, to pay school fees and utility bills. Aminatu will use the loan to purchase additional bags of gari and maize for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aminatu plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of gari and maize for sale.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and school fees.

For the past seven years, Teresia has operated a green grocery business, selling in a shop at wholesale and at the market. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. Teresia dreams of establishing a wholesale grocery in the future.

Teresia plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase a dairy cow to start a dairy farming business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a dairy farming business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 39 years old and married. She has two children, and one is in school. Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, soap, shampoo, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Hector Leonidas

texts.es:
Hector Leonidas tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero vive con los padres y con los hermanos , en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C NUEVA ESPERANZA, se encuentra en el sector La capilla, comunidad cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 25 minutos, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, comercio, construcción y ganadería.

Hector Leonidas se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, papas y cebada en terrenos de los padres. Compra y vende sus productos en la ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para, compra de abonos, semillas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la competencia, los precios y daños en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar un vehiculo y un terreno propio. 

Le gusta estudiar hacer deporte y festejar las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Hector Leonidas is 19 years old, single, and living with his parents and siblings in the canton of Guaranda in Bolivar Province.

The members of the Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank meet in the La Capilla sector, a neighborhood that takes up four blocks of Guaranda Canton 25 minutes away.  The members of this communal bank work in farming, trade, construction, and ranching.

Hector Leonidas farms, growing corn, potatoes, and barley on his parents' land.  He buys and sells his products in the city of Guaranda.

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for his crops.  The loan will help him meet his economic needs and improve his farming business.  He faces challenges such as competition, prices, and crop damage.  His dream is to buy an automobile and his own land.

He likes studying, playing sports, and celebrating community events.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for his crops

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a hard-working 29-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children aged 4, 3 and 2. 

For the last four years, he has been operating a mobile-phone repair shop so as to make a living. He wants in the next five years to have a mobile phone shop. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy mobile phone spare parts and accessories. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access credit easily.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Jovita de 35 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Chepen que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Jovita se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace unos un año, su mercadería que trae es para damas y caballeros, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1600 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jovita is 35 and lives with her husband and children in her own home. She has basic services and lives in an urban area in the district of Chepen, part of the department of La Libertad. The area is characterized by its agriculture, livestock and tourism.

Jovita has sold clothing for one year and has her business in her residence. She carries clothing for men and women and she also sells on order. She tries in this way to increase demand from her customers and thus make more income to meet her family’s expenses.

Upon observing that her business is growing daily, she decided to request a loan of 1,600 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more merchandise and supply her store with fashionable items, so that her client base will continue to grow. In this way, she will be able to repay her loan and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; este banco muy simpático está ubicado a 30 minutos de la Ciudad del Cusco en el poblado llamado Yuncaypata, este es un típico pueblito en el que se conserva toda la herencia andina pura, y viven todos en comunidad apoyándose en la época de siembra y cosecha, cuidando a sus hijos y a sus animales, es un pueblo muy bonito y es quechua hablante, está en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Estefania; la socia tiene 47 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales solo vive con 3 de sus hijos de 13, 11, 8  años de edad;  la socia trabaja en agricultura en todo lo referente a cereales, ella vende en el mercado de Cusco granos, la socia vende trigo, cebada, quinua, papa, deshidratada, entre otros productos, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivo y mayor mente produce quinua. La socia desea invertir el crédito para la compra de semilla de quinua, trigo, papa, para poder sembrar ahora en estos meses y para ellos requiere comprar la semilla, pagar el tractor que removerá y preparara la tierra y luego de un tiempito abonar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas, pagar al tractor, compra abono para su terreno.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
Estefania belongs to the Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata Communal Bank.  This very friendly bank is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco, in a village called Yuncaypata. This is a typical small village where people preserve their pure Andean heritage.  They live in communities, which support each other at sowing and harvest time, caring for their children and their animals. It is a very pretty village whose inhabitants speak Quechua. It is located in Cusco department.

Estefania, age 47, is married and has seven children.  She lives with only three of her children; ages 13, 11, and 4.  She is a farmer, and she works with everything having to with grains.  She sells grain at the market in Cusco.  She sells wheat, barley, quinoa, and dried potatoes among other products.  She has fields where she primarily produces quinoa.  

She wishes to use the loan to buy quinoa, wheat, and potato seeds in order to be able to plant now in these months.  In order to do so she needs to buy the seeds, pay for the tractor that turns over and prepares the land, and after a time she needs to fertilize the land.  

She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, to pay for the use of a tractor, and to buy fertilizer for her land.

She is grateful for this loan and values it. She pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner as she has with her previous loans.

loans.use: to buy seeds, to pay for the use of a tractor, and to buy fertilizer for her land.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Yat (pictured with her grandchild) and her husband, Leang, are vegetable farmers. They have been married since 1980 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two are married and live outside of the family home. Two are garment factory workers. One is a security guard, and another one stays at home. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Two about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.

Yat is requesting another loan of $1,000 to purchase one more motorcycle for her son who is a security guard to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Clara Agripina

texts.es:
Clara Agripina tiene 39 años de edad es soltera tiene cinco hijos  vive con los hijos de veintidós, veintiuno, trece, once y tres meses de edad  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas  a la siembra de cacao.

Clara se dedica a la  agricultura a la siembra de cacao las compras y ventas las realiza  en san Juan.  Solicita el crédito para poder dar mantenimiento a los cultivos de cacao para que el producto salga de mejor calidad.

 El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder mejorar los cultivos y obtener utilidades al momento de vender los productos.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuente es la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es poder estar siempre con la familia y poder comprarse una casa.

En los tiempos libres le gusta pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Clara Agripina is 39 years old. She is single and she has five children. She lives with her children, aged twenty-two, twenty-one, thirteen, eleven, and three months old. They live in the canton of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios.

She is a member of the communal bank "Cevallos", which is located in the San Francisco enclosure. It belongs to the Parrish of San Juan del Pueblo Viejo, in Ventanas. The population in Ventanas is dedicated to agriculture and cocoa cultivations.

Clara is an agriculturist who cultivates cocoa. The makes her purchases and carries out her sales in San Juan. She requests a loan to carry out maintenance care on her cocoa plantation so that her product will be of higher quality.

The loan will be of great help to improve her cultivation and to obtain better profits at the moment of sale.

The challenges which she faces very frequently are the competition and plagues. Her dream is to always be with her family and to buy a house.

In her spare time she enjoys travel with her family.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance care to her cocoa plantation

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy spare parts for maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 7 years. Mary Grace earns more income from fish vending.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for maintenance

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has operated a juice sales business for the past three years, selling to her neighbors and to passers-by. Her major challenge is competition from other juice sellers in the area. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demand.

Jane and her husband have two children, both of whom attend school. The family lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water bills.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase fruits to use for making juice to offer for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits to use for making juice to offer for sale

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Evangeline has a shop that sells green bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy coconuts and bananas for selling.

Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas to sell

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.ru: Нозигул проживает в районе Хамадони. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Она арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает чаку и салаты. В этой области она 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки помидоров, огурцов, капусты, чаки и зелени.
texts.en: Nozigul lives in the Hamadoni region. She is 43 years old. She is married and has six children. She rents a stall in the market where she sells chuckk and salads. She's been in this line of work for 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, chuck and greens

loans.use: purchase tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, chuck and greens

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia  lives in  Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 5 children, three of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (2 grand children). Sylvia has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 1 year, and work 7 day/ week.  

Sylvia sells her products at the market.  She has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more  bags of charcoal.  She also generates additional income through a small retail shop .The main business challenges for Sylvia includes transportation and increasing prices of charcoal.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler, and also build more build rental houses. Sylvia lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro cuenta con 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos Clara de 7 año de edad que esta cursando primero de primaria y Evelyn de 4 años que esta en el preescolar, su esposo se llama miguel ángel es empleado.

Ella iniciara su negocio va vender producto de la temporada de diciembre ella tenia la venta de pescados pero por problemas de salud lo dejo y ahora surtirá todo para las ocasiones navideñas, socorro espera que le vaya muy bien en el negocio ya que le esta poniendo todo el empeño y las ganas para sacar el negocio adelante también le gustaría que su negocio poco a poco incremente.
texts.en:
Socorro is 29 years old, married, and has two children. Clara is seven years old and starting her first year of elementary school. Evelyn is four years old and in preschool. Her husband is named Miguel Ángel and is employed.

Socorro started a business selling products for the December season. She had a business selling fish, but had to quit due to health problems. Now she wants to be completely stocked for the Christmas festivities. Socorro hopes to do very well in her business because she has put forth all of her effort and earnings into this venture so that it can succeed. She would also like for her business to increase a little bit at a time.

loans.use: to buy ornaments, lights, streamers, tinsel, and other items.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is  a 21-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She has run a food stall in Kator, South Sudan, for three years. Jane is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans to sell.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive en una comunidad  en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
La Señora. María tiene 30 años,  es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 4 y 3 años de edad y un bebé de 10 meses. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
Doña María para pasar más tiempo con sus hijos se queda en casa y se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas que son para la venta y  para el consumo de su hogar, también cría y vende pollos, cuyes y credos.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en  alimento para animales. 

Su meta es ampliar su negocio de pollos. 

En la foto esta la socia con su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank Nuevo Bankito la Ramada. She lives in a community in Cuenca. This place has a cold climate. Her people are dedicated to animal husbandry, agriculture, and many work in the city at different activities. Her people retain the culture and tradition of their communities.
Maria is 30 years old, is married and in their conjugal union has conceived three children of four and three years old and a baby of ten months. Her husband works in agriculture. The house in which they live is their property.
Maria, to spend more time with her children, stays at home and works in agriculture. She plants vegetables for sale and for consumption in her home. She also raises and sells chickens, guinea pigs, and creeds.
In the communal bank, she is in her third loan. She is going to invest it in the purchase of chickens and animal feed.
Her goal is to expand her chicken business.
In the photograph is the member with her son.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Sala De Belleza Linda Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sala de Belleza Linda lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Gloria de 43 años quien tiene una comideria desde hace 6 años. Ella inicio trabajando primeramente en este negocio y luego se puso su comideria en la cual cuenta con dos trabajadoras.
El crédito lo invertirá en granos básicos y carne. Ella tiene seis hijos de los cuales 5 dependen de ella de 22, 12, 8, 4  y 2 años de edad.
Las otras integrantes son Vilma quien tiene un Salón de belleza desde hace 5 años  y Karina quien se dedica al comercio de ropa usada y calzado desde hace 4 años.

loans.use: comprar granos básicos y carne

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Lorenzo has owned this small store for over 10 years. He sells all types of food products from his shop, ranging from rice to snacks for kids. He started this business with $15 (which was worth much more in Ecuador 10 years ago) and only sold rice, sugar, oil and plantains. Although he was one of the first businesses in this area he now faces competition from other stores around him. In order to contest with these businesses Lorenzo is looking to increase and diversify his inventory with this loan. He wants to begin selling chicken, meat, sausages and eggs as well as any other products that may be in demand. Because this is his only source of income he has dedicated his life to his business and is eager to receive a loan that could make it grow.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Diversify product offerings

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Vusal was born in 1979 in Sumgayit. He started his business of selling clothes and other apparel items four years ago. He currently rents a small booth where he sells mainly women's clothing. Vusal is currently applying for a loan in order to expand his inventory. In the future, he plans to open his own shop.

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
