loans.use: Sarah would like to buy 300 chickens and buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Mr. Oliver A. is a motorcycle transporter hoping to expand his business.  Oliver is 28 years old and hails from Asaba, Nigeria. He is requesting a loan of $625 to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a motor cycle

loans.name: Khalidi

texts.en: Khalidi is 28-year-old energetic carpenter and resident of Buguruni area. He is the father of 2 children. He has been in business for 6 years and is a skilled carpenter. Khalidi received business training from programs organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation. He buys wood upcountry and sells some of it retail at his workshop. He uses the remaining wood to make chairs, beds and tables. He helps his community by employing three others to work with him. Khalidi is requesting a loan of $750 so he can purchase more modern equipment, which will enable him to expand his workshop and his business.

loans.use: To buy modern equipment and expand his carpentry workshop

loans.name: Amelia Rosa

texts.es:
Amelia is a hard-working woman who earns a living selling candy in a cart at a bus station near her home. She leaves home very early every morning to be able to secure her supplies, and she works throughout the day in hopes of providing a better life for her three children. Two of them are in school, and the oldest one is intensely preparing at a prep school to attend a university and study accounting. Due to the demands of her children's education, she decides to sell candy and other treats at the most popular place in town. Previously she had sold outside local schools, but thanks to her perseverance her business has grown and will continue to grow. Amelia has the desire to keep working hard so she can soon open a bodega and cultivate some land to grow her own food. To fulfill her goals, she's requesting a loan of $375. You are putting your support in good hands with Amelia.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Amelia es una mujer luchadora que cada día se gana la vida vendiendo dulces en su triciclo en un paradero de vehículos de transporte público cerca de su casa; cada mañana muy temprano sale para poder alistar su mercadería y todo el día se dedica a esta actividad comercial por el bien de sus tres hijos que la motivan a seguir trabajando.Dos de sus hijos están estudiando, la mayor se prepara intensamente para ingresar a la universidad en una academia preuniversitaria ya que anhela estudiar contabilidad, es así que ante la demanda de la educación de sus hijos, decide vender dulces y golosinas en el paradero más concurrido de su ciudad. En anteriores oportunidades vendía en la puerta de los locales escolares, pero gracias a su constancia su pequeño negocio ha estado creciendo y seguirá creciendo, Amelia tiene el anhelo de poder seguir esforzándose para pronto establecerse en una bodega e iniciar el cultivo de algunos terrenos que ella posee para consumo propio.Amelia para cumplir sus anhelos solicita un préstamo de 375 dólares, tu aporte será una inversión sabia en manos de Amelia, no pierdas la oportunidad de apoyarla

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities and wide variety of candy and begin an new project

loans.name: Silila

texts.en: Silila is a single lady of twenty two years old who runs a small shop in front of her home.  She applied for this loan in order to purchase inventory to restock her shop.  Her shop is open every day and she makes about $220 Tala ($88USD) in profits per day.  The business is growing very well, and she hopes to expand it through future loans.

loans.use: To restock her small shop

loans.name: Ana Isaura

texts.es:
Ana Isaura M. is a married woman with 2 children that are in school. Her children are the reason she wants to improve herself and she has worked very hard to provide them with a stable family life and an education for their future.

Ana Isaura M. has owned a grocery store for twelve years and her sales have been very good. Her business is profitable now in her sector. Her sales have increased considerably over the years. Her initial capital was $15,000 - money she had saved and support from her husband.

Ana Isaura has worked with Ceprodel for 7 years and is very satisfied with the loans she's received. The loans have been provided to her when she needed them and have helped her satisfy the necessities of her business and her clients. She has made 23 transactions with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Ana Isaura M. es una mujer casada con 2 hijos los cuales se encuentran en la edad escolar. Sus hijos han sido la razón para que ella se superara y por ellos es que ella se ha esforzado, brindándoles así una familia estable y una educación para el futuro de ellos.

Hace 12 años Ana Isaura M. tiene su pulpería y sus ventas han sido muy buenas. Su negocio es rentable hoy en día en su sector, sus ventas incrementaron considerablemente al paso de los años. Su capital de inicio fue de C$15,000 (córdobas) los cuales eran ahorros y aporte del esposo.

Ana Isaura trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 7 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 23 créditos.

loans.use: The purchase of various products

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mrs. Sun D. D., age 29, works with her husband purchasing poultry from the breeder and reselling them for a profit, making about $3 each day. She has one child who is a student. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more ducks and chickens to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks and chickens to expand her business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a proud mother of six children all of whom live on their own, independent from their mother and father. At the moment, Marcelina is dedicated to the making and sale of cigars. She learned this skill when she was very young since her entire family is dedicated to the same business.

She sells her products throughout the country in different locations and there is a great demand for her product. With the loan that she is asking for today, Marcelina will purchase more tobacco in bulk which will allow her to sell her goods at a lower price.

loans.use: to buy tobacco to hand-make cigars

loans.name: Kossi Gakpo

texts.fr:
Mr. Kossi Gakpo S. was born on November 8, 1970 in Badja, which is located 45 kilometers from Lomé. He is married to a hairdresser by the name of Miss Charlotte Ameloko. In his workshop which he calls "Ets. Godwin" he makes shoes, copies keys, and also sells socks. He has been in this business since 1990.

He is requesting a first loan in the amount of US$ 500 which will permit him to purchase some tools of his trade such as a hammer and thread, and to make a display case for shoes he has made.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur S. Kossi Gakpo est né le 8 novembre 1970 à Badja, localité située à 45 km de Lomé. Il s’est marié à une coiffeuse au nom de Mademoiselle AMELOKU Charlotte. Dans son atelier « ETS GODWIN », il fait la cordonnerie, la reproduction de clef et vend également des chaussettes. Il a commencé par exercer ce métier depuis 1990.

Le premier crédit de 200.000 FCFA qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter les outils de travail tels que : le marteau, le fil à coudre et fabriquer un armoire pouvant permettre d’exposer les chaussures déjà fabriquées.

loans.use:
Purchasing tools of his trade

Acquisition des outils de travail

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David works as driver in public transportation, the motor of his car has a lot of mechanic problems. He needs to buy a new car since it’s his source of revenue which he uses to covers the expenses of his family and his three children who are in a public school. His house is located in the Pasankeri area of the City of La Paz. The loan will be used to change his car to keep on working in the inter-city public transportation industry. This is the fourth credit with IMPRO, the evaluation performed allows the requested loan by David to be approved. David is our client since 2003.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

David trabaja de transportista publico, tiene su movilidad que tiene muchas fallas en el motor y necesita comprar una nueva movilidad ya que es su fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su familia y sus tres hijos que están estudiando en un colegio estatal; su vivienda esta ubicado en la Zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito requiere para cambiar de herramienta de trabajo para continuar trabajando con transporte publico inter-ciudad. Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado por David. David es cliente nuestro desde el año 2003.

loans.use: Buy a new car to keep on working in public transportation.

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 40 year-old Magret K.. She is single, and has three children aged 11, 16, and 19. In 2003, Magret established her wholesale business. She has applied for a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of maize in bulk and thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania by providing a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. For instance, where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. This is a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are often termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services, for women on low incomes.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of maize in bulk

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta is married and has two children. She owns a 2 acre plot of land in Caacupé where she grows hens, cows, pigs and other animals.

Marta begins her day at 4h30 AM alongside her husband to begin milking the cows. Most of the milk production is sold from their home since the neighbours visit them to purchase fresh milk.

Twice weekly Marta produces cheese which is often purchased by the chiperos. Chiperos elaborate a typical corn bread which is very popular in Paraguay. Thanks to their hard work they are able to maintain their home and educate their children. Their work is intense and they work every day of the week without a day off. But they know that thanks to their sacrifice they are able to provide for their family so they do all this with lots of love.

Marta is very grateful to the Fundación Paraguya, even if it is true that she must work daily including sundays.

She requests a microcredit to invest in the purchase of corn and feed for her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Grain and feed purchase (food for cows, pigs and hens).

loans.name: Mayram

texts.en:
Mayram S. is 45 years old, married and has three adorable children. Her oldest son is studying at university while the others attend local schools. Mayram makes a living selling perfum and cosmetics in a store which she rents. She has been in this business for six years, and her dream is to expand her business, open her own store and establish contacts with steady suppliers of well-known products.

Mayram and her husband work hard to make sure they have sufficient funds to educate their children so they can succeed in life. To help make this dream possible, Mayram has applied for a loan of $1,000 to buy new perfumes and cosmetics, including hair color, nail polish, lipstick and other items. She would like to thank everybody who supports her and promises to pay the loan in four months and make payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase a wider range of goods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fatma A Nyota Njema Group

texts.en:
Fatma is 29 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 10, 8, 6 and 1. She has been a bites (snacks) and porridge seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

In the past, Fatma has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Fatma now requests a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwanaid and Mwajuma, who also have businesses dealing with bites, firewood, potatoes, cassava and juice sales.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Fathiya's Hakuna Kulala Group

texts.en:
Fathiya, 26, is single. She has been a tailoring and selling clothes since 2003. Every day, she works from 8am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Fathiya is requesting a loan to buy more tailoring items and clothes for the expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Veronica, who also has a business selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy tailoring items and clothes.

loans.name: Tuon

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuon S. is a villager in Prey Khla Tboung Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and she now cannot grow rice because she does not have enough money to hire a laborer to plow her rice field. Thus, Mrs. Tuon S. has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose; she would use any remainder of the loan to purchase more fertilizer and pesticide to make her crop better.

Mrs. Tuon S. is a 53-year-old widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow her rice field and purchase more fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Thok

texts.en: Thok C., 40, is married and lives with her husband and two of her three children in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She works growing bamboo to earn a profit and is able to make US$1.60 per day. Her husband Prum Chuk, 41, is a cow dealer and makes US$4 each day. She would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase a horse and its cart for her son to run a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and its cart.

loans.name: Huy

texts.en: Mrs. Huy A., age 46, is a local farmer that, since 1979, has been growing rice to earn a living for her family. She also raises pigs from a small pigpen in her home. Huy has six children; three sons are factory workers, two daughters are students, and another one is married and lives away from home. She is married to Lim Try, 68, who is also a rice farmer. Huy is requesting a loan to purchase more piglets to raise. The family lives in the Kompong Cham Province.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Асроилова Салтанат прживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 41 гд. Замужем и имеет семерых детей.У них очень большая семья , но все они живут очень дружно и весело. Салтанат занимается разведением мелко рогатого скота. Хочет купить еще нескольких овец , на полученный кредит. Погасть кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Saltanat A. lives in the Shahrinau region. She is 41 years old, married and has seven children. They have a very big but friendly family who live happily together. Saltanat has a business of breeding cattle. She wants to buy several more lambs for the received loan. She will pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lambs

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa Sánchez C. tiene la edad de 34 años habita en el reparto Juan ramón padilla  en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia ella es soltera , no tiene hijos , doña Rosa desde hace veinte años tiene su propio negocio el cual con las ganancia que obtiene le apoya a su familia  , los planes para su familia es incrementar su inventario de su negocio para poder ayudar  mas  con los gastos a sus padres ; ya que ella tiene el sueño de construirle su casa,  doña Rosa con su propio esfuerzos y el apoyo de afodenic ha incrementado su negocio y esta muy contenta con los resultado , esta señora es muy trabajadora ya que los fines de semana vende comida para obtener otros ingresos. y salir adelante con su negocio, con esta solicitud va invertir en productos varios, como granos básicos, productos enlatados, carnes entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosa Sánchez C. is 34 years and lives with her family in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is single and does not have any children. For the past twenty years Rosa has had her own business and with the earnings that she obtains she supports her family. The plans for her family are to increase her business' inventory to be able to help her parents more with their expenses. She already has the dream of building them a house. Rosa with her own effort and support from AFODENIC has enlarged her business and is very happy with the results. This woman is very hard working as on the weekends she sells food to obtain other income and get ahead with her business. With this request she is going to invest in various products such as basic grains, canned goods, and meats among others.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains and canned goods to diversify her grocery store

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan, requested by four borrowers, all of them live in Chong Kneas Commune in Siem Reap Province. Mr. O., 39, has been selected to be leader by the group members. O. and his wife currently earn a living by catching fish which they sell at the local market. They get up early, before light, every  morning and start fishing. They livelihood depend O. catching fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake, which is their main fishing ground. O. is unable to catch maN. fish  as his his fishing equipment is often broken. Therefore, he is asking for a loan to buy more fishing equipment. 
The other three borrowers are: 
T. is a widow, age 64, who earns a living catching fish for sale. She needs a loan to buy nets for fishing..
N., 48, catches fish to sell, with her husband and she requests a loan to buy more fishing equipment.
S., 20, catches fish for a living and she has applied for a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To buy more fishing equipment

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadia D. a  40 ans et vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari, ses 7 enfants et sa coépouse dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de  Bougouni.(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Madame Kadia D., en plus de son activité  de préparation et de vente de la crème de mil (appelée le  Dèguè), qu’elle a apprise auprès de sa grand mère, est également  très habile dans le secteur du vestimentaire infantile. Très appréciée, elle ne cesse d’être sollicitée par de nombreux clients tant masculins que féminins.
Dans le souci de diversifier davantage ses activités et satisfaire sa clientèle, elle décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après  4 prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) elle est à son 6 ème prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce  prêt Kadia D. compte  acheter, 140 litres de lait frais, 20 kg de sucre, 120  kg de mil, 3000 FCFA de glace et des douzaines d’habits pour enfant.
Elle s’approvisionne en matière première (lait, sucre, mil et glace ) dans le marché de Bougouni, et les vêtements pour enfant à Bamako (Capitale de la République du Mali.). Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et à crédit, au marché et dans son  quartier à une  clientèle constituée de toutes les catégories sociales.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 60 000 FCFA par mois et ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de vente d’habits à Bougouni.
texts.en:
Ms. Kadia D. is 40 years old and lives in a polygamous family with her husband, seven children, and her co-wife in the Hérémakono Nord district of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). In addition to her work making and selling cream of millet (called "dèguè"), which she learned how to do from her grandmother, she is also very adroit in the field of children's clothing. Much appreciated, she is continually in high demand by numerous customers, as many men as women.

Wanting to diversify her business more and to satisfy her customers, she decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After four group loans (solidarity loans), she is on her sixth individual loan. All the preceding ones have been correctly repaid.

With this loan, she intends to buy: 140 liters of fresh milk, 20 kg of sugar, 120 kg of millet, 3000 francs CFA worth of ice, and dozens of children's outfits. She gets her basic ingredients (milk, sugar, millet, and ice) at the Bougouni marketplace and her children's clothing in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). Sales are made at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, at the marketplace and in her area, to customers from all walks of life.

She envision realizing a profit of 60,000 francs per month, and her ambition is to open a clothing shop in Bougouni.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for children and ingredients for cream of millet

loans.name: Marvelyn

texts.en:
Marvelyn helps her husband in their hollow block and baluster (pre-cast) making business. Aside from this, they also maintain a fish pond that supports the immediate needs of their family. She would like to sustain their small businesses and with this in mind, she would like to borrow a loan from the lenders of PHP5,000. She hopes that through her business, they can have a progressively better life in the future. She and her husband will do their best to succeed in business and provide a better life for their family.  

Marvelyn is 49 years old and married to Gualberto. The couple was blessed with two children: Neil Alvin - 23 years old, college graduate; and Allen Pearl Kris - 11 years old, elementary student. She wishes to see her children live a successful life someday and have a better way of life.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther Y. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has four children, two daughters and two sons. She says one of her children is in junior high school while the others are in primary school. She says she lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Esther works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband trades in second hand clothes.

Esther is a trader. She trades in all types and sizes of wood. She sells the wood in a kiosk at her place of residence. She procures the wood directly from the sawmill operators in her community. Esther has been in this business for barely one year now. She is hopeful to sponsor all her children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy wood for resale

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en:
Enhtur S. is 38, married and the father of three daughters, ages 2, 13, and 18. His family lives in a "ger" (nomadic traditional tent) district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughters are attending a local kindergarten, elementary school and university, respectively. Enhtur's spouse, Gandi, is 37 and works as a saleswomen.

In 2005, Enhtur started running a retail business with his younger brother. They buy old cars and fix them up to sell for a higher price. They also get orders from clients to fix their vehicles.

Enhtur has gained a lot of experience and has many repeat clients. He plans to attract more clients to increase his income and open a large car care center. He would like to spend the Kiva loan on home maintenance and to buy an old car to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: maintain home and buy a second-hand car to fix up and re-sell

loans.name: Gozelle Mae

texts.en:
Gozelle Mae C. lives in the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 18 years old and married. To make a living, she has just started a business selling home products to tourists and local community members.

In 2008, Gozelle Mae joined PMPC to gain access to financial services that can help her improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business. She is requesting a loan, her first, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living situation. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Nary

texts.en: O. Nary is twenty-seven years old and a tailor who earns about $2.30 a day. She is married and blessed with a three-month-old child. Her husband is a construction worker who normally earns $4 a day. To improve the family's living  situation before her child is old enough for school, she plans to take out a $600 loan from Kiva to buy cows to resell. By doing this, she hopes she will be able to fix her house and save some more money for her family's use in the future.

loans.use: To buy cows to sell

loans.name: Kossiwavi

texts.fr:
Cette femme est une revendeuse de produits cosmétiques, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2007 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de mèches et perruques. Elle a poussé un peu loin ses études, ce qui lui a permis d’avoir certaines notions de gestion et lui permet de bien gérer son commerce. Elle veut agrandir son stock et sollicite de WAGES  un crédit pour acheter 15 pièces de pagnes, des mèches et de perruques.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman is a retailer of cosmetics. She has been in this business since 2007 and acquires her supplies at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She includes with this business the sale of hair extensions and wigs. She went a bit further in school, enabling her to gain certain management concepts. This allows her to manage her business well. She wants to expand her inventory and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 15 bolts of pagnes (colorful West African cloth), hair extensions, and wigs. She is married and the mother of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extension, wigs, and various cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Joemar

texts.en:
Joemar F. is a rice farmer. He is 28 years old and has one child. Though he is a young father, he has started to worry about the future of his kid. He always worries about where to get the money to spend for their daily needs.

The only thing that supports their family is their farm. He always wants to make it grow in order to have a better income for the family. He is applying for a loan of PHP 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds.

Now that he is connected with the credit program of CEVI, he has loans, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 101981&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Julia  es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo.
Julia desde hace años  se dedica por años a la venta de ropa por pedidos, ha estudiado un curso de cosmetología y se esta dedicando  hacer tratamientos de belleza y paquetes de novia.   
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de ropa de vestir.
El préstamo es de mucha ayuda, porque puede cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientas.
El sueño de Julia es tener una boutique o un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Click HERE to see the previous loan.

Julia is a member of El Triunfo (The Triumph) Communal Bank. For years, she has been selling clothes upon request. Julia studied cosmetology and prepares beauty treatments and bridal packages.

She needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy clothes. The loan will be very helpful because she can fulfill her customers’ orders. Julia dreams of opening a boutique or a beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a thirty five year old father of two. He runs a carpentry workshop in Nairobi where he manufactures beds, sofa sets and wardrobes. He has requested for a first loan of Ksh. 25,000 to add to his stock of timber and paint. Joseph has been in this business for the last fifteen years. He hopes to grow his business and out of his profits build a home and buy a family car. He describes himself as social, loving and caring. 


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of timber and paint

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 51-year-old widow who lives with her child. Twenty years ago, she started in agriculture and, in 2000, she purchased her own land and started growing tobacco and seasonal trees.Today, Fatmeh wants to borrow $1,000 to improve her business and increase its productivity.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina sells frozen food, such as chicken, turkey and fish, in her shop. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 38 years old and married with four children. She requests a loan amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more turkey, chicken and fish to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase frozen food to sell

loans.name: Ayao Koulefianou

texts.fr: Cet homme est infirmier de profession. Il a ouvert en 2007 dans le quartier de Kégué à Lomé un cabinet médical. Ce cabinet ne dispose pas des équipements appropriés pour répondre aux besoins de ses patients. Mais ses clients apprécient la ferme volonté qu’il a toujours en vue de bien les servir. Il dispose de bonnes connaissances en soins médicaux, en chirurgie légère et dans le traitement de certaines maladies comme le paludisme, la dysenterie, les diarrhées pour ne citer que celles-là. Pour disposer d’un cabinet médical bien équipé, il sollicite en ce moment un crédit de WAGES pour commander des tables, des lits, des produits de soins, acheter un nouveau stéthoscope et aménager sa clinique. Il est marié et a un enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
This man is a nurse by profession. In 2007 he opened a medical clinic in the Kegue district of Lome. This pharmacy is not equipped with the necessary equipment to attend to patients' needs. But his clients appreciate have always appreciated the efforts he has made in their care. He possesses strong knowledge in medical care, in minor surgery and in the treatment of certain illnesses such as paludism, dysentery, and diarrheas, just to mention a few. In order to have a well-equipped medical clinic, he is requesting a loan from Wages (Kiva Field Partner) to purchase tables, beds, first aid products, to purchase a new stethoscope and to remodel the clinic building. He is married and he has one child in his care.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tables, beds, and first aid products for his medical clinic.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil B. was born in 1986. He is single and lives in Fuzuli region.

Kamil has been in the auto repair business for 7 years.

Kamil requests a loan of 2000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel P. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el crédito anterior con el cual su negocio ha crecido y ha tenido más ingreso con los cuales ha podido construir unos cuartos en la parte trasera de su casa.
Les está haciendo falta el techo, pero desea ponerlo de concreto ya que es más duradero y segura, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que esta obteniendo su negocio, ya que gracias a ustedes a tenido mas clientes y esta en mejores condiciones su local.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Manuel P. is very grateful for the help with the previous loan. since then his business has grown and his income has increased, so has been able to build some bedrooms in the back of his house.

The rooms still need to be roofed and he wants to use concrete as it is more durable and secure. He does not have enough money to buy the materials and pay the labor for this improvement.

He is asking for a loan and plans to repay it with some of the profits from his business. Thanks to the previous loan he has gained more clients and the business is in a better position.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David M. is married and lives in his own home in the city of Villa Elisa. He has five children who are all in school or college. 
David has a truck he uses to provide delivery and freight services in the biggest market in the center of Villa Elisa. David has been running his freight-delivery business for the past 23 years. He previously worked with his parents in the market, selling fruits and vegetables from a stall. He saved up enough money to buy a truck and begin his business. 
David gets up very early in the morning to deliver goods to the market. The vendors open their stalls early and need their merchandise on time. Sometimes, during the summer months, David travels throughout Paraguay transporting goods between cities, such as seasonal fruits – watermelons, melons, oranges and pineapples. David needs a loan to repair parts of his truck so that it functions well and is reliable.

loans.use: To Repair his delivery vehicle

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 36-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mahdi has been working as a contractor since 1990. He also works as home painter. 

He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Mahdi has requested a loan.

When he first started his business, he had to face heavy competition and he had some financial issues. Mahdi is special in his trade because he is known for his good work.

His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Khantati Group

texts.es:
“Khantati” es un grupo de 8 señoras que pertenecen al Centro Focal Collpani, así, Victoria Q. es la Presidenta, como Tesorera está Roxana A. y como Secretaria de Actas es  Mercedes Y., las tres organizan a sus compañeras para llevar adelante su reunión, guiados por un orden del día.
Todas tienen diferentes negocios de comercialización, es decir, compara y venta de productos, producción y servicio y necesitan el crédito para invertir en sus negocios y generar ingresos para sus familias, además a ellas les gusta el consultorio porque tienen la oportunidad de cuidar su salud y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Khantati is a group of eight women who belong to the Collpani Community Center. Victoria Q. is the president, Roxana A. is the treasurer, and Mercedes Y. is the secretary. The three of them organize their colleagues in order to move the meeting along and guide them through the agenda of the day. All of them have different businesses. That is to say, they buy and sell products, produce goods, and provide services. They need the loan to invest in their businesses to generate income for their families. Also, they like the clinic because they have the opportunity to take care of their health and that of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: G.s. Ana Virgen Noble Group

texts.es: La señora Manuela de Jesús, Yesenia del Socorro y Marcia es también integrante del grupo solidario Ana Virgen Noble, La señora Yesenia del tiene 30 años y se dedica  a la elaboración de tortillas, esta actividad la realiza con otros miembros de su familia que le ayudan a elaborar. Ella posee tres hijos los cuales son menores de edad. Ella es casada, por lo tanto para el ingreso del hogar su esposo también aporta, ya que trabaja como ayudante de albañilería. Las 3 son personas muy luchadoras y lo más importante trabajadoras anteriormente ya habían solicitado financiamiento por lo que han reconocido que ha sido de gran ayuda para sus familias y para sus negocio. Actualmente solicitan este nuevo financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia prima para cada una de sus actividades.
texts.en:
Señora Manuela de Jesús, Yesenia del Socorro and Marcia are jointly liable members of the Ana Virgen Noble group. Señora Yesenia, age 30, is engaged in making tortillas. She carries out this business with other members of her family, who help her make them. She has three young children and is married. Her husband also contributes to the household income since he works as an assistant bricklayer.

The three members are very energetic and, most importantly, hardworking. Previously they have applied for financing which they have recognized has been of great help for their families and for their businesses. Currently they are applying for this new loan which will be for working capital that will be used for the purchase of raw material for each one of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia K. is a single parent who has two children and is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills. Cecilia has received junior high education.

Cecilia has been selling bananas, plantains and provisions such as soap, Milo (a milk beverage), milk and canned tomatoes at Elmina for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions, bananas, plantains, cassava and other food supplies to sell.

Cecilia hopes to save the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, bananas, plantains, cassava and other food supplies to sell

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en: Nasra H. is an entrepreneur and married woman. She runs a business selling cosmetic goods at her shop at Kombo Street at Dar es Salaam.  She purchases goods from wholesale and retail sales shops at Kariakoo's city market shopping center and sells them to retail customers. She meets her family's daily needs by selling the business goods. She plans to expand the business to a wholesale shop. She needs a loan of 1,000,000TZS to buy more goods

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Ma. Susan's Group

texts.en: Ma. Susan S. is from the village of San J.. She is 31 years old and is the group leader of a twelve-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ma. Susan S.’s Group. Ma. Susan is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month. Ma. Susan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ma. Susan is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her eighth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Taem

texts.en: Mrs. Taem C. is 50 years old and she lives in Preaek Samraong village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 3.50-hectare field where she grows rice and eggplant for selling to her support her family.  She has decided to request a loan in order to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline to help farm her crops. Her husband, Mr. Sanh Sor is a construction worker who receives a small salary to help support his family. The couple has seven children, three of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory and another who is a construction worker.  The other three are students in the local school. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline for farming.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita A. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis oriental. She is 54 years old. Conchita is married and has three adult-aged children. Conchita owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas as well as coconut shells used in making charcoal in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Conchita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 4000 PHP and was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Conchita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: We Need Help Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “We Need Help” group from the small town of Waterloo. This is where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. These small-scale businesswomen have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each from SMT/Kiva lenders to further strengthen their businesses. In this way, they can make more sales, better profit and, consequently, improve their living conditions.

Thirty-seven-year-old Marie F., pictured on the left, is the leader of this group of borrowers. Marie who was born in Waterloo, is married, and has two children, both of whom attend secondary school. For more than fifteen years, Marie has been a businesswoman. She sells items such as onions, vegetable oil, clothes, and any other goods she finds lucrative for the time. Marie also owns a bar where she sells both soft and hard drinks. She also sells cooked rice, meat, and vegetables. With her share of this loan, she will invest in her cooked-rice business by buying rice and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) in large quantities.

loans.use: Buy rice and palm-oil in large quantities

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Roció N. Cerdas es una señora de 31 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo y 2 hijos en una comunidad  rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café y otros, artesanía, ganadería y muchas otras actividades. 

Doña Roció se dedicado toda su vida a la siembra y comercialización de productos agrícolas, en especial tubérculos como la papa y la yuca. Los cuales son productos muy consumidos en esta zona y alrededor del país. Con el negocio Doña Roció  y su familia han generado los recursos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella asegura que con el tiempo el negocio ha ido creciendo de tal manera que la demanda es mayor a la capacidad de su producción, es por eso que ella solicita un crédito de ¢617,000 (seiscientos diecisiete  mil colones)  para construir la estructura que sostiene la máquina de lavado de papas que  también necesitan   financiar con el préstamo. Con esto agilizaran el proceso de lavado y así su producción será más efectiva.

Doña Roció es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Ha recibido 5 microcréditos y los ha cancelado responsablemente.
texts.en:
Roció N. Cerdas, age 31, lives with her husband and two children in a rural community in Costa Rica. The community is located 45 kilometers to the south of San José, and it is called San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal is an area that is a bit mountainous, and the people engage in activities such as commerce; growing vegetables, coffee, and others; handicrafts; livestock; and many other activities. Roció has devoted her entire life to planting and selling agricultural products, especially tubers like potatoes and yucca. These products are consumed a lot in this area and around the country. With the business, Roció and her family have generated the resources to have a better quality of life. She assures us that in time her business has been growing in such a way that the demand is greater than her production capacity. That is why she is requesting a loan for 617,000 colones. This is to build a structure that will support the machine to wash the potatoes, which they also need to finance with the loan. This will speed up the washing process, and their production will be more effective. Roció is a member of the Business of Communal Credit San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), one of the 100 associated organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. She has had five loans, and she has paid them back responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build an infrastructure for a machine to wash potatoes

loans.name: Diana Yamileth

texts.es:
Diana Yamileth F. R., tiene la edad de 32 años, habita en el Barrio Villa Fraternidad, y con su esposo el cual labora como bodeguero en una librería, tienen dos hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica desde hace 9 años a la venta de cosméticos, el cual con el apoyo de su esposo quien realizo la inversión de la mercadería para la venta de estos productos personales.

En los últimos años ha observado un alza en la demanda de estos productos por tal razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería tales como cosméticos, ropa de segunda mano, y variedad de productos varios, para ofrecer. Una inversion de esta magnitud le garantizara la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos personales y la oportunidad de mejorar sus condiciones económicas de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Diana is 32 years old and lives with her husband in the Villa Fraternidad neighborhood. They have two young children. Her husband works as a bookstore shopkeeper, and she’s been selling cosmetics for the past nine years. Her husband provided the money needed to invest in products when she began. She has noticed an increased demand in the past few years, so she is asking for this loan to invest in more merchandise, such as cosmetics, second-hand clothing, and various other products. This investment will allow her the opportunity to increase her income and improve her family’s economic status.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es:
El señor Ceferino M., tiene la edad de 56años, habita en La Concepción, barrio Los Martinez, es casado, su esposa se desempeña como comerciante de frutas  y verduras en el M. de Masaya y así lo apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene hijos ya todos mayores de edad.

Don Ceferino desde hace 31 años se dedica a la agricultura, las mayor problemática hacia el cultivo son la condiciones del tiempo y la sequía que afectó el año pasado, con el primer crédito otorgado logró establecer un cultivo de piña y gracias a la asistencia técnica y a trabajos arduos en el campo están en muy  buenos condiciones lo que le permitió vender y cancelar su primer crédito; ahora con este segundo crédito quiere darle mantenimiento ya que necesita comprar fertilizantes e insumos  que requieren el cultivo.
texts.en:
El señor Ceferino M. is 56 years old and lives in La Concepción, Los Martinez neighborhood. He is married and his wife sells fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market. Thus, she helps with household expenses. They have children who are all adults. Don Ceferino has worked in agriculture for 31 years. His greatest problem has been weather and last year's drought. With his first loan, he established plantings of pineapple; thanks to technical assistance and hard work in the field, they are in very good condition, which allowed him to retire his first loan. Now, with his second loan, he wants to maintain his plantings. He needs to purchase fertilizer and other products that cultivation requires.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural consumables such as fertilizer for the maintenance of pineapples

loans.name: Lucifa

texts.en:
Lucifa C. is a 47-year-old married woman from the village of Lingating Baungon Bukidnon. She and her husband have 5 school-age children. To earn a living, Lucifa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. More specifically, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where her primary source of income is derived from selling both food and everyday products in her local community. Lucifa has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2007, Lucifa joined HSPFI to gain much-needed access to financial services. In turn, she was able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her standard of living. Recently, Lucifa successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 18,000 PHP from HSPFI. This prior loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lucifa is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 21,000 PHP ($475), which will again be used to purchase additional products. Notably, this loan would be the seventh loan taken out by Lucifa from HSPFI. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and it reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional products

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda M. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 46 years old and married with six adult children. To make a living, Minda owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products. Minda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Minda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Minda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Minda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jelyn P. is from the village of Sepac Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Jelyn is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Shasta Daisy 1'.

Jelyn is single and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Jelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling herbal products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from selling herbal products like "haplas", & "bemar" in the local community. Jelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelyn is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Jelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teodosio

texts.es: Teodosio tiene 48 años, vive con su esposa y uno de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era niña hasta el momento, se ha dedicado a cultivar papa en campos de cultivo que posee, asimismo cría animales, como: ovejas que lo lleva a pastear a una considerable distancia para que puedan desarrollarse  saludables. Su esposa y sus hijos lo apoyan en esta tarea y es que casi siempre trabajan en equipo. Afirma que le agrada trabajar en el campo porque esta en contacto directo con la naturaleza y respira tranquilidad como siempre lo hace, aunque su trabajo sea muy esforzado y de largas horas, es recompensado cuando llega la época de la cosecha, es por esta razón que esta planeando aumentar su producción. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que recibirá, logrará comprar más sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Teodosio is 48 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in their own house. Since he was a child he has been a farmer growing potatoes in his fields. He also raises animals, including sheep which he grazes in a pasture far from his home so that they can develop in a healthy way. His wife and children help him with this work, and they almost always work as a team. He attests that he enjoys working outdoors, as he enjoys the direct contact with nature and the fresh air to breathe. Although his work requires long hours and is very physically demanding he is happy to see the results of his labors at harvest time. For this reason he would like to increase production. This is his first loan from MFP and he is very happy to receive financial support. He is also grateful to be a part of his communal bank, since all of its members are responsible and supportive. He would like to express his gratitude to all the people who provide funding for his loan, which will be very useful for the progress of his business. He will use the loan to buy more bags fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Rosenda Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Señora Rosenda Guadalupe I. es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay, vive en por el sector de  Fátima en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza natural, su centro histórico, los 4 ríos que la bañan,  su gastronomía y su gente que es muy cálida y amable.

Doña Rosenda tiene  58 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos que ya son mayores de edad,  son casados y viven de manera independiente, su esposo es de profesión ebanista (trabaja la madera) y tiene su taller propio, gracias al trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Rosenda es profesora de una escuela de la ciudad, lleva 35 años en la docencia, labora medio día y el resto de su tiempo se dedica a su hogar.

Este es su primer crédito, fue invitada por sus hijas que son miembros de la banca comunal, el crédito lo va utilizar en algunas mejoras en su hogar, su meta es  llegar a tener una casita de campo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosenda is a member of the Yanuncay Community Bank. She lives in the Fatima section in the city of Cuenca, a city that is known for its natural beauty, its historical center, its four rivers for bathing, its food and its warm and friendly people. Rosenda is 58 years old, married and has four children. The older children are married and live on their own. Her husband is a woodworker and he has his own workshop. Thanks to their work together as a couple, they have constructed their own house. Mrs. Rosenda is a teacher at the school in the city. She has been teaching for 35 years. She works for half a day and then dedicates the rest of the day to her home. This is her first loan. She was invited to join the community bank by her children who are members. She is going to use the loan for home improvement. Her goal is to have a little house in the country.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Cherry Viem

texts.en: Cherry Viem M. is from Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Cherry Viem owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling firewood in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Cherry Viem joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional firewood to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Balitwegomba Women's Group-Jinja

texts.en:
46-year-old M. Juliet belongs to Balitwegomba Women’s group-Jinja. For eight years now she has been operating her second hand clothes and retail shop businesses along Kamuli road in Jinja. Juliet has been relying on her buoyant disposition to attract clients, most of whom are community members. Her involvement in this business was spawned by savings from her earlier poultry business. 

This married mother of four describes herself as fully focused and steadfast. $67 is the approximate amount of money she makes as profits per week. 

With her portion of this loan she says she is going to purchase more bales of clothes to sell and to buy retail items such as sugar, soap, maize flour, etc, for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more bales of clothes to resell

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
La Señora María P. es socia del banco comunal El Paraíso, vive en la comunidad de la Confianza en la parroquia de Cumbe, En su entorno se encuentran, entre grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, románticas haciendas viejas. El centro parroquial de Cumbe está organizado en torno a la plaza central y se caracteriza por conservar parte de su arquitectura tradicional, la cual se ve reflejada en las casas de dos plantas, su gente se dedica agricultura y ganadería.

Doña María tiene de 54 años, es viuda hace 24 años, tiene 3 hijos que son mayores y viven  independientes.  De su segundo compromiso tiene 7 hijos, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, sus 5 hijos solteros trabajan y ayudan a la economía de la casa. Con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
 
La Señora María se dedica a la cría de gallinas, cuyes y cerdos a los que los vende en su propia comunidad, también se dedica a la agricultura, lo que cultiva es para su consumo y solo una mínima parte es para la venta.

Es nuestra socia fundadora de la banca comunal y los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de unos cerdos y en su alimento.
 
Su meta es tener más animales
texts.en:
Mrs. María P. is a member of the “El Paraíso” (Paradise) communal bank.  She lives in the community of Confianza, Cumbe parish.  One can find large pasture areas of cattle ranches and romantic old haciendas in her surroundings.  The Cumbe parish center is arranged around a central plaza noted for conserving its traditional architecture which is reflected in the two story houses.  Most of the residents are farmers and cattlemen.

María, 54, was widowed 24 years ago.  She has three adult children who live independently.  From her second marriage she has 7 children, the two oldest are married and live independently and the five single children work and contribute to household expenses.  Through her work she has managed to build her house.  Her second husband is a farmer.

María raises chickens, guinea pigs and pigs for later sale in her own community.  She is also a farmer.  Most of what she grows is for her own consumption; just a very small part of it is sold.

She is the founding member of the communal bank and the loans have benefited her business.  The new loan will be used to buy pigs and feed for them.

Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: To buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is from the village of Francfort, Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur. She is 33 years old. Josephine is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, coffee in sachets and chocolate drinks in sachets in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and build working capital. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia L. is from the village of Pangalalan. She is 42 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of products in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Maria Bertha

texts.es:
María Bertha es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el Anexo San Luis, una zona agrícola que pertenece al distrito de La Victoria, una de las zonas mas pobladas de la provincia de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. Ella suele criar aves de corral y las vende sacrificadas semanalmente entre sus vecinos y los pobladores del distrito que van hacia el mercado. El negocio le sirve para apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. 

María desea realizar algunos arreglos en su domicilio de modo que ella y su familia puedan vivir de mejor modo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles. 

María es una mujer entregada a su familia y que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
María Bertha is a 39 year-old mother who lives with her husband and three children in San Luis, an agricultural area of La Victoria district, one of the most densely-populated districts of Chiclayo province.

María raises and sells young animals.  She usually raises poultry and then every week she sells them, already slaughtered, to her neighbors and residents of the district who come to the market.  Her business helps her to support her husband with the family's finances.

María would like to carry out some home repairs so that she and her family can live better.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

María is a woman who is committed to her family and who has a great desire to get ahead in life.  People who know her consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy woman.

loans.use: To carry out some home repairs

loans.name: Marjorie Del Rocio

texts.es:
Marjorie de 33 años, inicio hace 10 años con la papelería para poder ayudar con los gastos de su familia, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos pudo completar el dinero para ubicar su pequeña papelería readecuo su casa y la ubico en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Viviendo con su esposo que es artesano y sus dos hijos de 12 y 5 años en el suburbio de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales ha podido incrementa su mercadería en la papelería. Ella vende papeles, cuadernos, juguetes, plumas etc. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días  con ayuda de su mama. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y vitrinas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere amplia su negocio incluyendo mercadería.
texts.en:
Marjorie is 33 years old.  She set up her stationery store 10 years ago so that she could help with her family's expenses.  She started by selling exercise books, pens and paper to her neighbors and acquaintances.  She was able to make enough money to set up a small stationery store and so she adapted her home and installed it in the front part of her home.

Marjorie lives with her husband, who is a craftsman, and her two children aged 12 and 5, in the suburb of Guayaquil, an area which is noted for the fact that most of its residents are informal salespeople.  Marjorie has been able to increase the merchandise in her stationery store.  She sells paper, exercise books, toys, pens, etc.  She works from 7.00am to 9.00pm every day with the help of her mom.

Marjorie will use her loan to buy exercise books, pens and display cases for her business.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and sell more goods.

loans.use: To buy stationery, pens and exercise books

loans.name: Samwel Odhiambo

texts.en:
For the last eight years, Samuel has been in the mining business in Naivasha town. He is 51 years old and is married to Pamella Akinyi. They have six school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend who is a member of KADET. This will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to employ more labor and buy working tools. 

In the future, Samuel hopes to purchase a lorry to transport his products to the market.

loans.use: To hire labor and buy working tools

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long V., age 50, is married with three children; two are married and one attends school. She is a local farmer as well as a domestic rice trader who owns a rice hulling machine inside her home. She provides a rice milling service to her neighbors for a fee. Her husband works with her in the business. Long V. usually generates around $3 profit per day to meet her family's needs. The harvest season is coming and she always gets orders from her clients to mill their rice; however, her old hulling machine is getting old and it often breaks while providing service. To solve this problem, Long V. would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy a new hulling machine to replace the old one.

loans.use: to buy a new hulling machine to replace the old one

loans.name: Set Mot Group

texts.en:
Aminata K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aminata was born in Yele village 36 years ago. She is married to a civil servant and the couple has five children, four of whom are attending primary schools and one in secondary school. For four years now, Aminata has been selling groundnuts, rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc. 

This is the first loan that Aminata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve on their living conditions. 

Aminata will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leone leones) to expand her business; she will buy groundnuts, rice and palm oil on a wholesale basis to add to her business.

loans.use: Buy groundnuts, rice and palm oil wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Oscar Javier

texts.es:
Oscar , es un joven de 24 años de edad , soltero,nacido en el departamento de Esteli.De oficio mecanico,inicio a la edad de 18 años en el negocio de la mecanico y que lo ha tenido  por tradicion pues su padre es mecanico tambien . El empezo a trabajar de lleno en un taller familiar motivado por buscar el progreso inicio con la ayuda de su  padre a luchar por sacar adelante su taller,asi mismo ha tenido la iniciativa como comerciante ya que tambien se dedica a la compra y venta de motocicletas.Su taller se encuentra ubicado en la parte central de Esteli donde mas afluencia de clientes hay .
El solicita el credito para capital de trabajo ,y que con esto podra mejorara sus ingresos atraves de la ventas de repuestos de motocicleta. Su meta es obtener un negocio propio , especializado en venta de repuestos nuevos de motocicletas ubicado en los puntos centrales de Esteli para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Oscar is a young man who is 24 years of age.  He is single and was born in the Department of Esteli.  He is a mechanic by trade and started working in a repair shop at the age of 18.  Oscar follows in the tradition of his father, who also worked as a mechanic.  He began working in the family repair shop and was motivated to find success.  With the help of his father, Oscar was able to press forward to succeed in this trade.  At the same time, he is a merchant who buys and sells motorcycles.  The family repair shop is located in the central part of Esteli where there are many customers.  

The loan he is requesting will be used as operating capital.  This will help improve his earnings through the sale of motorcycle parts.  Oscar’s goal is to have his own business that specializes in the sales of new motorcycle parts and have it centrally located in Esteli so that he can increase his sales.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle parts to sell

loans.name: Nehemiah

texts.en: Nehemiah is a 24-year-old businessman who runs a retail shop. He is also employed as a driver. Nehemiah has been operating his business for two years. He decided to employ two people to run his business as he works as a driver. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to run his business well because he has been trained in business record keeping. He has requested a loan of 35,000 KES to buy a refrigerator, cooking fat, sugar and soap.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, cooking fat, sugar and soap

loans.name: Zoila María

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila T. es socia del banco comunal Tocte, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre y  pertenece a la parroquia de Jadan,   su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en artesanías, cuenta con hermosos paisajes, su gente es amable y cordial.

La Señora. Zoila tiene 50 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 23, 20, 19, 15 y 10 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y el ayudan económicamente, su cuarto hijo pasa en la casa y es quien le ayuda a cultivar la tierra y su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora como albañil, con el sacrificio de los dos han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Zoila se dedica a la agricultura,  siembra hortalizas y verduras las que son para su consumo y para la venta, también cría animales como: pollos y chanchos.

Se encuentra en su sexto crédito los mismos que le han permitido crecer en la cría de animales y con este nuevo crédito va ha comprar mas chanchos. Su meta es  construir un reservorio de agua y terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Zoila T. is a member of the Tocte community bank.  She lives in the community of Tocte, in Jadan parish.  People in this area raise animals and farm crops.  Many are craftspeople.  The area has beautiful landscapes and the local people are kind and friendly.

Zoila is 50 years old, married, and has 5 children aged 23, 20, 19, 15 and 10.  Her three eldest children work and help her financially.  Her fourth child is at home and helps her cultivate her land.  Her youngest child attends a local school.  Her husband is a construction worker.  With a lot of sacrifice, the two of them have managed to build their own home.

Zoila is a farmer.  She grows greens and vegetables for her own consumption and to sell.  She also raises animals such as chickens and pigs.

This is Zoila's sixth loan.  Her previous loans have allowed her to grow in her animal-raising business and she will use this new loan to buy more pigs.  Her goal is to build a water reservoir and to finish off her house.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Rajeshwori

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Rajeshwori M.. She is married and has 2 children aged 11 and 7. In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and vegetables. In the future, Rajeshwori plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.
