With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Chean

texts.en: Chean O. is a 38-year-old married woman who resides in the province of Siem Reap. To earn a living, she and her husband often take her boat to the middle part of Tunle Sap River in order to catch fish, spending at least eight hours per day. After fishing, they take all the fresh fish to sell at retail to people who come to buy anything in the market. From this business, they can earn around $7 a day to use for the family’s expenses. Currently, her boat is so small and is getting so old that it is an obstacle that affects their fishing activity. In order to make more revenue, Chean O. is seeking a loan to buy a new big boat for fishing.

loans.use: To buy a new big boat for fishing.

loans.name: Diana Maritza

texts.es:
La Señora. Diana G. es socia del banco comunal El Aguacate, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre del banco comunal en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida como Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, por su belleza colonia que fue nombrada en 1999  patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy cálida y amable.

Doña Diana tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad que estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en una fábrica de bloques y almacenamiento de madera, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa prestada.

La Señora. Diana se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la venta de ropa, ella les vende  a sus vecinos y personas conocidas.

Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería como: ropa de niños, pantalones, camisetas, blusas, etc. para surtir su negocio.

Su meta es sacar adelante a su hijo para que tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Diana G. is a member of El Aguacate community bank.  She lives in the community of El Aguacate, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is also known as Santa Ana de los Cuatro Ríos (Saint Anne of the Four Rivers).  It was named a World Heritage Site in 1999 because of its colonial beauty.  Its people are very warm and kind.

Diana is 24 years old, married, and has one 7 year-old son who attends a local elementary school.  Her husband works in a brick factory / wood warehouse.  They don't own their own home but live in a borrowed house.

Diana does her housework and also sells clothes.  She sells to her neighbors and acquaintances.

This is the third loan that Diana has accessed through her community bank.  She will invest it in buying merchandise such as children's clothes, pants, t-shirts, blouses, etc. to stock her business.

Diana's goal is to get her son ahead in life so that he can enjoy a better future.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes, blouses, pants, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: El señor Víctor Hugo es abogado y trabaja en un estudio jurídico. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de libros de leyes los que le ayudaran mucho para desempeñar con mayor eficiencia su trabajo. Vive en anticretico con sus padres en una casa ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos. Victo Hugo es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006 y se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron.
texts.en:
Sr. Victor Hugo is an attorney who works at a law practice. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy law books that will help him develop greater efficiency in his work. He lives with his parents in an “anticrético” rental house that is located in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. Victor Hugo is single and has no children.

He has been a client of IMPRO since 2006 and is very satisfied with the loans that have been granted to him.

loans.use: to purchase law books for his job as an attorney.

loans.name: María Vicenta

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Las Cumpliditas, vive por el sector de San Joaquín, este sector es conocido por la producción de hortalizas y verduras, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, tiene varios lugares para deleitar su rica gastronomía.
 
Doña María tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 25, 23, 21 y 19 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segundo hijo es casado e independiente y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la área de la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.

La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de hortalizas hace varios años, cuenta con un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad, labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes que son para su consumo y para la venta.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito  y lo va a invertir en la compra de hortalizas para crecer en el negocio.

Su sueño  es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Señora María is a member of the Las Cumpliditas (Little Bouquets) communal bank. She lives in the San Joaquín sector. This sector is known for the production of garden produce and vegetables. Her people maintain their culture and traditions. San Joaquín has several places which provide delight with tasty cuisine.

Doña María is 45 years old and married. She has 4 children, ages 25, 23, 21, and 19. Her eldest daughter works and helps with expenses. Her eldest son is married and independent, and her two youngest children study at a high school in the city. Her husband works as a construction worker. Working together, they have built their own house.

For several years, Señora. María has sold vegetables. She has her own stall at a market in the city and works seven days a week without a fixed schedule. At home, she raises chickens and guinea pigs for her family’s consumption and for sale.

This is the second loan she has had in the communal bank, and she will invest it in the purchase of vegetables so that she can increase her business. Her dream is to not have any debts.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel tiene 26 años, es soltera vive con la madre y un hijo, vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SANTA ROSA DE AGUA CLARA, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 20 socios es el segundo crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao y yuca, además se dedican al comercio.

Maria se dedica al comercio tiene un restaurante de comida. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de frutas, verduras y tipos de carnes, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado los ingresos y existe los suficientes alimentos para cocinar. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y la competencia. Su sueño es trabajar y salir adelante.

Le gusta ayudar a su madre en la casa.
texts.en:
María Isabel is 26 years old, single and living with her mother and son in Agua Clara which is part of Chillanes Canton.

The “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara” communal bank is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  It has 20 members and this is the second loan they’ve requested from the Cooperative.  The members of this communal bank farm cocoa beans and manioc and also are merchants.

María has a merchant; she has a food restaurant.  Her purchases take place in Chillanes and San Pablo and sales occur at the Chillanes Sunday Farmers Market.

The loan will help her buy fruit, vegetables and types of meat.  The loan has helped her increase crop production.  She has faced challenges like illness of the laborers and competence.  

Her dream is to work and to get ahead.  She likes to help her mother around the house.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and all kinds of meat.

loans.name: Ashetu

texts.en: In the picture above Ashetu is in the process of preparing millet porridge for sale. She is married and has three children. Her husband is into carpentry. Ashetu assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more millet to prepare porridge for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more millet to prepare porridge for sale.

loans.name: Karambenor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03 juin 2010. Il  est  constitué de cinq femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Mariama qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge cinq autres enfants confiés par ses parents.
Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en: This community group was created on the 3rd June 2010, and is made up of five women who live in the same quarter. They are all owners of small businesses. Madame Mariama (on the right of the photo with her hand raised) is the group leader. She is a 42 year-old married mother of eight, and looks after another five children. She has sold vegetables for a living for several years. This loan will enable her to boost her working capital and to better develop her business. The profits generated will enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food and clothing etc.) and to increase her level of savings.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Muhwezi

texts.en:
Muhwezi is a 40-year-old married man with five children. He lives in his own house in Kamwenge, Uganda.

He has been trading in coffee for eight years and he is happy with the proceeds despite the challenge of limited funds. His desire is to own a coffee store that supplies the whole region. Muhwezi needs the loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: To buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Fideliz

texts.en:
Fideliz is 33 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling "nipa" in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like bamboo, nipa, etc. for her business.

Fideliz has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the "nipa" (palm frond mats used in construction) for five years and also earns an income from a general store.

Fideliz aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional materials like bamboo, nipa (palm frond for mats) etc. for her business

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is 36 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children. All of his children are currently in school. Muhammad has a business of a small retail shop that sells motorcycle spare parts that he has had for five years.         

To help expand his business, Muhammad has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase motorcycle spare parts for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Muhammad hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Muhammad hopes to expand his business. Muhammad is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program (SEP), which has helped his future prospects by improving his capital.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Aminata.  She is married and has no children.   

 In 2006; Aminata established her ready-made clothing business. She began her business because she had gained experience from her mother and she wanted to be independant. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 950,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Aminata has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional bedspreads and baby pants, etc. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. 

In the future, Aminata plans to complete her building and to develop her business.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for additional ready-made clothing for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing notions

loans.name: Niñas Bonitas Group

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe es una joven integrante del grupo tiene 33 años, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos, Ruben y Valeria que estudian, a los cuales quiere mucho y son su mayor motivacion para salir adelante. Con mucho empeño Maria Guadalupe logro hacerse de un establecimiento, en donde se dedica a la venta de paletas heladas y gelatinas; con el dinero que gana puede surtir mas producto y tener mas variedad. A ella le gusta vender  este tipo de productos ya que sabe que a los niños les encantan y en tiempo de calor los refresca mucho. Ella escogio esta actividad, ya que penso que era una buena idea  para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos economicos y la educacion de sus hijos.

Una de las metas de Maria Guadalupe es ampliar mas su local para poner su negocio mas a la vista y de esa manera llamar mas la atencion y atraer mas clientela.

Niñas Bonitas es un grupo solidario compuesto por ocho mujeres muy unidas las cuales se encuentran en su primer ciclo; sus reuniones estan ubicadas en la colonia San Miguel, en el Municipio General Escobedo. Ellas decidieron ponerle ese nombre al grupo, ya que se sienten muy identificadas con el. En el grupo la mayoria de las mujeres se dedican con mucho esfuerzo al comercio de ropa, joyeria, snacks, etc, para asi poder ayudar a sus familias con los gastos en el hogar.

Maria Guadalupe conoce a las integrantes del grupo y sabe que son mujeres de palabra, inteligentes, emprendedoras, luchadoras, y sobre todo responsables.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe is a young woman of age 33 who is part of a communal group.  She is married and has 2 children; Ruben and Valeria who are in school.  She loves them both and they are her greatest motivation to succeed.  With a lot of effort, Maria Guadalupe was able to obtain en establishment where she sells popsicles and gelatin.  With the money earned she is able to stock more product and have more variety.  She likes to sell these types of products since she knows that kids love them and it cools them off during hot weather.  She chose this business because she thought it would be a good idea to help her husband with expenses and with their kids education.

One of Maria Guadalupe's goals is to expand her store so it is in plain view and this way attract more attention to it and bring more customers in. 

Niñas Bonitas ( Pretty Girls ) is a communal group made up of 8 women who are very united and this is their first term as a group; their meetings are held in San Miguel, a General Escobedo municipality. They decided their group to have this name since they feel they identify with it very well.  The majority in the group work hard selling: clothes, jewels, snacks, etc., and this way they can help their families with household expenses.

Maria Guadalupe knows the women in the group and knows they are women of their word, intelligent, entrepreneurial, fighters, and overall responsible.

loans.use: to expand the store and stock up on merchandise ( popsicles and gelatin ).

loans.name: Oyunjargal

texts.en: Oyunjargal has been running her tailoring business successfully. Now she desires to expand her business by enlarging the workplace and number of workers. She is requesting a loan to purchase a new multiple-operation sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a new multiple-operation sewing machine.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 39 years old and is a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Janet, who is employed. They are blessed with one child, aged three years. He has been in the farming business for the past eleven years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Charles will use the loan to buy fertilizer and maize seedlings for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. 

He hopes to buy a pickup and a piece of land to build rental houses, which will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 55 years old, married and has three children.  He does quarrying to earn a living.  He has been in the business for six years and has employed two people.  Besides quarrying, he practices dairy farming to earn extra income.  He has grown his business through Faulu Kenya.  This has helped him to educate his children.

Simon has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mutambo Shg Group

texts.en:
Fred is the facilitator of the Mutambo group. Fred and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Fred is a father of four children. He joined One Acre Fund to have One Acre Fund’s best prices and to have additional maize profits to educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Fred had an excellent maize yield harvesting 17 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Fred was only able to harvest two bags of maize on one acres of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Fred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Fred will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In the picture the field officer is pictured standing on the far left and Fred is pictured with his group members.

In 2012, the members of Mutambo SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Melchora provides manicure and pedicure services. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy materials needed to provide those services.

Melchora has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Melchora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for manicures and pedicures

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира жительница района Конибодом. Возраст, 51 лет. Замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Она имеет среднее образование. Более тридцати лет занимается скотоводством. Она в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Nazira is a resident of the Konibodom region. She is 51 years old, married and has one child. She has secondary education. Nazira has been doing animal husbandry for more than thirty years. She mainly feeds and sells cattle. She is taking out the loan to buy several heads of large horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy several heads of large horned cattle.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE TUPAC AMARU;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Florencia;  La socia tiene 45 años de edad, La socia es casada, La socia tiene 3 hijos de 24, 22, 18 meses; La socia trabaja comprando y vendiendo ropa, zapatillas, zapatos; la socia viaja a Tacna para traer su mercadería, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de ropa y zapatos y en su viaje; la socia viajara para la ciudad de Tacna y traerá ropa al por mayor, zapatos aprovechando la navidad y que sus amistades y clientas le han hecho pedidos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa y zapatos.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Florencia, 45, is a member of the “Virgen Purificada de Tupac Amaru” communal bank located in Urcos District in Quispicanchis Province and Cusco Department.

She is married and has three children who are 24, 22 years and 18 months old.  She works as a clothing, sandal and shoe merchant.  She travels to Tacna to get her merchandise.  She wants the loan to buy clothes and shoes and to pay for her trip.  She will travel to Tacna and will buy clothes and shoes at wholesale taking advantage of Christmas because her acquaintances and customers have placed orders with her.  She is asking for the loan to buy clothes and shoes.

She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Josefa del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 3 años. El crédito que solicita es de temporada; ya que necesita invertir en pollo, gaseosas, cervezas, jugos y chiverías  que es lo que más se mueve en esta época. 
Ella es madre soltera tiene un pequeño por el cual trabaja arduamente.
texts.en: Josefa del Carmen is a hardworking, enterprising woman who has been selling food for three years.  The loan she requests is seasonal since she needs to buy chicken, soft-drinks, beer, juice and snacks which are what sells the most during this season.  She is a single mother and has a little one that she works hard for.

loans.use: to buy chicken, soft-drinks, juice, snacks, liquor, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 28 years old and single. To earn a living, he runs a butcher shop. He has been in the business for 4 years and has employed one person. Through Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business and save his money. He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future. He has requested for 50,000 KES to buy meat.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Srun's Group

texts.en:
Srun who is 49 years old and married is the breadwinner of a big family with ten children in a village of the Sa Ang district of Cambodia. She and her husband have struggled to earn income to feed their big family by growing vegetables as their only source of income. They have been in this business for 24 years. 

Srun has been with VisionFund since 2009 and the loans from the past two years have helped her feed her family regularly. With good businesses, Srun and the other three group members, who have just joined and who have been with VisionFund for from one to five years, are applying for a loan. As the leader of the group, Srun will use the entire loan of US$250 to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her grow vegetables successfully and also increase her welfare.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Nisha is 33 years-old. She is married and has two children aged 13 and 8. In 2004, she established her tailoring business. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loans from Patan BPW and used it to buy raw materials for her business.  In the future, Nisha plans to improve the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buys raw materials for her business

loans.name: Hakilignouma 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   Hakilignouma 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Kemeni, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec   KIYA, debout en Tshirt rouge sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,75 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 225.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The ten members of the Hakilignouma 2 Group are married women with an average age of 44 and five children.  They all live in traditional families in Kemeni, one of the villages in San, the 4th largest administrative region in Mali.  They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organization to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season.  They are on their second loan; their past loans were fully repaid.  Rice is the crop grown by Kiya, standing in the red t-shirt in the photo.  With her loan, she plans to buy fertilizers and seeds, as well as pay the cost of labor for maintaining 1.75 hectares.  The harvest will be sold in the village as well as at the San market to a clientele of resellers and consumers.  She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 225,000 FCFA per season.  This profit will enable her to repay her loan as well as help her husband in their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
For cultural reasons Wafaa chose not to appear in the picture, so her husband is standing in for her.

Wafaa is 24 years old and a mother of 3 children.

Wafaa and her husband Abdullah borrowed money from friends to open their own business, which is soft drinks distribution. As the business grows, Wafaa decided to take a loan to buy a rickshaw to increase the distribution.

Her future goal is to buy a big car.

Wafaa's biggest challenges is the lack of gasoline and goods because of the siege on Gaza.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw for goods distribution

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL JEHOVA ES MI PASTOR ESTA CONFORMADA POR DIEZ INTEGRANTES MADRES SOLTERAS CON VEINTE HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSBILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIAS DE MALPAISILLO Y SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLE CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR EN LA ACTULIDAD LUCHAN PARA BRINDARLES UN FUTURO MEJOR A SUS HIJOS, COMO ES SUS ESTUDIOS, Y UNA VIVIENDA, ESTABILIDAD EMOCIONAL Y ECONOMICA.

GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ESA AUDELIS Y TIENE PORA ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA UNA PULPERIA ES UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES COMO : ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZUCAR, LECHE, PAN, HUEVOS, JUGOS, DETERGENTES, GALLETAS ETC. EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION, ELLA DEDICA A SU ACTIVIDAD UNA DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES, Y EN UN FUTURO OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. EL OBJETIVO SURTIR SU PULPERIA CON PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES, JEHOVA ES MI PASTOR AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Jehova Es Mi Pastor communal bank has ten members, who are single mothers caring for twenty children in total. They all come from Malpaisillo and are hard-working and responsible, and they want to improve themselves. Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources, they were unable to study and had to work to help with household expenses. They are now working to provide their children with a better future, including their studies, a home and emotional and financial stability.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Audelys, who earns money from a grocery store. This is a small shop that sells food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, juice, detergent, biscuits, etc. Her business is located in the house where she lives. She works there for twelve hours per day, offering her products to meet her customers' demands and to obtain a higher income in future. Her aim is to supply her grocery store with food products. Jehova Es Mi Pastor thanks Kiva users for helping people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to have a decent working environment.

loans.use: to supply her grocery store with rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, corn, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina’s business is cosmetics sales by catalogue and she has 5 years of experience in this activity. She is married, her husband is a bricklayer, and they have four sons. Because these sons are all young, family expenses are high and Marina decided to help her husband by starting her business.

A friend of Marina's invited her five years ago to start her business and now she is seeing the results of her sales. If she invites other people who want to be in cosmetics sales into her business she can earn a little bit more money.

Marina comments that she has to be prepared for this season and for this reason she needs a loan of US$ 925 to invest in her business. She will purchase merchandise and believes that her sales will increase by 50%

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Marina se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo, tiene 5 años de experiencia en esta actividad, esta casada, su esposo es obrero y tiene 4 hijos. Todos sus hijos son menores, por lo que los gastos familiares son altos, es por eso que decidido apoyar a su esposo y tomo la decisión vender cosméticos, una amiga la invito y a 5 años ahora ve los resultados gana por sus ventas y si ingresa personas que también quieran iniciar en las ventas gana un poco mas. Comenta que se tiene que preparar para la temporada de Diciembre, es por este motivo que necesita un préstamo pues la mercancía la tiene que comprar de contado y ella tiene que fiar a los clientes por lo que ocupa un crédito por la cantidad de $925 a 6 meses. Con esta inversión sus ventas podrán mejorar hasta en un 50% e igual sus ganancias, además contar con muy buen inventario para ofrecer a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ysutor

texts.en: Y. sells items such as tomatoes, peppers, smoked fish, tinned tomatoes, corn and cassava dough, and so on. She wants to expand her sales and therefore seeks a loan of $800 from Kiva to enable her open a mini market.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Naomi would like to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Mrs. Ngozi E. is 29 years old, married with four children, and hails from Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She sells cooked food and provisions to her community. She is requesting a loan of $ 625 to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and food ingredients

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old. He has a welding shop in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1000 to purchase a new welding machine. He has a big family, and he is the only one responsible for supporting them. He wants to develop his shop and increase his income. At the same time, he wants to hire two unemployed people to work with him.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new welding machine

loans.name: Luis Edison

texts.es:
Luis is a very hard working and entrepreneurial 24-year-old. He has worked hard since he was a boy to help his mother. He will soon complete a chef's certification from a prestigious cooking school and hopes some day to attend university. In the meantime he runs several businesses--one selling firewood and another raising guinea pigs for meat. Luis is asking for a loan of $300 to expand these businesses and achieve financial stability so he can some day provide for a family. Let's help this young entrepreneur carry out his plans.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Luis es un joven de 24 años, diligente que ha sabido trabajar desde muy niño ayudando a su madre y que hoy ha decidido emprender su propio centro de ocupación dedicándose a la crianza de cuyes y a la venta de leña.Actividad con la cual se auto educa y gracias a su desempeño está a punto de terminar su carrera de chef en un prestigioso instituto y mantiene latente aún la esperanza de cursar estudios superiores en una universidad sin descuidar sus proyectos de negocio.Podemos observar a un joven que como pocos progresa a su corta edad y cada día tiene nuevos proyectos que anhela realizar, requiere de 300 dólares para poder ampliar su granja y deposito de leña y apela a su buen corazón para poder incrementar su capital para que con el tiempo obtenga estabilidad económica y pueda ofrecer lo mejor de sí a su familia cuando decida conformarla..Ayudemos a este joven empresario a poder realizar sus proyectos de vida.

loans.use: To finance raising guinea pigs and firewood sales.

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en: Itagia is a self-employed, single lady from the village of Vavau.  Her business is a retail shop that is located in her village.  Itagia has chosen to do this business because she experienced that there are not that many shops in her village, and so, with her coming into the market, there will be good competition.  Her business has become really successful that she is now making a clear profit of 600 Tala ($240 USD) a week.  Itagia will continue with her business and aims to keep offering better prices and the best service to her customers.  With her requested loan, she wants to restock her shop because she believes that there will be more customers during Christmas and New Year’s time.

loans.use: To buy inventory to restock her shop

loans.name: Lidia Evangelina

texts.es:
Lidia Mendoza is the mother of two kids who are 15 and 8. Unfortunately, she was widowed some time ago, and she was left to care for her children, especially the one who has cerebral palsy. She needs to give him all of her support and to pay for his treatments and therapies. This is why she does extra work cleaning houses and sells shoes in the afternoons.

However, the roof is failing in the place where she sells shoes, and her products will soon be unprotected. This is why she is requesting a credit of $1,125, which she is willing to repay in 6 months. With this money, she will be able to buy a used motorcycle so a family member can help her collect from her clients, and she will also buy more merchandise so she can have a better cash flow for her business. With your help, Lidia will be able to pay her children's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Lidia Mendoza madre de dos hijos uno de 15 y otro de 8, desgraciadamente Lidia quedó viuda hace tiempo, y ella quedó a cargo de sus hijos, en especial el que tiene parálisis cerebral, a quien necesita darle todo el apoyo además de costearle los gastos de sus tratamientos y terapias, Fue por eso que extra a los trabajos que realiza limpiando casas, por las tardes vende zapatos.

Sin embargo el lugar en el que vende sus zapatos se está cayendo el techo y sus productos se van a quedar desprotegidos. Es por eso que Lidia está solicitando un crédito de US $1,125 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar una motocicleta de segunda que un familiar le podrá ayudar a cobrar todos los pedidos que le hicieron, además de comprar más mercancía y así tener mayor flujo de dinero en su negocio. Con tu ayuda Lidia podrá pagar los gastos de sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to be able to collect from her clients and to buy merchandise

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: Mrs. Chim S., age 37, works selling fish, making on average around $5.30 each day in revenue. Her husband (pictured,  as she was not available at the time) works as a fisherman making around $3.30 per day from selling his fish to the people in his community. They have two children who are too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to expand her inventory of fish to meet her growing customer demands, and the leftover of the money will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of fish.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca was a little girl when she began to learn about sales. In the city where she was born she used to sell chicha to help in her home. One she married, it was necessary to have income, so she opened a convenience store. She began little by little, with whatever she could buy to supply her store. So, with hard wrok, she was able to stock her store with a variety of products. She has since moved to a new locale, which was good for her, her family, and her business now is in its own locale and she doesn’t have to pay rent for a space. Now her store also has a bakery and small bazaar. She always has customers, and she has a dream with two her children of turning their great store in to a minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Desde muy pequeña Francisca aprendió lo concerniente a las ventas. En su pueblo natal ella solía vender chicha para ayudar en su hogar. Una vez que se casó, la necesidad de contar con un ingreso fue más grande, lo cual la convenció de abrir una bodega. Fue empezando poco a poco, con lo único que podía comprar para abastecer a su tienda. Así, con su empeño, logro que su tienda este bien surtida de diversos productos. Hasta que llego el momento de mudarse a vivir en otro lado. Lo que fue bueno para ella, para su familia y para su negocio también pues ahora contaba con un local propio y no debía pagar renta por uno alquilado. Ahora su bodega se ha complementado con una panadería y un pequeño bazar. Los clientes nunca le faltan, pero el sueño de ella y de sus dos hijos es convertir su gran bodega en un minimarket.

loans.use: Convert a convenience store to a minimarket

loans.name: Meyling Lissette

texts.es:
Meyling Lissette Martínez is a strong person who dedicates herself to the selling of hardware from her own business located in her home in the Villanueva area of Chinandega.

One of Meyling’s urgent needs is obtain the resources to buy inventory for her hardware store and therefore she is seeking support from Ceprodel for a loan that would enable her to buy these product and thereby improve her family’s standard of living. She had loans a year ago with Ceprodel that have been repaid in a satisfactory manner according to the terms of her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La dama Meyling Lissette Martínez es una persona muy esforzada que se dedica al negocio de la venta de productos de ferretería teniendo su propio establecimiento en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Villanueva de Chinandega.

Una de las necesidades que la señora Meyling atraviesa es la urgencia de adquirir recursos económicos para la compra de productos ferreteros es por este motivo que ella busca apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan la compra de estos productos y así mejorar la condición de vida de su familia. Actualmente ella tiene créditos desde hace un año con Ceprodel habiéndolos cancelado satisfactoriamente según lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for hardware store

loans.name: Bella Judith

texts.es:
The lady Bella belongs to “Las Shipibas” Communal Bank located on Jr. Guillermo Skylights Mz. 189 Lt. 10 of the District of Yarina Cocha of the Department of Ucayali. She is 38 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a machine operator, but the income that he has does not meet their daily needs, so Bella decided to invest in a food sales business with the first loan of 300 soles received from Manuela Branches.

Currently Bella is dedicated to domestic work and the preparation of her foods in the mornings. In the afternoon she leaves to sell her foods in the different zones of our city and at night she rests for the next day’s work.

With this loan of 1,800 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy: 1 bag of rice, meats, sugar, vegetables, seasonings, oil, salt, eggs, carbonated water, etc.

Bella says that the loans are a big help, because they permit her to grow her business and to give a better education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bella pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Jr. Guillermo Lumbreras Mz. 189 Lt.10, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es operador de maquinas, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Bella con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de comida.

En la actualidad Bella por las mañanas se dedica a las labores domesticas y preparación de sus comidas, en las tardes sale a vender sus comidas en las diferentes zonas de nuestra cuidad, y por las noches descansa para la jornada del día siguiente.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, carnes, azúcar, verduras, condimentos, aceite, sal, huevos, gaseosas, etc.

Bella dice que los prestamos son una buena ayuda, porque le permiten crecer en su negocio y darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy rice, meats, sugar, vegetables, seasonings, oil, salt, eggs, carbonated water, etc.  for the preparation of foods for sale.

loans.name: Usha

texts.en: Usha S. lives in a single family home with her husband and son in Kulashwor, Kathmandu. Her son is studying in primary school. Kulashwor is one of the developing towns in Kathmandu. The demand for sweet foods is increasing because Nepal is rich in festivals. People need sweets to celebrate the festivals. Mr. and Mrs. S. are engaged in their own sweet shop. They produce a variety of sweet items for their shop. So Mrs. S. is requesting Rs 15000.00 to buy various types of food materials to prepare sweets for their business.

loans.use: Usha would like to buy various types of food materials to prepare sweets for her business.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
B. Gulchehra is 40 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three school agechildren. Her husband is a taxi driver. Despite of her lack of education she has been running her own business for seven years. Gulchehra is a market vendor. She sells kids clothing in the local market. Being hard-working and polite by her nature she has managed to obtain a clientele that is happy with her goods and services. The business is successful and generates stable income for the family. Gulchehra loves her children very much and she wants all of them to be well-educated. With this purpose she wants to send all of her children to university after finishing school.       
Today Gulchehra requests $600 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. She plans to use the loan to purchase new summer clothing. She hopes to raise her income to support her elder son university tuition, as he finished high school this year. Gulchehra expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan in time. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live.

loans.use: To purchase kids clothing to increase inventory
